story:
Help us turn environmental activism into a game that kids will love to play, while learning about marine life and tangible things they can do to save our global oceans.

Coral reefs around the world are disappearing at an alarming rate.  That’s a big problem, because coral reefs are the rainforests of the oceans.  Although coral reefs cover only 0.1% of the ocean surface, they are homes to approximately one quarter (25%) of all sea life!  So if there are no more coral reefs, the entire marine ecosystem will be severely affected. 

The thing is, the major reasons coral reefs are dying--things like global warming and ocean acidification--seem to be such huge and insurmountable problems that most people get overwhelmed and give up.  But you know who doesn’t think like that?  Our young people!  Today’s children and youth are more aware of global environmental issues than any previous generation, and they still have the energy, the enthusiasm, and the sincere belief that they can do something to fix the problems.  As connected and networked as they all are, adolescents know that even small actions can have a giant impact--as long as you get thousands or millions of people to work together. 

Healing Oceans Together is one youth organization with that kind of vision.  We are young teens (and our families) who want to engage our peers around the world in working together to save our oceans.  So we thought, what could we do to reach the whole world with our message?  What can we do differently to inspire other kids to change their behavior for the benefit of the oceans when there is already a ton of information out there on this issue? 

Then we had a brainstorm.  What do kids really love to do?  They love to PLAY GAMES!  What if we made saving the oceans into a game? 

We planned for the rules of the game to model mathematics and science of an ecosystem. The artwork itself will use crochet, origami and other mathematically rich media to model surfaces and shapes. This invites students developing or playing the game to engage with many types of modeling and design.

So here is our idea in more detail.  We want to make a trading card game like... well, we won’t mention the name because we don’t want get into copyright infringement, but it rhymes with “smokeynon.”  Our cards will have points and powers and fun stuff like that, but it will be based on REAL marine life and the ways they actually win or lose in the game of Survivor played in the oceans every day!  And part of the game will include the things we do as individuals that effect the ocean in either a positive or negative way.  So you’ll get negative points for leaving the lights on all night while you are asleep or driving someplace that you could walk to, or positive points for planting a vegetable garden or for choosing a homemade lunch over going out for a fast food meal. 

We have an opportunity to work with many excellent professional science and math educators and game designers, so we already have some ideas about how the game will look and play - check them out!  And here is the next radical part of our plan.  We want to have the largest possible impact, right?  So we want thousands or millions of people to be playing our game all over the world.  Therefore, we are committed to designing our game and our cards under a Creative Commons license and to making them available for anyone to download for FREE!   Free is always good, right?  Free is the way we think we can make the largest possible difference.

So here is what we’ve got in place:

  • a group of highly committed young teens, with support from their families
  • a history of successful kid-friendly environmental awareness projects, including our Recycled Gifts Fair, our Great Sea Slug Beauty Contest, and our Craft Coral Reef (see our website at http://healingoceanstogether.wordpress.com/ for more information on these projects)
  • a network of supporters around the world
  • access to large numbers of peers and collaborators, ranging in age from preschooler through teenagers, who will help us to test and fine tune our game
  • connections with a university research program that will assist with our game development and distribution
  • connections with professional scientists, mathematicians, artists, and game developers who will assist us in making the game fun, meaningful, and beautiful

 

We are willing to do all the game development work out of our own resources.  But here is where we need your financial support.  For this game to work, the science has got to be right.  We need to go and work with professional marine biologists to understand the intricate relationships between the different components of the coral reef ecosystem.  We need to go and observe coral reef life in action so that we can depict it realistically in  our game. 

We have an opportunity to do that by spending a week with coral reef researchers at VIERS--the Virgin Islands Environmental Research Station in Saint John’s Island in the Caribbean.  We will be studying with professional marine biologists and observing and capturing the images of the marine life to include in our game. 

So it is going to be really cool.  But don’t think we’re trying to get you to fund our vacation at a fancy resort.  VIERS is a working research facility set in a primitive location.  There’s no air conditioning, no warm showers, no WiFi and video games, no swimming pool and tiki bar.  It will just be us with the scientists, the natural environment, and the inhabitants of the coral reef. 

So, actually, we’re doing you a favor.  We’ll do all the sweating, hard work, and avoiding biting bugs and stinging jellyfish to bring you the world of the coral reefs on cards that you can play in the luxury of your own home, school, or workplace.  And playing the game promises to give you:

  • FUN (we all need more fun in our lives, don’t we?)
  • ENLIGHTENMENT (who knew all these tiny invertebrates would be so fascinating?)
  • MODELING (one of the key math and science literacies of our era)
  • INSPIRATION (little things that if we all do together could really help save the coral reefs from further destruction) and maybe even
  • HEALTHIER OCEAN ENVIRONMENTS

 

So please support our game development effort.  Maybe you can’t fly, or don’t have X-ray vision or extraordinary strength.  But if you help our efforts to find a fun way to save the vital ecology of the coral reefs, you’ll be a Super Hero to us... and to the other children who want the coral reefs to still be around by the time they are adults. 

And, of course, you’ll get cool Perks!  Check them out on the right hand side of the page.   Check out the photo gallery for samples of the crochet pieces that are part of our craft coral reef, and what you could receive as one of our perks!   If you would like to donate your perk to someone that would love to have it, we are willing to find just the right family to donate it to, and give you all the credit, of course.

story:
What is this project about?
     We hate waste. Each and everyday people discard plastic bottles into the environment. You can find plastic waste everywhere. Roadsides, the beach, even makes an Island in the middle of the Pacific Ocean. Instead of waste, we see an above ground mine ripe for processing. It is important to see how we can extract more of this valuable resource from the waste stream. We get plastics for oil and that has significant environmental and economic implications. Plastic waste is several times more valuable than metals such as steel. So why waste it!
    Plastics are difficult to recycle. Current recycling methods are complex and are not sustainable. Thus, I started tinkering to find out a more sustainable way to recycle plastic, and developed a breakthrough simple one-step process. Our recycling equipment can process all types of PET plastic  products: bottles and thermoforms. Then, the old stuff is made into new plastic products.

     We want to raise $5,000 to fund a full plastic recycling prototype with advance features to demonstrate  the new recycling concept. All proceeds will go towards testing the full prototype , and make a video to show its easy operation.

     ENAS is proud of its new plastic bottle recycling concept to convert waste beverage bottles into chips at collection point(s).   We hope this recycling initiative will help raise visibility about the importance of recycling with a goal to drive recycling rates up, and divert millions of plastic bottles from entering the waste steam and potentially into other plastic products.    
     The recycling equipment consist of Precision ovens and specially crystallization trays, where plastic bottles are melted and converted into to square chips to be latter used to make new plastic products. Capacity: about 1,000 empty bottles/day or 7.2 tons of plastic/yr. Ideal locations are those generating over a thousand containers/day: drop-off centers at Bottle Bill States, municipal convenience centers, schools, hotels, sport arenas, cruise ships, cafeterias, etc. ENAS' ovens reduce volume by 90%, lower disposal costs and produce quality valuable material.

     Who are we?
      ENAS is an emerging  plastic recycling company.  We are a small group of professionals living and working at western NC. We manage this project on our own with no government grants or subsidies.

     Why this project?
    Plastic is a valuable resource and should not be wasted. Increasing amounts of plastic waste cost us taxpayers billions of dollars/year to dispose at landfills. Landfills cost $1 million per acre per year, transportation over $45/ton, and litter clean up costs over $100/ton.  Of every 10 bottles made, 8 are disposed at landfills or thrown around.  Recycling in smaller amounts at point of collection reduces volume by 90%, reduces transportation costs, increases recycling rates and saves $ to  taxpayers by cost avoidance.

     Why now?
     The price of plastic is tied to the price of oil and gasoline. As price of gas goes up, the more we save. Recycling also reduces negative impacts on the environment; plastic does not decompose, lasting over 1,000 years. At North Carolina at least 90 % of the residents have access to some type of plastic recycling, but only recycles 18% of available PET bottles.
   
    Why us?
     We have the technical background to make this project a reality in early 2012. Its progress is monitored  by solid waste management organizations and entrepreneurial organizations such as 20/20 Tech, BRECK, Advantage West and Land-of-Sky.
     
                  Our brand new e-mail is ovenas@att.net. Contact us for more information.

                                            Donate to help the environment.
     


Technical Specifications:

     RPET= recycled polystyrene terephthalate.

     ENAS' precision ovens are safe and easy to operate. The glass window let you see the clear plastic material convert into strong white RPET right in front of you in less than 30 minutes. Uses 240 volts and has low energy consumption.

    Contact us at ovenas@att.net with questions or feel free to post at our website: http://www.plasticeans.co.

What We Need & What You Get

       $5,000 will cover the cost testing a new prototype and making a video showing that recycling at the point of collection in relatively small amounts is an easy, viable and cost-effective alternative to supplement existing practices,  Ms. Blanco has been founding the project to conduct preliminary activities, prototypes and beta testing. But, additional resources are needed until sufficient recycled material is produced to sustain the operation. Should our funding goals fall short, funds received will be used towards producing a community education booklet targeted to schoolchildren on how recycling helps maintain a healthy environment.

      To show how grateful we are for your participation in this noble cause, we offer unique perks at various levels:  $1,000- reading pad; $500- 8GB flash disk; $100- home made "Baklava" box; $50- carrying tote with recycle logo $20- your name plus names of other contributors in a large frame and prominently displayed at the Collection/Accumulation center, plus a thank you card. Our success will be due to the good folks who pass along this campaign to their friends and contacts. If you like what you see and decide to participate, just select the contribution that best suits you.

Other Ways You Can Help

     As always, we ask that you help us to spread the news in any way you can, by e-mail, social media or some good old gossip. Using the e-mail feature in the main page makes it real easy to send to friends. And don't forget to check on us regularly; we are updating our progress on a weekly basis.
    Remember, to preserve the environment and decrease plastic waste, send this notice to your contacts with similar ideas. Most people are interested in protecting the environment, but do not know how. It is easy:

                    REMOVE LABELS AND/OR CAP FROM PLASTIC CONTAINERS BEFORE DISPOSAL.

    Again, thanks for your support!

story:
Anisha, Mario, and a whole lot of poop.

Ever had diarrhea? Ugh, right? The stomach cramps, the sweating, the fever, the discomfort. Hopefully, you were able to cure the diarrhea and avoid repeat episodes. Not everyone is so fortunate, however. Nearly 400,000 children in India under the age of 5, most from poor families, die each year from diarrhea-related illness.

Everyone agrees that fecal-oral transmission is the main culprit. That is, feces makes its way into food and water, and from there, into the body. Now there are many ways for this to happen. But we at Tansa Clean are interested in a specific one – the way in which huge amounts of human feces are dumped into freshwater sources close to urban areas.

About 40% of urban homes in India aren’t connected to the sewer system. These homes call in vacuum trucks to empty their septic tanks. But Indian municipalities simply aren’t big enough to process the material from these unsewered homes. So once they’ve serviced the tank, truck operators frequently drive to the most convenient drop-off point, which is often the closest river.

Now the river starts to die as it sickens people around it. Lost work days and the cost of medical treatment means that the Indian economy loses an estimated $120 million annually. And nearly 70 of India’s rivers have such low levels of dissolved oxygen thanks to fecal pollution that they are unable to support aquatic life.

But Tansa Clean has a solution. Because if handled right, poop can be transformed into clean, highly renewable energy, and nutrient-rich, pathogen-free compost.

To do this, you need an anaerobic biodigester - a very cool technology - that uses bacterial action to break down organic wastes into methane and compost in the absence of oxygen. Fortunately for us, India has a large and growing number of them. So we’re connecting vacuum trucks with biodigesters. Once a truck has completed servicing a septic tank, we send it to the closest municipal or private biodigester to offload. The biodigester takes this organic waste and does its microbial magic. Meanwhile we pay the truck driver for each delivery. Our system will keep thousands of cubic meters of septic tank waste out of rivers leaving them a little cleaner.  

Simple, elegant, impactful.

We’re starting small (but dreaming big)…and we’ve got such cool perks!

A great idea! But it isn’t any good until we can test it, break it, fix it, refine it, and grow it. And we can do this…with your support. We’re partnering with a biodigester operator in the state of Maharashtra in India to test the system. We’ll create a small network of vacuum truck operators in the closest big city and they will make deliveries to the digester. We’ll trial this delivery system; measure what’s going in and what’s coming out; test for harmful pathogens; analyze the makeup and volume of methane; and see what farmers think of the compost.

With the money we raise through this campaign, we’ll run this system for atleast one quarter. Then, we’ll grow our customer base, the network of trucks, and our impact.

As thanks for your support and generosity, we’ve developed and sourced some great perks.

We’re lucky that Mario isn’t just a designer with a clean, spare, and modern design aesthetic, but he’s also a great quirky sense of humor. He’s put these skills to full use in creating our cool perks. Choose from postcards, bumper stickers, canvas grocery bags, and t-shirts. Or choose one of the beautiful photographs that our friends Ashish Kothari and Brian Gough have taken. Each one tells a story of India. 

The postcard:

The bumper sticker:

The tote bag:

The T-shirt (front):

The T-shirt (back):

The photographs:

1. A dog snoozes at the door to an inner sanctuary in Thiksey Monastery, Ladakh, Jammu & Kashmir (by Ashish Kothari)

2. Kite fighting string being prepared for Uttarayan, the annual kite festival, Ahmedabad, Gujarat (by Brian Gough)

3. Laughter in Ramapir No Tekro (Ahmedabad's largest slum), Ahmedabad, Gujarat (by Anisha Shankar) 


4. A patient ox waits to be put to work in Kasurdi village, Maharashtra (by Anisha Shankar)

Choose one perk or mix and match to get the perks you want.

It doesn’t have to be money.

Yes, we’d love it if you can show your support with money. But if you can’t, we still need you! Here are four easy and critical ways for you to support us.

1.  Send our campaign link (it appears under the video) via email to two friends who will be excited to support us with money.

2.  Share our campaign link (it appears under the video) on your Facebook page and your twitter feed. The more people who know about us, the better are our chances of success.

3.  Follow the campaign by hitting the star under the right hand corner of the video. You’ll get our updates and you’ll learn how we’re doing.

4.  “Like” Tansa Clean on Facebook and follow us on Twitter (@Tansaclean).

Frequently Asked Questions.

Is there a shipping cost?

Yes, there is a shipping cost for the shopping bags, t-shirts, photographs, or any combination of these. When you pay for shipping, we have more money left over to test our “sanitation transformed” model in India.

For shipping within the U.S., add $5.00-$8.00 (depends on your perk) to your pledge amount.

For shipping outside of the U.S., add $15.00-$20.00 (depends on your perk) to your pledge amount.

Do the t-shirts come in different sizes?

Yes! We offer them in S, M, and L.

How do I select the size of my t-shirt?

At the end of the campaign, we will email you to get your size request.

As thanks for your support and generosity, we’ve developed and
sourced some great perks. 
We’re lucky that Mario isn’t just a designer with a clean, spare,
and modern design aesthetic, but he’s also a great quirky sense of humor. He’s
put these skills to full use in creating our cool perks. Choose from postcards,
bumper stickers, canvas grocery bags, and t-shirts. Or choose one of the
beautiful photographs that our friends Ashish Kothari and Brian Gough have
taken. Each one tells a story of India.  
The postcard:

The bumper sticker:
The tote bag:

The T-shirt (front):

The T-shirt (back):

The photographs:1. A dog snoozes at the door to an inner sanctuary in Thiksey Monastery, Ladakh, Jammu & Kashmir (by Ashish Kothari)


2. Kite fighting string being prepared for Uttarayan, the annual kite festival, Ahmedabad, Gujarat (by Brian Gough)
3. Laughter in Ramapir No Tekro (Ahmedabad's largest slum), Ahmedabad, Gujarat (by Anisha Shankar) 4. A patient ox waits to be put to work in Kasurdi village, Maharashtra (by Anisha Shankar)
Choose one perk or mix and match to get the perks you want.
It doesn’t have to be money.
Yes, we’d love it if you
can show your support with money. But if you can’t, we still need you! Here are
four easy and critical ways for you to support us.
1.  Send our campaign link (it appears under the
video) via email to two friends who will be excited to support us with money.
2.  Share our campaign link (it appears under the
video) on your Facebook page and your twitter feed. The more people who know
about us, the better are our chances of success.
3.  Follow the campaign by hitting the star under
the right hand corner of the video. You’ll get our updates and you’ll learn how
we’re doing.
4.  “Like” Tansa Clean on Facebook and follow us on
Twitter (@Tansaclean).
Frequently Asked Questions.
Is there a shipping cost?
Yes, there is a shipping cost for the shopping bags, t-shirts,
photographs, or any combination of these. When you pay for shipping, we have
more money left over to test our “sanitation transformed” model in India. 
For shipping within the U.S., add $5.00-$8.00 (depends on your
perk) to your pledge amount.
For shipping outside of the U.S., add $15.00-$20.00 (depends on
your perk) to your pledge amount.
Do the t-shirts come in different sizes?
Yes! We offer them in S, M, and L.
How do I select the size of my t-shirt?
At the end of the campaign, we will email you to get your size
request.

story:
Short Summary

We are "Positive Steps", a registered, "grass roots" NGO that works hard at reducing poor human socio-economic status and ultra-poverty of rural Malawian communities. The name reflects our approach to critical human development issues - one step at a time, always forward. This project is about leveraging significant institutional finance to enable a unique sustainable development model and build financially viable social enterprises within 7 Malawian rural communities.

With a population of 15 million, only 8.9% of Malawians have access to electricity. Almost no rural community has access to grid electricity. When the sun sets, people have to use kerosene lamps, torches and candles, grass, firewood; most rural households cook wood fire that spews toxic smoke; schools have no light, no electricity for internet or computers; our children’s ability to learn is affected by the lack of light for studying and fail to achieve their full potential in education; our clinics cannot operate effectively and safely, small business cannot grow and realize their full potential because of lack of access to electricity; it takes rural dwellers half a day to walk to the nearest town to charge their phone for a fee and in some cases it may even take a whole day; there is no easy access to clean water. Most villagers walk miles to the nearest river, lake or well to fetch water in a can or queue at the borehole for more than 6 hours to only get a bucket of 20 litres or less. Often this water is contaminated with harmful pathogens. These contaminants cause serious illness, long-term suffering and even death. Our children are particularly vulnerable and often die. These social trends if not addressed continue to accelerate ultra-poverty levels for rural Malawians.

In our effort to reduce the above-mentioned social trend and create a sustainable model for scaling up to serve the whole country on future, Positive Steps has developed a project called "Green Rural Alternative Sustainable Energy Project (GRASP)”. The concept has been proposed to and been well received by Malawian banks, International NGOs and private investors - in principle we have access to funding our first communities. We are to prepare a full proposal for installation of clean and sustainable energy and water in seven (7) sites during 2014 and need to design the Project Document. To do this we need two things:

1.  To carry out baseline surveys, consultation and community sensitisation at the target sites

2.  A capable technology partner whose vision is aligned with ours

We have partnered with RVE.SOL Ltd who manufactures the KUDURA sustainable development solution – essentially clean, renewable energy and water in a single box.

For the purposes of the fieldwork and project prep and as our own resources are limited we have created this campaign.

What We Need & What You Get

The total project cost for the field work and creating the project document is estimated at €7,769. This in turn will leverage commercial and private institutional funding estimated at €150,000 per community. We have a high belief that our funding will be approved on the basis of pre-work that has been done.

We have raised 48% from our local resources and through local promises to pay. We are looking to raise the remainder of  €4,000 which will enable this project to materialize.

Your contribution will be used to:

-  enable the project team to conduct the surveys, interviews and field study (meals, material, printing)

-  cover data collection fees, local stakeholder meetings and travel costs to the seven selected sites.

-  purchase two second hand computers for data processing and prep in our offices

We are contributing the cost of man-power of the project team (4 people), transport rental and off course our passion and commitment  to see GRASP realised in Malawi.

By supporting this initial phase of the project you will help Positive Steps to be able to design the Project Document and access the funds from the financiers, investors and funding organizations. This will create a life time opportunity for the rural communities in Malawi who will access the right to clean and sustainable energy for lighting, clean drinking water, biogas for cooking and increase their agricultural productivity. Above all the project (GRASP) will reduce household poverty by increasing their income from $1.25/day to possibly $4.50/day.

If we do not raise the total sum targetted, we will try to raise the rest from other sources and NGO's and in the worst case scenario we will advance the detail planning on a community by community basis until we run out of money. The computers will have too wait and we will process data by hand and type the documents…

The Impact

This project is a world changer for rural Malawian. Increased possibilities for health facilities and hospitals to e.g. assist deliveries, perform emergency mini-surgeries and operate emergency rooms during evening and night contributes to improved health. It will reduce maternal deaths caused by inefficient health systems (poor lighting); increased lighting in schools and the possibility to do homework and reading at home during the evening contributes to improved education; agricultural productivity will increase as the project targets to produce organic fertilizer; lighting and productive use of electricity from the solar technology extends business hours and improves the possibilities for growth for income generating activities, such as phone/battery recharging businesses; IT based activities (E-banking), refrigeration, and oilseed pressing and costs incurred in the purchase of fuel will be reduced through increased access to electricity, allowing more money to be spent on food, health care, education and other basic needs which will result in money saved and poverty reduced.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell your friends about our campaign and get them to contribute whatever they can. Have them tell their friends! If you have connections to International NGO's that contribute to the sustainable development in Malawi in particular well wishers and/or friends that will be of huge help to our project. Please tell your friends and colleagues about us – we will make you proud that you changed the future of rural communities in Malawi.

Thanks so much,

Richard

story:
Almost there, but just not yet ! 

I am a former lawyer & trade consultant turned hotelier in Brussels more than 15 years ago. I am also a single mom of a daughter of 11. I am  passionate  and proud about my trade & took myself the challenge to renovate a classified building by Alejandro Christophersen and turn this casa chorizo into a showcase of 

eco-friendly design & renovation & hotel management, 

the very first 100%  eco-hotel in Buenos Aires.

Phileas Fogg Buenos Aires aims at being an environmental place to eat, sleep, learn tango, listen to jazz, relax in the spa and enjoy allergy friendly food. 

A place like no other.

What We Need & What You Get

I have funded the purchase of the building and 80% of the renovation with own means. To complete the project , we would need 70 000 USD 

  • to buy eco-designed furniture , bio-degradable towels, linnen sheets
  • paint rooms ( eco-paint ), finish bathrooms ( water saving shower heads & toilets )
  • buy 6 bikes made of recycled material MADE IN BUENOS AIRES for cycling tours of the city
  • Fancy a free stay with us in return for your support !                                                 Hurry & Discover what we will offer you ! 

The Impact

If you believe in another world, where we consume less, where we can travel & visit places on a minimal ecological footprint,  supporting the Phileas Fogg eco-hotel should be your choice ! We will make it happen ! 

For all  suffering from a gluten allergy ( like myself ), lactose allergy or other, struggling to find food we can enjoy, help us create your culinary heaven !

  • For 15 years I have been succesfull in Brussels. I have learned a lot but needed a new challenge, a beautiful challenge, one that will make this world  a better place to live.

Risks & Challenges

Most of the hurdles and obstacles have been taken: the building bought, the building permit in, the structure of the building having been reinforced and renovation well on its way to its final stage...

  • we need your help to make it to the finish
  • as an ultimate back-up, we are selling a flat in Brussels, but sales are slow

Equally Good Friends

if you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask your folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Spare yourself a lot of trouble &  use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it. See you at the Phileas Fogg !

story:
Short Summary

The Unist'ot'en Camp lies directly in the path of both the Enbridge Northern Gateway tar sands pipeline and the Pacific Trails LNG pipeline proposals. The blockade is maintained by the Wet'suwet'en, an indigenous nation whose land would be crossed by these projects, with support from a broad range of allies. The Wet'suwet'en have given legal notice to the companies and governments that these projects will not cross their land.

These folks need supplies to maintain the blockade - and that's where we come in! We can't all be there, but we can keep the frontline blockaders fed through the long Northern BC winter. 

Resistance to these projects is huge and growing, and the Unist'ot'en Camp is literally ground zero for this resistance. If all the other avenues of resistance fail - and we can't be 100% confident that they will succeed - this physical blockade will be absolutely critical. They have already successfully evicted company agents and prospectors.

Immediate Needs

Funding

We (myself and anyone who wants to step up to help!) need money to purchase ethically raised beef from a farm in the Comox Valley. I live and work on a farm that raises grass fed beef, and that's where I'll be sourcing the beef.We may get a good deal from the farmer - this is pending. We'll then donate our time to process it into beef jerky (and possibly some other products to send up, as well: salt beef, canned beef stock).  

Any extra funds will either be given directly to the Unist'ot'en Camp as cash or, if the camp leaders request it, we may purchase other goods to send up. I am working with one of the Unist'ot'en Camp's liaisons in Victoria to arrange transport of the food up north. Check out Wild Coast to find out more about the support work they're doing for the camp.
Because of the timing, I am getting a loan to purchase the beef. So it's going up one way or another - I just need folks to help pay for it!

Equipment and Labour Support
I could also definitely use some other forms of help besides money. If anyone has extra dehydrator or cold-smoker capacity and could take on making some of the jerky, that would be amazing. If you are in the Comox Valley or reasonably close by, please get in touch on Facebook or email me at feedtheblockade (at) gmail.com.

If you have other shelf-stable, ethical, homemade, SAFE food products that could help feed folks, also get in touch.

The Impact

Donating to this is directly supporting the Unist'ot'en Camp. If you're one of those folks (and I know there are lots) who feels passionately that these extreme energy projects can not be allowed, that indigenous law can not be ignored, and that we need to work together to stop these projects by any means necessary - this is a way to provide material support. Real support. 

I know that there are lots of folks who feel incredibly strongly about this - and yet feel powerless. Here's your power! And here's your opportunity to get more involved. We need everyone who can to do everything they can to resist these insane projects. If we don't, no one will and our world will be gone.

It is also important to the Unist'ot'en Camp that food be sourced ethically. While the most important this is to keep folks fed, it is also vitally important, according to the camp's leaders, to be sourcing ethical, responsible food. That's the world we are going for, so it's what we should support when we can. And we can.

Risks & Challenges

There's not much risk to forgoing a dinner out and putting the money toward this instead this. Or donating more, as much as you can.

In fact the much greater risk is not doing everything we can to stop these pipelines and extreme energy projects.

As I said, the food is going up one way or another - we need folks to pitch in to cover the costs.

story:
Support Solar Energy at The Mountain Institute

The Mountain Institute (TMI) is a non profit organization dedicated to preserving mountain environments and empowering mountain communities. We're asking for your help to create a solar-powered, net zero energy demonstration project at our Spruce Knob Mountain Center in West Virginia. 

Your support will enable us to purchase additional solar panels that will generate 100% of our earth-sheltered office building's energy from the sun. This will convert the building into a net zero energy building (one that generates all of the energy it consumes on-site)  providing one of West Virginia's only solar-powered, net zero energy demonstration projects for education.

In June of 2013, TMI installed a small 3.05 kW solar array on our earth-sheltered office building with help from a generous grant by the Appalachian Stewardship Foundation and a donated panel from the system’s installer, Mountain View Solar. So far, the panels have produced enough clean energy to provide more than half of the earth-sheltered office building's electricity while cutting TMI's power bills.  

Your Contribution Will:

Provide a unique opportunity for over 2,000 people every year to learn about solar energy and ways to deploy it in their own communities. The project will be one of the few places in West Virginia in which visiting adults and school-aged children can learn about the benefits of solar energy from a whole building perspective, integrating concepts of energy efficiency and passive solar design

Help a non-profit organization save on energy expenses. TMI spent more than $7,000 last year on energy costs to operate its experiential education center.  West Virginia’s electricity rates have increased an average of 50% in the last five years; each dollar spent on energy represents a dollar that can’t support TMI’s education and on-the-ground projects. Each solar panel installed at our earth-sheltered office building will, over its lifetime, provide years of clean, locally-produced energy, and save TMI over a thousand dollars in energy costs. 

Support local economic development around renewable energy in West Virginia. The American-made solar panels will be installed by Mountain View Solar, a West Virginia company employing local workers to design and install the array.The solar array will demonstrate how the Appalachian region is capable of harnessing clean energy resources while creating economic opportunity and protecting the region’s natural assets.

About The Mountain Institute:

TMI is a non-profit organization with a mission to preserve mountain environments, support mountain cultures, and improve mountain livelihoods.  TMI’s Appalachian Program focuses on developing an understanding and appreciation for the complex interaction between community, culture, and conservation through education and sustainable community initiatives.

The heart of the program is the Spruce Knob Mountain Center, which serves as the home base for TMI's wide variety of education programs. These programs bring adventure, group process skills, leadership development, conservation, and environmental education together in a rigorous and invigorating environment.

story:
Growing Futures Kenya is the brain child of Evelyn Libal and Juma Bongo Saidi. While studying sustainable agriculture and development in Kenya Juma and I fell in love.  Now we are pouring our heart, soul, and hands into applying our many talents and skills to the dynamic improvement of our area in coastal Kenya. I have degrees in Environmental Studies and Horticulture from the University of Wisconsin Madison as well as a lifetime of experience growing up on an organic farm. We are in the infancy of our project.  This initial money is to run trials on the ideas we would like to implement to assess feasibility and gain experience of challenges and solutions on a small scale. This way when we write for larger grants we will have a better idea of what is involved and how to do it efficiently the first time! Our goal is to create opportunities because while our community suffers seriously from poverty of the pocket they are gifted with a wealth of human capitol waiting for a chance. We budget $50 a week to take care of our needs, everything else goes to building and creating this project.  Our ideas are as follows:


1.  Compost, swales, mulch, and terra perta creation to build a healthy soil in a heavily weathered, eroded, and desertifying area for local vegetable production.  This uses low cost or free local resources to create a more fertile growing environment for farmers to grow their food locally instead of shipping it in.  It also is a demonstration of organic soil building farming to give an alternative to synthetic fertilizers and the damage to the reef ecosystem synthetic fertilizers cause.  See our website for more on this we have almost completed this project and are watching to see how our plants grow!  We only need $250 to finish paying for the transport of compost from the market (divert waste stream), charcoal from the shops in town (the unusable small chips and dust), and to employ our neighbor to cut and bring grass for mulch (employing women!).   


2.  Mini-aquaponics! Aquaponics is the growing of fish and plants to make a closed loop system of fertilization and cleaning. Before jumping into a big aquaponics project we want to test our design on a small low risk scale.  We would make plant rafts of 1 liter water bottles.  We want to source the media locally using coconut husks and fired clay balls. Above the tank with the floating plant rafts would be gutters with more plants. The water would be pumped with a small solar pump through the gutters and fall back into the tank adding oxygen to the water.  Total project cost about $300.  $100 for barrels, $15 for gutter, $100 for pump, $25 for wood to build support structure, $100 miscellaneous (getting fish, transportation to tour aquaponics in the area, seeds, and the things I have not thought of yet and it always costs more than expected) coconut, clay balls, and recycled water bottles are free and we have an old mosquito net to protect our babies from the ravages of insects.


3.  Micro greens to Crickets.  In Kenya crickets are an acceptable food source.  We want to assess if the local varieties of crickets can be domesticated.  If they do well we would like to have growing containers that would switch between micro-greens and crickets.  The cricket waste is an excellent fertilizer. Crickets are very efficient at becoming a high protein and fat snack while microgreens are packed with vitimins, minerals, and phyto-nutrients.  This initial stage is to see if the local crickets can survive and reproduce in captivity. If this can be accomplished the next stage is to see what kind of market there is for greens and crickets.  Given that my neighbors are pretty universally malnourished and there is a serious lack of access to fresh food in our area I think we stand a pretty good chance! Again if on a small scale this is successful we will write plans for expansion. Total cost $200. Barrels+ transport $100, Dirt $40, Getting crickets $10, things we don’t know we need yet $50.


4.  Rain barrels and pond digging to expand terrace. Total $250. Barrels $100, pond digging $50, tires and transportation $100.  


5.  Road. The goal is to have a safe road where sustainable forestry on the edges will provide a portion of the cost for maintenance as well as balancing the carbon expenditure of a road Infrastructure is one of the best gifts you can give. Having a road connects you to the market allowing economic growth. Not having a road really holds people back. For example our neighbor has cows.  When it rains he cannot come out to take care of his cows. His cows suffer and he does not get paid. A good road also keeps you from bodily harm.  The young men who do motorcycle taxi pretty universally have large burn scars from falling on the awful roads and getting stuck under the searing exhaust pipe.  They also have to spend a lot of time and money fixing their motorcycles when they fall and break something. Our community wants to level the road, dig ditches, and plant many a tree on the sides.  Any money left over will continue the building of the road.  We are going to start with a half kilometer stretch to test our estimates and know what is needed for a larger project. Something I have learned in Kenya is that you can really never know what is going to happen. You just need to do it and adapt accordingly. Optimally the trees could earn the area carbon credits which could go toward maintenance and put the power of infrastructure building into the local communities hands instead of waiting for it to trickle down.   Estimated project cost $3000.  Leveling the road $500 (local labor), Planting trees $500(trees, manure, water, rent truck to transport), compensation of farmers for land $1000, gravel $1000.  Once again, this trial will allow us to make detailed plans and allow us to learn the ropes so we can implement much larger self sustaining road projects. We need to implement an accountability and transparency system for handling the money that comes from the potential carbon credits and harvesting of the trees.   


6.  Back to School.  We host talent shows for school supplies and get books for schools.  We need children’s books!!!!! Ship them to Juma Bongo Saidi at P.O. box 160 Mtwapa, Kenya.  They will all find homes in the classrooms surrounding us!  To learn more visit http://growingfutureskenya.org/?page_id=47.  The stereotype of malnourished kid from Africa is unfortunately correct in our area but they are so much more awesome than just that. We want to encourage and reward their multitude of talents. High prizes are new school uniforms, shoes, back packs at $10.  Small prizes are pencils, notebooks, erasers, coloring supplies. We would buy these in bulk. We also need speakers for dance offs.  We would like to spend about $2,500 to host competitions and develop our model for doing outreach and empowerment through expression and KEEP KIDS IN SCHOOL! $300 will go to sending the books I have in the USA to Kenya, $2,200 goes to buying school supplies, obtaining area to display art work, speakers, and transportation. This is crazy fun and does a lot to help kid’s confidence and creativity. (Schools cannot afford art classes or after school programs.)   


7.  House. We are building a BEAUTIFUL sculpture of a house trying to make dirt and cow poop an enticing alternative to cement! The base is an Earthship (used tires packed with dirt) covered with cob (sand, clay, straw, and cow manure).  We want to show people there is a high quality, environmentally friendly alternative to building with cement.  We are about half way done. Once it is finished it will have a guest room for visitors (volunteers from abroad as well as people who would like to do a work learning experience with us to spread knowledge).  This is going to need another $2000 to finish everything.  We need more dirt for the walls, metal bars for window security, coral blocks and cement to put in our big metal door and build a cistern, transportation, $50 a week for our food and living expenses, as well as all the miscellaneous things we need.   


8.  Toilet digging and rain water catchment. Too many people don’t use toilets in our area and too many children die from water born disease.  A group of young men have volunteered to dig toilets for $10. Water tanks depend on the size.  Once we find out about buying wholesale I will put their prices up.  The last $2000 and anything extra will go to these two activities.


These are our 6 month goals.  Once we have learned to navigate Kenya, know our projects inside out, and Jay has completed some formal education we want to write for larger funding. Our 5 year plan is to have a Maker Space Resource Center in addition to our demonstration farm and buildings.  I have even planted to trees for it so we can have living walls! This way people have a chance to explore a diversity of skills and ideas to fill empty market niches. It is also a place to be exposed to many ideas from around the world as well as creating sustainable employment opportunities in an area with exceptionally high and unreliable unemployment.  We also want to have a space for volunteers to stay given that they contribute positively to the community in whatever skills they have.  These are our first baby steps and with an early helping hand soon we will be on our feet planting forests and sculpting a beautiful future! 

I keep a blog at http://growingfutureskenya.blogspot.com/ and share our myriad of weird day to day adventures and experiences.  On http://growingfutureskenya.org/ we have more of our grandiose plans, goals, and how things are developing.  We will be updating a facebook page with tons of pictures!  I can be contacted by email evelyn@tikkunolaminc.com, by phone +254729242492, or facebook Evelyn Libal or  Growing Futures Kenya.  Please contact me if you have questions or have a specific project you want your funding to go to!

story:
Summary
We welcome you to our GlassDharma campaign! We hope you liked the video and learned something too!  We are grateful to Its a Plastic World  for letting us use it in our Earth Day Campaign. 
                                                               Who We Are
David Leonhardt and Gail Johnson co-founded GlassDharma, home of the original glass straw, and created the glass straw industry. The website went up in 2008 and since then these environmentally friendly straws have been shipped to over 50 countries. 
                                                              The Mission
We are here to educate people about Plastic Pollution and the alternatives to single-use plastics as we operate a sustainable green business manufacturing glass drinking straws. One glass straw can replace 1000's of plastic ones. 
                                                         Campaign Objective

                                      

"Thank you for the straw and a very informative video. Great event!"  Lacey K.
We are asking for your support in growing our Earth Day project. We have had an explosive 7th Annual Free Straw Earth Day Giveaway (link on our website top of home page through Earth Day, April 22) that allows 1000's of people to become aware of the impact of their everyday choices related to single-use plastics and the alternatives that are available. Your financial help and any of the 10 tasks listed at the end would be fantastic!
There are many people who don't even think about the impact of their plastic choices and we need you to help change that -  for everyone's health, for our kids futures. for the animals, fish and birds, for our oceans and for our planet! 
 See below for details on how we did not anticipate such a huge response and now need your help to expand this project keeping the flow of education and changed behavior going to help our planet! Our successful Earth Day promotion = more people = more awareness = less plastic consumption = a cleaner and healthier planet = you making a huge difference!  Thank you so much for your consideration!  
                                                             Are you in?

"Woo hoo, straws ordered for mommy and kiddos! Thanks for the great opportunity and the education. I knew the plastic and trash issue was bad, but that video was very informative .. Plus all the posts leading up to today. The quiz and form were perfect from my iPhone and the code was sent instantly! "  Jen S.

                

What We Are Asking From You

We are inviting you to help us ensure that this year's 7th Annual Free 

Earth Day Project is phenomenally successful! 

Our original cost projections included:

(and we'll keep this simple as the actual figures get quite complicated)
  • Product costs (materials & labor)
  • Shipping
  • Webmaster labor costs
  • Social media labor costs
What actually happened:
On the 5th Day of our Earth Day Free Straw Giveaway, notices on at least 4 very large websites with links to our Giveaway went totally viral.  This resulted in 1000's of orders more than we had anticipated.  In addition to the unplanned production, and shipping costs, there is also website and social media expenses needed to modify our Free Straw Giveaway.
What we have done:
  • Modified the Earth Day Giveaway so that all future participants would have to pay $3 shipping to defray future costs and be able to keep the Earth Day Giveaway going until originally planned, Earth Day, April 22.
  • Shipped the 1st thousand orders
  • Started this Indiegogo campaign so that we do not have to go back on our word to the thousands that have successfully taken the Earth Day quiz about the video above. We  need your help to be able to ship to them. 
  • Total costs that we are asking your help with;  $15,000
  • We have become really excited about the potential of both these campaigns to make a much bigger impact on our planet than we would have ever even imagined! We believe there are no accidents - our mistake in not setting a limit to begin with is now a potential blessing for the planet with so many people receiving this valuable education!
Check out the link at the bottom of this page to the history of our Earth Day Free Straw Giveaway as well as the section on Additional Background Notes.                                      Funding Need Summary                                     Total:  $15,000
We would love to raise this amount or more - the priority is to get our already ordered free straws out there as soon as we can!

"Hooray, I received my earth day straw! Thank you so much GlassDharma for the opportunity to receive a free straw and learn about our earth.                  Cindy & Tom M.

The Exciting Part! ~~~ Perks For You!
The Perks we have picked for you are going to let you celebrate Earth Day, every day! GlassDharma straws! Why would you love to have GlassDharma glass drinking straws? Here are just a few reasons:
  • You can make a difference at multiple levels including the world!
  • Good for the environment -plastic straws/stirrers are in the top 10 Ocean Debris List (Ocean Conservancy). 
  • No BPA (endocrine disruptor) toxins like in plastic counterpart that can't be recycled and has been attributed to cancer, infertility, asthma, etc.
  • Great teaching tool- their beauty and style really get noticed
  • Durable and backed by a unprecedented life-time guarantee against breakage (can be replaced if broken)
  • Made in California 
  • Easy to clean - Can go in the microwave and dishwasher
  • Kid friendly and safe
  • Great for all hot or cold drinks
  • Perfectly stages specialty drinks - bubble teas, iced drinks, shakes, smoothies and juices
  • Beautiful in cocktails - great accessory for stemware and martini glasses
  • Concerned about staining or damaging your teeth? Use for wine, coffee, teas and acidic drinks                 
                                                           Our Straw Collection      

                                                     

This is a brand new offering exclusive to our Indiegogo contributors! We are calling it our GoGo Bend!  It is 10" long and with the 8mm diameter, it fits many of the popular mason jar lids and sippy tops - a perfect straw for on the "Go!" (fits in extra long hemp sleeve carrier)

                              

Here is our famous Earth Day Straw  in 12mm Smoothie size and 9,5mm Ice Tea size - our shortest straw at 5 " (+/- 1/4")

"So cute! I bet one of those straws is coming my way! Loved the video by the way. So informative and I have been spreading the word more than ever. Thank you GlassDharma for your wonderful product and inspiring mission!"  @veggieern on Instagram

Our smaller diameter (7mm x4mm) Coffee Straw comes in 8", 9" and 10" lengths and are very popular for replacing the plastic straws in many beverage containers. 


  

                                 Here are our original 3 styles and available lengths - 

  • Beautiful Bend - 9"
  • Decorative Dots -  6.25" & 9"
  • Simple Elegance -  6.25", 8", 9" & 10"

The Decorative Dots come in 6 different colors so they can be used for personalizing individual glasses (like wine glass markers) with your family or guests.  The Beautiful Bend reaches towards you and along with the Decorative Dots, they won't roll off the counter!   

                 

           We have 5 colors of our hemp sleeves in 3 sizes (Blue, Purple, Natural, Black, & Green) and our Family Pack Carrier are the perfect way to carry your straws 

So, take your pick and find the Perk that works for you!

"Loved the video by the way. So informative and I have been spreading the word more than ever. Thank you GlassDharma for your wonderful product and inspiring mission!" 2015 participant

Sip the World. Make a Differnce

              Here is diagram that shows the diameters in the different styles:   

                            


What else can you do to help this campaign and our planet instead of/or in addition to contributing money?
  1. Tell everyone you know about this campaign! You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
  2. Go to our website www.glassdharma.com and select the option on the home page at the top for "7th Annual Free Glass Straws for Earth Day", watch the video again (if you like), take the quiz and receive a $6 coupon code for a free straw (with you paying shipping!) Offer good through Earth Day,April 22, 2015.
  3. Check out the additional resources on the Earth Day page - there is  a lot to learn! Beth Terry of My Plastic Free Life is one of our favorites! 

                                                    

  4. Sign up for our newsletter so you can be kept informed of future promotions and discounts.
  5. Become part of the Pollution Solution - what changes can you make to have a more sustainable lifestyle? Bring your own shopping bags?  Use your own non-plastic water bottle?  Carry a glass straw with you?
  6. Share your ideas and comments here or on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, etc.
  7. Consider us in the future when you need that special, unique gift! 
  8. Support other green companies like ECOlunchbox, Chicobags, The MasonBar Company, Reuseit, etc.
  9. Support other Indiegogo projects that help our environment such as Plastic Free Shop
  10. Encourage restaurants to ask before automatically giving out plastic straws or even to switch to compostable straws.

                                                               

Additional Background Notes

Our Earth Day Straw, the one we have offered for free in the Earth Day Giveaway, is a straw made from mill ends. When we start with a 59" glass tube and cut it into 9" lengths, we end up with a 5" (approx) piece which we used to discard! We decided to reduce our scrap and get more straws made! An excellent re-purpose! 

Although the production costs of these straws are low, we need to cover the shipping of the free straws that have already been ordered. We rely heavily on social media to promote our campaigns and we hit the jackpot!  Again, this is great news for our planet because so many people are learning about Plastic Pollution!  

We started our Free Earth Day Giveaway promotion on Tuesday, March 24th . On Saturday, March 28th, after our Earth Day promotion was posted on several high traffic websites and we were getting 20-30 orders per minute- almost all just for the free straw. We shut the website down on Sunday after receiving over 4000 additional orders in less than 12 hours.  When we brought it back up on Monday, we apologized for the down time and decided we had to change the offer to receive a free straw with the $6 coupon but that each person would now be  paying the $3 shipping. This enabled us to continue offering a free straw.

 We are  continuing our promotion through Earth Day, April 22.  Our learning has been that we do need to set a limit up front! We also needed more data to better predict add on sales to the free straw. 

                                                        

Your contributions are going to allow us to  complete our mission  by getting these straws shipped out to the world and into the hands of people who are learning how to make a difference for our environment. We really didn't want to tell over  4000 people  that we were going to have to cancel their orders and change them to the $6 off coupon code (with future compensation).  You are now given the opportunity to make a difference for yourself and many others who really want to start making changes in their single-use plastic consumption.  We are asking you to partner with us so you can also make a difference with plastic pollution education and we can continue to ship our highly desired Earth Day straws. 

We love GlassDharma straws and use them daily for smoothies, green juices and even coffee and tea. What we really love about GlassDharma is that these straws are amazing teaching tools and they are fun to use! It is so cool to be in a restaurant and whip out a glass straws and say, "No plastic straw please, I have my own!" We often talk about the spiraling dynamic that happens when people start thinking about how easy it would be to quit using plastic straws.  What else could they change?  Bring their own shopping bags?  Use their own non-plastic water bottles?  The thoughts only go on from there. These glass straws are so beautiful and durable (we do have a lifetime guarantee against breakage - if it breaks, we replace for free plus shipping) you can't help but tell your friends and family about them! 
GlassDharma has funded and grown this plastic debris awareness event for the last 7 years and we now invite supporters to be included so that we might continue to grow this project to infinite proportions.  Our Planet wins.  We all win!
David Leonhardt and Gail Johnson, Co-founders GlassDharma
P.S.
And you might ask, why Dharma?  It is a Sanskrit word that has many definitions and meanings.  For us, it means that this is our life purpose, our right action.  We are delighted to have you as partners! 
History of Free Glass Straws for Earth Day
story_txt:
SummaryWe welcome you to our GlassDharma campaign! We hope you liked the video and learned something too!  We are grateful to Its a Plastic World  for letting us use it in our Earth Day Campaign. 

                                                               Who We Are

David Leonhardt and Gail Johnson co-founded GlassDharma, home of the original glass straw, and created the glass straw industry. The website went up in 2008 and since then these environmentally friendly straws have been shipped to over 50 countries. 

                                                              The Mission

We are here to educate people about Plastic Pollution and the alternatives to single-use plastics as we operate a sustainable green business manufacturing glass drinking straws. One glass straw can replace 1000's of plastic ones. 

                                                         Campaign Objective




                                      


"Thank you for the straw and a very informative video. Great event!"  Lacey K.

We are asking for your support in growing our Earth Day project. We have had an explosive 7th Annual Free Straw Earth Day Giveaway (link on our website top of home page through Earth Day, April 22) that allows 1000's of people to become aware of the impact of their everyday choices related to single-use plastics and the alternatives that are available. Your financial help and any of the 10 tasks listed at the end would be fantastic!
There are many people who don't even think about the impact of their plastic choices and we need you to help change that -  for everyone's health, for our kids futures. for the animals, fish and birds, for our oceans and for our planet! 

 See below for details on how we did not anticipate such a huge response and now need your help to expand this project keeping the flow of education and changed behavior going to help our planet! Our successful Earth Day promotion = more people = more awareness = less plastic consumption = a cleaner and healthier planet = you making a huge difference!  Thank you so much for your consideration!  


                                                             Are you in?


"Woo hoo, straws ordered for mommy and kiddos! Thanks for the great opportunity and the education. I knew the plastic and trash issue was bad, but that video was very informative .. Plus all the posts leading up to today. The quiz and form were perfect from my iPhone and the code was sent instantly! "  Jen S.

                



What We Are Asking From You


We are inviting you to help us ensure that this year's 7th Annual Free Earth
Day Project is phenomenally successful! 


Our original cost projections included:

(and we'll keep this simple as the actual figures get quite complicated)


Product costs (materials & labor)

Shipping
Webmaster labor costs
Social media labor costs

What actually happened:
On the 5th Day of our Earth Day Free Straw Giveaway, notices on at least 4 very large websites with links to our Giveaway went totally viral.  This resulted in 1000's of orders more than we had anticipated.  In addition to the unplanned production, and shipping costs, there is also website and social media expenses needed to modify our Free Straw Giveaway.
What we have done:

Modified the Earth Day Giveaway so that all future participants would have to pay $3 shipping to defray future costs and be able to keep the Earth Day Giveaway going until originally planned, Earth Day, April 22.
Shipped the 1st thousand orders
Started this Indiegogo campaign so that we do not have to go back on our word to the thousands that have successfully taken the Earth Day quiz about the video above. We  need your help to be able to ship to them. 

Total costs that we are asking your help with;  $15,000

We have become really excited about the potential of both these campaigns to make a much bigger impact on our planet than we would have ever even imagined! We believe there are no accidents - our mistake in not setting a limit to begin with is now a potential blessing for the planet with so many people receiving this valuable education!



Check out the link at the bottom of this page to the history of our Earth Day Free Straw Giveaway as well as the section on Additional Background Notes.                                      Funding Need Summary                                     Total:  $15,000



We would love to raise this amount or more - the priority is to get our already ordered free straws out there as soon as we can!

"Hooray, I received my earth day straw! Thank you so much GlassDharma for the opportunity to receive a free straw and learn about our earth.                  Cindy & Tom M.




The Exciting Part! ~~~ Perks For You!
The Perks we have picked for you are going to let you celebrate Earth Day, every day! GlassDharma straws! Why would you love to have GlassDharma glass drinking straws? Here are just a few reasons:


You can make a difference at multiple levels including the world!
Good for the environment -plastic straws/stirrers are in the top 10 Ocean Debris List (Ocean Conservancy). 
No BPA (endocrine disruptor) toxins like in plastic counterpart that can't be recycled and has been attributed to cancer, infertility, asthma, etc.
Great teaching tool- their beauty and style really get noticed

Durable and backed by a unprecedented life-time guarantee against breakage (can be replaced if broken)

Made in California 
Easy to clean - Can go in the microwave and dishwasher

Kid friendly and safe

Great for all hot or cold drinks

Perfectly stages specialty drinks - bubble teas, iced drinks, shakes, smoothies and juices

Beautiful in cocktails - great accessory for stemware and martini glasses

Concerned about staining or damaging your teeth? Use for wine, coffee, teas and acidic drinks                 


                                                           Our Straw Collection                                                           
This is a brand new offering exclusive to our Indiegogo contributors! We are calling it our GoGo Bend!  It is 10" long and with the 8mm diameter, it fits many of the popular mason jar lids and sippy tops - a perfect straw for on the "Go!" (fits in extra long hemp sleeve carrier)

                              


Here is our famous Earth Day Straw  in 12mm Smoothie size and 9,5mm Ice Tea size - our shortest straw at 5 " (+/- 1/4")
"So cute! I bet one of those straws is coming my way! Loved the video by the way. So informative and I have been spreading the word more than ever. Thank you GlassDharma for your wonderful product and inspiring mission!"  @veggieern on Instagram

Our smaller diameter (7mm x4mm) Coffee Straw comes in 8", 9" and 10" lengths and are very popular for replacing the plastic straws in many beverage containers. 

  
                                 Here are our original 3 styles and available lengths - 


Beautiful Bend - 9"
Decorative Dots -  6.25" & 9"

Simple Elegance -  6.25", 8", 9" & 10"


The Decorative Dots come in 6 different colors so they can be used for personalizing individual glasses (like wine glass markers) with your family or guests.  The Beautiful Bend reaches towards you and along with the Decorative Dots, they won't roll off the counter!   

                 

           We have 5 colors of our hemp sleeves in 3 sizes (Blue, Purple, Natural, Black, & Green) and our Family Pack Carrier are the perfect way to carry your straws 
So, take your pick and find the Perk that works for you!

"Loved the video by the way. So informative
and I have been spreading the word more than ever. Thank you GlassDharma for your wonderful
product and inspiring mission!" 2015 participant
Sip the World. Make a Differnce
              Here is diagram that shows the diameters in the different styles:   



                            


What else can you do to help this campaign and our planet instead of/or in addition to contributing money?


Tell everyone you know about this campaign! You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
Go to our website www.glassdharma.com and select the option on the home page at the top for "7th Annual Free Glass Straws for Earth Day", watch the video again (if you like), take the quiz and receive a $6 coupon code for a free straw (with you paying shipping!) Offer good through Earth Day,April 22, 2015.

Check out the additional resources on the Earth Day page - there is  a lot to learn! Beth Terry of My Plastic Free Life is one of our favorites! 
                                                

Sign up for our newsletter so you can be kept informed of future promotions and discounts.
Become part of the Pollution Solution - what changes can you make to have a more sustainable lifestyle? Bring your own shopping bags?  Use your own non-plastic water bottle?  Carry a glass straw with you?
Share your ideas and comments here or on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest, etc.
Consider us in the future when you need that special, unique gift! 

Support other green companies like ECOlunchbox, Chicobags, The MasonBar Company, Reuseit, etc.

Support other Indiegogo projects that help our environment such as Plastic Free Shop

Encourage restaurants to ask before automatically giving out plastic straws or even to switch to compostable straws.



                                                               


Additional Background Notes

Our Earth Day Straw, the one we have offered for free in the Earth Day Giveaway, is a straw made from mill ends. When we start with a 59" glass tube and cut it into 9" lengths, we end up with a 5" (approx) piece which we used to discard! We decided to reduce our scrap and get more straws made! An excellent re-purpose! 
Although the production costs of these straws are low, we need to cover the shipping of the free straws that have already been ordered. We rely heavily on social media to promote our campaigns and we hit the jackpot!  Again, this is great news for our planet because so many people are learning about Plastic Pollution!  




We started our Free Earth Day Giveaway promotion on Tuesday, March 24th . On
Saturday, March 28th, after our Earth Day promotion was posted on several high traffic websites and we were
getting 20-30 orders per minute- almost all just for the free straw. We shut the website down on Sunday after receiving over 4000 additional orders in less than 12 hours.  When we brought it back up on Monday, we apologized for the down time and decided we had to change the offer to receive a free straw with the $6 coupon but that each person would now be  paying the $3
shipping. This enabled us to continue offering a free straw.
 We are  continuing our promotion through Earth Day, April 22.  Our learning has been that we do need to set a limit up front! We also needed more data to better predict add on sales to the free straw. 


                                                        
Your contributions are going to allow us to  complete our mission  by getting these straws shipped out to the world and into the hands of people who are learning how to make a difference for our environment. We really didn't want to tell over  4000 people  that we were going to have to cancel their orders and change them to the $6 off coupon code (with future compensation).  You are now given the opportunity to make a difference for yourself and many others who really want to start making changes in their single-use plastic consumption.  We are asking you to partner with us so you can also make a difference with plastic pollution education and we can continue to ship our highly desired Earth Day straws. 


We love GlassDharma straws and use them daily for smoothies, green juices and even coffee and tea. What we really love about GlassDharma is that these straws are amazing teaching tools and they are fun to use! It is so cool to be in a restaurant and whip out a glass straws and say, "No plastic straw please, I have my own!" We often talk about the spiraling dynamic that happens when people start thinking about how easy it would be to quit using plastic straws.  What else could they change?  Bring their own shopping bags?  Use their own non-plastic water bottles?  The thoughts only go on from there. These glass straws are so beautiful and durable (we do have a lifetime guarantee against breakage - if it breaks, we replace for free plus shipping) you can't help but tell your friends and family about them! 
GlassDharma has funded and grown this plastic debris awareness event for the last 7 years and we now invite supporters to be included so that we might continue to grow this project to infinite proportions.  Our Planet wins.  We all win!

David Leonhardt and Gail Johnson, Co-founders GlassDharma

P.S.
And you might ask, why Dharma?  It is a Sanskrit word that has many definitions and meanings.  For us, it means that this is our life purpose, our right action.  We are delighted to have you as partners! 
History of Free Glass Straws for Earth Day

story:
OUR STORY

Since 2011, Earlham College students with the Responsible Energy Investment (REInvestment) Campaign have been calling for Earlham to DIVEST from fossil fuels – because as a Quaker school that holds values of peace and justice, Earlham has no business profiting from the violence of the fossil fuel industry.

In the four years that students have been working tirelessly on this campaign, REInvestment has had a significant impact on campus. Even though Earlham has not yet committed to divest, the campaign has been a vehicle for education. The dozens of students who have worked on this campaign have learned valuable grassroots organizing skills, which they will surely use when they move on to be leaders and changemakers post-Earlham, and they've learned about extreme fossil fuel extraction and its impact on people, communities, and the climate. That knowledge has spread throughout campus as students have worked to raise awareness about these issues.

Earlham Alums for REInvestment is a group of Earlham alums organizing other alums to support the campaign.  Today, we're asking for your help in supporting the education of REInvestment activists – because we know from experience that an Earlham education involves much more than what happens in the classroom.  So while Earlham is investing in fossil fuels, we're investing in Earlham students.

Will you join us?

The truth is, all of us in EAR know from experience that these kinds of trips have a big impact. When we were students working on REInvestment, we had the chance to go to conferences and trainings. Students have attended the Mountain Justice Fall Summit, where they heard firsthand from West Virginia residents about what it's like to live near mountaintop removal coal mining. We also sent students to national divestment convergences in 2013 and 2014, where we got to meet up with hundreds of other divestment activists for a weekend of workshops and strategizing. As you can tell from students’ reflections about these trips, they were powerful and moving experiences.

Learning firsthand about the struggles of frontline communities is central to REInvestment's core values about fighting for human dignity and environmental justice, and the students need our help to make these trips happen.

But students have always had to fundraise for these trips themselves.  Although REInvestment receives some funding from the school, Earlham policy prohibits school funds from being used for off-campus travel or conference registration.  That's why we believe that this fund and the flexibility it affords is very important for REInvestment activists.


OUR BUDGET

Most immediately, the students are excited about going to the annual Mountain Justice Fall Summit.  Registration for that event costs $50 per person, and travel would average out to about $25 per person.  That means that every $75 we raise would send one Earlham student to the Fall Summit.

The Fall Summit is the first event students have in mind this year, but other options might include regional climate activist convergences, or trips to fracking sites closer to their Indiana home.  Travel to a regional conference or a fracking site might cost just $25 per person.


FOR MORE INFORMATION...

You can visit REInvestment on their website, Facebook, or Twitter.

For info and updates about Earlham Alums for REInvestment, please connect with us on our Facebook group or contact reinvestearlham [at] gmail [dot] com.


THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

~ Our inner light does not burn on fossil fuels. ~
