story:
We are very excited to announce the launch of our new and improved website & online shop – www.poochy.com

This means that we are wrapping up our crowd-funding campaign and moving to the new site full time.

Our new site will officially introduce Poochy to the world – the generation 2 hands-free poop collector from Piqapoo, which is even more comfortable, durable and efficient than before.

The site includes our official Poochy shop, enabling direct orders with worldwide shipping, alongside special offers, discounts & sales, training videos and lots of other goodies, all with a new look and a convenient user experience. Check it out now

We will of course still be available to you via backers@piqapoo.com, our Facebook page and directly through the site.

 

 

 

Piqapoo was designed by dog parents with the dog’s well-being as the top priority. We spent three years refining its design and searching for the best materials that are both durable and provide maximum comfort for our pets.

We are truly excited about this and know that Piqapoo will forever change the way people walk their dogs! 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

As dog parents, we are very protective of our dogs. When we first came up with the idea we had to check that it actually works. We talked with many dog owners, trainers, and vets and got very good feedback.

 

 

Easy to fit and durable enough to contain any texture of dog feces, Piqapoo provides the cleanest and simplest solution for dog waste disposal.  

 

 

 

Before delivery, we will ask you via email for your dog's size so we can send you the appropriate Piqapoo.

Piqapoo has been successfully tested by the vision-impaired and their service dogs. See how it went for one blind man and his furry friend when they used Piqapoo for the first time…

 

 

How do I use Piqapoo?

Attach the collection bag to the clip and easily place the clip around the base of your dog's tail when you go for a walk. When your dog is ready to poop, the droppings will fall directly into the collection bag. Once the dog is done, take the clip off his tail and press the button to toss the bag into the bin. 
For further details please refer to our How-To video and see our infographics in the Project Description.

 

Does using Piqapoo hurt? Will my dog be comfortable?

We designed Piqapoo with top veterinarians. The well-being of your dog is our first priority. Piqapoo’s soft silicone cushions fit comfortably on your dog's tail without hurting him at all.

 

How long can I leave the clip on my dog's tail?

Piqapoo is so soft and creates almost no pressure, so you can leave it on for as long as your walk takes.

 

Can my dog run, sit, play and wag his tail while wearing the device?

Absolutely, your dog can move and behave as usual.

 

Does using Piqapoo require training?

Piqapoo doesn’t require training, although some dogs may need a few tries to adapt. We found that within a few days of using Piqapoo, most dogs get excited when they see their owner reaching for Piqapoo, letting them know it's time to go out for a walk. 

For further instructions please refer to HOW TO POOCHY.

 

Will my hands ever come in contact with waste?

Never. Using Piqapoo will keep your hands - and the ground - 100% clean at all times.

 

Is Piqapoo environmentally friendly?

Our bags are approximately 80% smaller than the average poo bag, so that the amount of wasted material is reduced to a minimum. Using Piqapoo also means droppings never touch the ground, thereby minimizing health hazards and pollution caused by dog fecal matter.

 

Does Piqapoo fit any dog breed or size?

Piqapoo was designed with top veterinarians to be comfortable for dogs of all breeds and sizes. When you order a Piqapoo, we will contact you to get your dog’s size information and send you the appropriate Piqapoo. 
 

Does Piqapoo work with other animals?

Piqapoo was designed specifically for dogs according to the dog anatomy and tail shape. It's not designed to work or be comfortable for other animals.

 

Does it matter if my dog is male or female?

No, Piqapoo works perfectly well with both male and female dogs.

 

What about dogs with short tails?

Piqapoo fits any dog with a tail 2 inches or longer.

 

Can Piqapoo handle diarrhea?

Piqapoo is the only available solution that can easily collect any kind of waste, including diarrhea.

 

Is Piqapoo safe for kids?

Yes, made of quality materials and too big to swallow, Piqapoo is safe.

 

What colors are available?

Currently, Piqapoo comes in 3 color combinations: White and blue, white and green, white and pink. 

One of our Reach Goals is to add 3 more colors if we hit $300,000.

 

Can a clip or bag be designed upon request?

At the moment, no. In the future, we plan to provide our human and canine customers with customized options.

 

How long does the clip last?

The clip is designed to last at least one year.

 

Can I wash the clip with water? How should it be cleaned?

Yes, washing the clip is not a problem, although the clip is designed to stay clean all the time. Our beta customers' tests show 100% clean clips 100% of the time.

story:
SAROS can provide a sustainable fresh water supply for remote islands and coastal regions without using fossil fuels or electricity by using wave energy, operating completely off the grid.

Ocean waves contain a tremendous amount of energy, and even small waves seen all around the world can have a greater energy density than wind and solar. The evidence is seen in ocean waves’ ability to toss around massive ships, rip apart naval structures, or even just knock you off your feet at a day at the beach. SAROS uses the enormous forces generated by ocean waves to pump water through a reverse osmosis desalination system. Desalination is a notoriously expensive and energy-hungry process, so what better place to use the vast amount of energy found in the ocean?

 

How can SAROS help?

Currently, water can be almost $5 a gallon in locations experiencing water scarcity. Once our buoy is deployed to a pilot location, the clean water produced will be less than 1 cent per gallon. At that phase of the pilot:

$10 = 1000 gallons of clean water, enough for a family of 4 for 21 days 

$25 = 2500 gallons of clean water, enough for a family of 4 for 52 days

$30 = 3000 gallons of clean water, enough for a family of 4 for 63 days

$50 = 5000 gallons of clean water, enough for a family of 4 for 104 days

$100= 10,000 gallons of clean water, enough for a family of 4 for 208 days

According to WHO guideline, each individual person should have access to 12 gallons a day for drinking, sanitation and cooking.

As the SAROS buoy rises and falls with passing swells, it works against its mooring tether to drive the pumps underneath the hood of the buoy. These pumps intake seawater and pump it back to shore under pressure. Before entering the desalination system, a device which we call the WaveBank transforms the surges of incoming water from the buoy into a smooth, steady stream of water into the reverse osmosis system. SAROS uses tried and true, off-the-shelf reverse osmosis systems which are among the most efficient systems in the world. These systems feature an energy recovery device that acts like a turbocharger for the incoming seawater, boosting the incoming pressure, as well as providing massive energy savings. The water that comes out is fresh, clean, and ready to drink! No chemicals or pollutants are added at any point, and reverse osmosis removes salt, bacteria, and any other harmful contents from the seawater. All this powered only by the motion of the ocean.
 

While we’re seeking collaborative efforts with researchers, organizations and strategic partners to further advance our program, we need YOUR initial support to help us get our project above water. By supporting our campaign, you’ll be helping us make strides to get fresh water to people who need it the most all around the world. Join us in our efforts to responsibly turn waves into fresh water. Your support is what will make all the difference. All of the money raised from this campaign will go into testing pilot programs in locations around the world,
 

A significant supply of energy exists in our oceans, yet harnessing this energy in a useful and efficient manner has been a challenge...until now.


We decided to take on that challenge and developed our first proof of concept. After building multiple systems and conducting countless tests, we took everything we learned and used it to build our latest prototype. From our first prototype to our current prototype, we have come a long way and hope that you’ll help us continue our research and development.
 

 


 


 

Reverse osmosis (RO) is currently one of the most efficient ways to desalinate seawater. A single RO membrane not much bigger than a rolled newspaper can produce over a hundred gallons a day of fresh water, making it immensely more practical than desalination through other means. Unfortunately, RO requires pressures in the range of 800psi, meaning desalination is still a significant task. This is where SAROS enters the process.

 

Engineers Chris Matthews and Justin Sonnett have kept the design of SAROS simple. By using common components, they’re able to place them above water and on shore to avoid complicated installation and maintenance. By concentrating only on fresh water production and not electricity production, SAROS has much higher efficiency. By eliminating energy-related emissions, SAROS’ new design and adaptability provide a unique opportunity to supply clean water, expand the water supply, preserve ecological and environmental needs of communities and address economic issues of energy and water pricing.
 

 

Fresh water scarcity has become a primary global issue and current market technologies focus on large-scale desalination plants, which are harmful to the environment and have high operating expenses. While small-scale desalination systems are on the market, they have complicated components, don’t promote sustainability and require imported fossil fuels or large amounts of electricity. Supporting SAROS’ sustainable ways will help make the endeavors to create fresh water better for the world and more attainable for others.
 

Typical desalination processes can be taxing on the environment, especially coastal communities. Unlike traditional methods that require a huge amount of power, typically generated by burning fuel oil, SAROS uses clean, renewable wave energy and produces zero emissions and minimal salt brine concentration.

SAROS also creates the opportunity to bring desalination to less developed regions that are in dire need of fresh drinking water. By removing dependencies on outside resources, communities will be able to focus on their daily tasks as SAROS provides them with a consistent supply of new, fresh water.

SAROS can cut the cost currently associated with producing fresh water in half. By utilizing only the energy within ocean waves to power the desalination process, SAROS eliminates the need for fossil fuel and electricity, which is typically required for traditional desalination methods. It’s time for everyone to have access to affordable, clean water.

The innovative, wave-powered technology used in SAROS could also be configured to do things like generate electricity, autonomously pump water to clean up oil spills or even filter plastic from our ocean. The amount of potential good that SAROS can bring is as exciting as it is endless.

The global water shortage affects people from around the world, especially those in challenging economic situations who can’t afford costly water delivery options. Imagine if you had to walk hours every day just to get fresh water for you and your family. Often times, families in Africa, South Asia and the Middle East designate women and children, particularly young girls, to be responsible for gathering water.

Women in areas with water shortages can spend several hours a day in the pursuit of fresh water, taking away from the time they could be using to work or pursue an education. Sometimes women and children even drop out of school for reasons related to water scarcity.

By introducing fresh water sources closer to these communities that need it the most, you can help alleviate these issues. Studies show that girls’ school attendance increased significantly for every hour reduction in water collection. Children are also healthier when clean water is accessible. By introducing eco-friendly solutions, such as SAROS, you have the potential to impact women and children in important educational, economic and political ways.


 


SAROS has been named a finalist at the 2016 Savannah Ocean Exchange where we will present our sustainable water innovation this November!SAROS has also received plenty of awards and recognition including being named as a semi-finalist at Hello Tomorrow Competition and the St. Andrew Prize for the Environment.
 


SAROS started as a senior design project at the University of North Carolina, Charlotte. Chris Matthews and Justin Sonnett, then seniors in the Mechanical Engineering program, had a goal to prove that it is possible to sufficiently pressurize water and perform Reverse Osmosis (RO) using only wave energy. After graduation, Chris and Justin were given the opportunity to advance the SAROS technology and provide a solution for the water scarcity problem plaguing coastal communities. SAROS’ mission is far from over. In fact, it’s just the beginning and it starts with you.
 

 

 

We firmly believe SAROS is an answer to fresh water supply issues currently experienced by isolated island and coastal communities and will become a player in the much-needed diversification of even the developed world’s water supply.


Our team of advisors is comprised of industry leaders with decades of experience in the financial, energy and sustainability sectors. These members have dedicated valuable time and resources and have contributed to the success of our inaugural venture, SAROS Desalination.


 

 

By proving that we can turn ocean waves into clean, drinkable, fresh water with our first SAROS prototype, the team is now moving to the next phase of testing and optimizing our current prototype. By focusing solely on water production and targeting areas in need of sustainable, small-scale desalination, our team has identified a clear market for advancing the SAROS technology.


 

Chris has always enjoyed tackling new and difficult problems, and is now taking the opportunity to face two of the world’s biggest challenges: the global need for fresh water, and the ever growing threat of climate change. An environmentalist and humanitarian, Chris is using his passion for problem solving, and his training as an engineer, to help make SAROS a success. As co-creator of SAROS and a founding member of the company, his main engineering focus centers on mathematical and computer modeling, as well as analysis of system characteristics and performance. Additionally he focuses on the design and implementation of instrumentation and data acquisition methods for testing.
 

His whole life, Justin has been fascinated by how things work, their form and their function. Passionate about engineering, technology and design, he’s experienced with bringing innovative ideas from the back of the napkin to reality. As one of the founding members and Director of Research & Development, Justin’s role spans engineering and design in order to implement creative solutions, optimize unit performance and maximize customer value. A lifelong surfer and lover of anything related to the beach, SAROS gives him the unique opportunity to merge his love for the waves with his passion for design. Justin loves to tinker and enjoys taking what he learns both in the garage and in the water, and applying it to engineering topics in the office.

 



Organización Pro Ambiente Sustentable (OPAS)

 

We’re currently partnering with an environmental non-profit, Organización Pro Ambiente Sustentable, that is located in Puerto Rico and focuses on implementing environmental programs to achieve sustainable island communities. Providing sustainable, fresh water solutions to areas in need will be a focal point of the partnership with OPAS. As part of this partnership, we will be conducting a pilot study on Cajo de Muertos, Ponce. SAROS will not just be supplying drinking water to this island population, but will be supporting the protection of the island by branching out to flora conservation as well.

 

Colorado Haiti Project (CHP)

 

SAROS is working with the Colorado Haiti Project (CHP) to initiate a pilot project in the community of Petit Trou de Nippes. CHP works in partnership with rural Haitian communities to support their rise out of extreme poverty. While construction of 12 safe water wells has eased their water crisis, Haitian groundwater is jeopardized by encroaching salt water. Additionally, the devastation wrought by a hurricane like Hurricane Matthew demonstrates just how fragile safe water sources are in these areas. SAROS has the potential to solve this crisis with a more sustainable solution.
 


 

Does SAROS make electricity?

 

SAROS does not currently make electricity. We could adapt the unit to do so, but our number one goal is to produce fresh water for people in need. We’ve found the economics are more favorable by focusing directly on producing water. By skipping the middle step of generating electricity and only desalinating water, the process becomes more efficient, simpler and less expensive.

 

What is desalination?

 

Desalination is the process of removing salt from water. With SAROS, we’re able to take seawater and remove enough salt to make drinkable water that can also be used for irrigation.

 

How much water does a SAROS unit make?

 

One SAROS machine can make around 3,500 gallons per day, and we can group units together to provide up to 50,000 gallons per site (10-20 units).

 

Could SAROS be used in California?

 

Sure! SAROS can be used anywhere located near an ocean, but California has such a dense and large population that our device may not be the best option for their widespread drought conditions. Desalination has a wide range of useful scales - you can find large desalination plants that make 50 million gallons a day and simpler systems that make just 100 gallons a day. Just like a single wind farm couldn’t possibly supply all of Los Angeles’ power demands, a single wave-powered desalination unit couldn’t possibly supply enough fresh water to a city as big as LA. However, a SAROS unit has the ability to aid smaller communities and townships in need, which is why they are our target markets.

 

How do you get the water back to shore?

 

Currently, we simply pump the water back to shore through a small, flexible hose.

 

Why hasn’t anyone done this before?

 

The time for a wave-powered desalination unit has never been better than right now. Environmental concerns and water shortages are some of the hottest topics today. Innovation and development require the right amount of ingredients - money, motivation and knowledge - to make things happen. We have a very unique combination of those things that allow us to tackle something that others haven’t followed up on in the past.

 

Who needs/could benefit from a SAROS unit?

 

There are over 230 million people living on islands and in coastal communities that lack access to fresh water, as well as the resources and infrastructures to use traditional methods of retrieving water for drinking, washing and cooking. These communities are the target populations for a SAROS unit. Though really anybody looking for a less-expensive, environmentally-friendly, sustainable source of desalinated water could benefit from a SAROS unit as long as they lived close to the ocean.

 

How much water do people really need?

 

While this depends on the situation, a typical US household (family of 4) uses 400 gallons of water a day. The average person in the United States uses about 80-120 gallons of water per day and the largest use of household water is flushing a toilet. In “developing areas,” the World Health Organization reports that individuals use 11.6 gallons of water per day. In an emergency, an individual needs only 2 gallons of drinking water to survive, whereas 5-10 gallons would be required for eating, drinking and basic sanitation. This means that in an emergency, one SAROS unit could provide drinking water for 1,750 people. It’s also possible that one unit could provide the daily water requirements in a “developing area” for over 300 people.

 

Are we really running out of water? There seems to be plenty where I live.

 

Water usage and conservation are probably some of the most poorly understood concepts today. Water is a finite resource, but very few people treat it like one. The global average water footprint is 1,000 gallons of water per day, which includes domestic, industrial and agricultural usage. Domestic water use (household) is 8% of that total. Industrial use is 22% (i.e. food processing or clothing manufacturing) and agricultural is 70% (irrigation). It takes water to make the clothes we wear and the food we eat, let alone to get a drink when we’re thirsty. As water resources diminish around the world we will all be impacted. Coming up with sustainable solutions for our global water needs becomes more compelling every day.

 

How much does the water produced by a SAROS unit cost?

 

We’re on track to bring the cost of a gallon of desalinated water to 6/10 of a penny (0.6 cents) using the SAROS unit. Non-desalinated water is less expensive because it’s purified fresh water (usually from lake or groundwater). For example, in Charlotte, North Carolina (non-desalinated) water from a utility costs 3/10 of a penny. In Malibu, California water from a utility costs 8/10 of a penny due to demand and water shortage conditions. Desalinated water costs more, but it’s the only affordable, sustainable solution for smaller communities located near the ocean. For example, in the Virgin Islands it costs about 1.8 cents per gallon to buy water from a utility. SAROS’ water is about a third of that price.

 

How does the SAROS team collect enough data to know how to better their design?


Opening a second office in Wilmington, NC has provided the SAROS team with the opportunity to have the buoy on the water 24/7. This helps accelerate the development process and provides the team with valuable data on how it performs in varying wave conditions.

The evidence is seen in ocean waves’ ability to toss around massive ships, rip apart naval structures, or even just knock you off your feet at a day at the beach. SAROS uses the enormous forces generated by ocean waves to pump water through a reverse osmosis desalination system. Desalination is a notoriously expensive and energy-hungry process, so what better place to use the vast amount of energy found in the ocean? How can SAROS help?Currently, water can be almost $5 a gallon in locations experiencing water scarcity. Once our buoy is deployed to a pilot location, the clean water produced will be less than 1 cent per gallon. story:
– How can house facades produce oxygen and improve the living environment? –

 

 

 
 

BIOBLINDS - "The Green Skyline Initiative"

Bioblinds provide "oxygen machines" as organic curtains for individual windows or entire houses and, theoretically, complete skylines. They are a "speculative design" project with essentially the vision to offer an open-source-toolkit or online-configurator to build fully functional window blinds made of plants in a Do-It-Yourself/(DIY)-design. All research concerning this project is iterative and to reference Anna Tsing (2018), grows out of the continuous collaborative work.

 

 

THE IDEA

A digital toolkit with building instructions and e.g. shopping lists for free download in order to build modular or integrated oxygen machines. These are intended for self-cultivation above doors or windows - with products from the hardware store and special tendril or hanging plants. This is a kind of ‘Vertical Gardening 2.0’, or ‘kinetic plant curtains’ for windows, entire houses and thus theoretically complete skylines. The tendrils should not be injured or stressed too much. This is possible thanks to a special mechanism elaborated by a group of amateur engineers, designers, communication and cultural consultants around the creative office Jan Engel. 

 

The direct effects are obvious: Each wall could be green, the oxygen production could be increased accordingly, energy could be saved by cooling effects in the living area, the living comfort is increased and urban contexts are freed of gray.

 

 

Just quickly talking about the functions: Bioblinds can block the sun-light and reduce UV radiation, at the same time they provide privacy to the degree you want, as they can be opened and closed, and they also function as thermal isolations. Ergo Bioblinds somehow are “vertical gardening 2.0”. You can even grow food.

 

 

 

Our aim after this campaign:

Since it is intended to be a democratic DIY offer, the Bioblinds team is planning a joint land-art project in the 30th anniversary year of the German reunification – with all those interested as bearers of the message of democratic freedom. The idea of ​​Bioblinds should stand as a sign of personal development. For this purpose, the group wants to build a two-story research cube in Osterwieck, on the former inner-German border. This should generate necessary social, mechanical and design data, bringing together both humans and plants of different cultures.

 

WHAT DOES PR ACTIVATION ENTAIL? WHAT AM I SUPPOSED TO FUND HERE?

By "PR-activation" we refer to means and measures to reach some publications and attention for this project within Germany but also world wide. For example, we would put all efforts in creating a relationship with chosen media in order to develop stories together for their channels. Ergo journalists need to travel to Goslar, see the prototype and get relevant information in a way that is tailored to their narrative needs. By this step we hope to enrich our story, find more partners and also a host for the land to build our research cube. PR-activation also entails going one layer deeper into the planning. In detail by creating more technical renderings for specific contexts. Please have also a look at the chapter below about our plans when it comes to "Timing and Budget".

 

The time of the anniversary of "30 Years of German Unity" in 2019/2020 enhances the message of Bioblinds: “Democratic freedom and personal self-actualisation.”

 

This is because they, figuratively in this context, transform the former iron curtain into a green curtain, and a former watchtower into a transcultural interaction and community space. As a DIY product, Bioblinds make "democratic freedom" tangible and position this important value in a direct economic and social context.

 

 

THE IMPACT

Bioblinds redirect the cycle of “grey eating green” into “green co-existing with whatever there is or will be”. Grey here stands for urban centers and mega-cities. Bioblinds not only enlarge the sqm-area of plants in urban environments but also add oxygen and cool the interiors. Therefore, Bioblinds have a direct impact on the world climate and relate to the “Fridays for Future” movement. Bioblinds can be applied individually or as a community project, to one flat in a house or to the entire house. They can add a structured organic layer over each architecture and they can even be integrated in the planning of the housing or even of a city. For that please get in touch directly.

 

THE PLANT POSSIBILITIES

Bioblinds function with a variety of plants. So far we did research with ivy, wild wine, stingless blackberry, hop, blauregen, incense, indian mint and dichondra plants. We want to elaborate DIY-toolkits that strongly depend on the climate, personal choice and the plant. In the "research cube" we want to collect as much data for different plants and therefore climate zones as possible. 

 

 

CALL FOR SUPPORTERS

To reach our goal, we are looking for supporters for the next step, the "reseach cube", the "prototype V" at the former inner-German border.

 

We have to do more research to be able to offer the necessary data for a globally adaptable toolkit – so that really everybody on this planet could do their own Bioblinds. And this research needs to be more elaborated as we ever could do it on our balconies and own houses. That is why we plan the prototype V as a final research cube and also statement for democratic freedom and self-actualisation! Bioblinds not only change how your part of a facade is perceived – most importantly it changes you, as your view with Bioblinds is always calming and beautiful. The idea is designed, especially, for an urban context but, of course, also applicable on the country side or in a desert. 

 

 

WHAT KIND OF DATA DO WE WANT TO COLLECT IN THE RESEARCH-CUBE

We want to know what people think about the idea. What they would improve or change. And we will try to answer questions like: What plant needs which mechanism-adaptations? What plants work in which parts of the world? What is specifically important when you work with ivy? Can the general mechanism be even more elaborated by collaborative stimuli? How will people move in a unique place like this? How will they use the Bioblinds? How will they interact? How will they create new rooms and break down walls between humans? We aim at collecting this kind of social, scientific, mechanical but also design data and put it all into the toolkit. 

 

This is very important for us as we want this idea to be fulfilled TOGETHER with everybody who is interested. We want to include as much knowledge and input as possible. 

 

 

THE NEXT NECESSARY STEP

But before this becomes possible we need to “PR-activate” the project to different stakeholders. Already during the construction phase in spring 2020 we want to provide a space for the context of the German Unity Jubilee, e.g. with "live East / West Influencer Talks" or "Community Gardening Workshops" as well as other intergenerational happenings. "Organic events" such as "the groundbreaking ceremony", "the topping-out ceremony" and "the opening" round off the communication potential. 

A potential partner could position her- or himself as sustainable, innovative and future-oriented.

 

We actually see each contributor, and even if it’s only with your feedback in the comments, but especially each Backer, as a partner to create the future. 

 

Do you also want, that all people, whether in the countryside, or in the urban centers of this world, can build sustainable "oxygen machines" in front of their windows, add the amount of plants in cities and reduce their energy needs? 

 

Then help us with your support!

 

 

OUR TEAM

Our team consists out of five people, two generations and two countries.

Together with the product designer Tino Seubert from London, the lobbyist Anne Jacobs from Berlin, the economy expert Rüdiger Engel from Goslar and the cultural consultant Judith Jacobs, also from Berlin, Jan Engel forms the "Bioblinds – The Green Skyline Initiative"-core-team. Jan is a communication consultant freelancer since 2013. Before that he used to be working in Berlin as the director of events at Scholz & Friends Berlin and later as a CEO of the Blumberry, both agencies in the WPP-network. Jan had the dream for this initiative when he was 17 years old, staying at a ground-level-apartment in New York City with an 'ugly view'. For more information about the single team members, please click at their profiles or contact us directly.

 

 

OUR AIM FOR THIS CROWD-FUNDING CAMPAIGN

In order to reach our “The Green Skyline Initiative”, we want to get an indication from the crowd-funding community, if you think it is a silly idea or if you guys like the idea – that's kind of it. If you like it, we will use the funds to create material that helps to convince more supporters, partners, (e.g. a host for the land), ... . In the very very best case the funded money is already enough to build the prototype V and to do more research and to translate the findings into free open-source data. In short: We want to further work on the free DIY toolkit for every person around the world – no matter what. Just in case we cannot activate the envisioned research cube, we would still try everything in order to do as much research for you guys and all people, interested in Bioblinds, as possible. The findings we collected during the prototypes I-IV already form a solid basis of data, including technical and mechanical specifics, design principles, plant knowledge, shopping-lists, etc. – but they need more elaboration and especially internationalisation. 

 

 

OUR CHALLENGES

This project faces many challenges to be realized. The way sketched out here, with the help of the research cube at the former inner-german border, is just one possibility that would organically develop in our course of iterative prototyping. We checked various options and with this we reach the highest ratio between research data, costs, attention and relevancy. As already mentioned, the collected data will entail plant specifics, social data, scientific data, mechanism specifics, water systems, design proposals, technical drawings, perhaps even an online-configurator, and definately shopping lists. We plan to provide everything as a download with feedback and contribution or donation possibilities – but in general for free. We believe in open-source and look for likewise-minded people that believe that Commons can change the world – and why shouldn't we see the urban environments as Commons? They are! And they can produce oxygen! Each square meter! :-) Bioblinds is how to make cities into jungles! We want to provide the first edition of data in English.

Our utopian (?) dream is to activate the realisation of prototype V, the iterative research cube, at the former inner-German border in 2020 and to be able to provide all knowledge and down-streamed data in autumn 2020 – for everybody to build their own Bioblinds in spring 2021. 

 

 

PLEASE HELP US WITH YOUR FUNDS, FEEDBACK AND SUPPORT.

 

Request press material if needed.

 

Watch the 2:55min video again: 

https://vimeo.com/372155680

 

Watch again the 8 sek trailor:

https://vimeo.com/372014312

 

 

 

If you still want to know more about the background, please continue reading. :-) 

 

 

CONCERNING OUR PROTOTYPES

We built four different iterative prototypes in different sizes and all (!) of them worked. But they are not fully designed yet - untill now we elaborated the core mechanisms and all the construction needs and challenges for the DIY toolkit. Ergo our prototype IV, the most elaborated one and the one shown in the pictures and videos at the single yellow house ((not the envisioned research cube)), is totally DIY and already helps us on our way to create a free digital DIY toolbox. And, most importantly, the prototype works flawlessly! For more material on the existing prototypes, you are more than welcome to visit the showcase-prototype in Goslar, Germany during a "showcase event" or on special request as a perk. Of course, we can also send you more videos and pictures of it.  The next prototype V, the one we try to get attention and support for, here at this platform, will be necessary to extract more data on different plants and different mechanisms. All findings at the hopefully-to-become-true prototype V, the envision research cube, will be elaborated to one digital free downloadable data toolkit. These data will be open-source in order to be able to collectively elaborate the idea further and make parts of skylines green as a post-human commons movement.  But after many years of research and prototyping we need your help. With your funds you will let us know, if we should continue to put our personal resources into this vision. We are open for all kinds of feedback. We put this project into concept stage, as our product is sustainable and does NOT need a power-supply as regulated in the community guidelines of this platform. But again, we do have working prototypes –  in real-size on a real window outside of a real house (see pictures). And the prototype IV actually is a commissioned art piece as a holistic conceptual service of www.janengel.berlin

 

Below you see the length of our prototype IV plants and how fast they are growing after the initial installation. They grow very structured and beautiful. Especially during a wind or storm the Bioblinds move very elegantly and breath live into the architecture without any risks of breaking the window glas – due to our special construction.

 

 

CONCERNING THE "ORIGINAL BIOBLINDS"

We are able to offer the "Original Bioblinds" for individual clients or sponsors – as we did with prototype IV. Our unique mechanisms, plant selection and care process plus the overall design features, ensure, already now, perfectly working Bioblinds. Be the first having original Bioblinds!!! Individual Bioblinds can also be sponsored by companies for special locations like train stations, parks, land art or other kinds of buildings or places. Due to a construction phase and a planting phase, this offer strongly depends on several circumstances, like the climate zone, the time of year, the architecture, the architect, the distance to our team. If you want to be the first one having this breath-taking, beautiful innovation, get in touch over hello@thegreenskylineinitiative.com and we will try to make your personal “Original Bioblinds”, perhaps even with flowers, reality – ASAP. :-) 

 

 

CONCERNING OUR PERKS

Obviously, we can only offer rather spiritual and appreciation perks. The main thing certainly is, to be part of creating the future and helping developing a free speculative design, open-source technique that could transform cities. The fuzzy feeling in your stomache you will get with each help you do, no matter how little it is. For those of you that want to see the prototype IV, we offer several exclusive perks to come to Goslar (Germany) and stay in our guest room. We can then discuss the prototype IV, further involvement and we can show you the beautiful city of Goslar. Each perk helps us covering the expenses we had and will have in order to make this dream come true – this is exactly where our "Sales / Off Percentages" come from: For us the amount you fund is way more worth than that specific amount. We highly appreciate each help. Oh, and we also offer perks for corporate partners. Here we offer to include their logo on "The Green Skyline Initiative" homepage and in case we get the research cube built, the logo will also physically appear there. You and your company will be positioned as innovators. Additionally the research cube could be used for special events, if realized.  Another possible main perk (and also normal service of janengel.berlin) is to let us check if your house or flat qualifies for a Bioblinds installation and then get your Bioblind (depending on climate zone, space, light, plant, etc.). We promise that we try to offer you a direct and as fast as possible way to your personal Bioblinds. Obviously, the price here is highly individual – therefore, please indicate your interest with your fund. We will screen the possibilities and make a ranking for these first customers. So far we have requests to build Bioblinds in Japan close to Tokyo, Katar and Hong Kong. In such cases, the client obviously has to pay for the travel expenses, necessary planning, constructing and planting. 

Additionally we are providing another very unique perk. If you or your company want to get a strategic and integrated communication consultancy, idea development, personal coaching, CEO coaching, narration consultancy, design consultancy or just a philosophical speculative design discussion, you can book us for a skype consultation for a special rate – we calculate here with 30 minutes. 

We are also super proud to have another perk. In order to show that we want each person and their input to be seen in the Bioblinds-Vision we thought about a free perk for christmas: We want to try to use two variables for a new approach to data sonification: First, the frequency in which people contribute in the first days,  and second, the amounts that are funded. These two variables, as anonymous data sets, will be the basis of the Bioblinds-song that we want to offer for a free download on christmas. So every funder becomes part of the Bioblinds-Song. For that we work together with a math expert and an amazing composer. Let's see. :-)

On top of this all we offer two very personal perks from our own collection of beloved things. We have a beautiful iconic coffeetable book about bamboo "Die wunderbare Welt des Bambus". And we have the painting "Before" by Australian artist @bradteodoruk (on Insta) . 

If your wishes entail more than one item, please contact us. These specific perks are exclusively available through our campaign. 

 

CONCERNING OUR TIMING AND BUDGET

We want to be transparent from the start. This step to "PR-activate" this research-cube on our overall journey to elaborate globally adaptable and scalable Bioblinds-open-source-data for each architecture for free for everybody, is our third step. The last years we worked on steps 1 and 2 (idea, research, plant finding, prototyping, planning crowd-funding) on our own for free because we believe that this simple idea democratically could change urban contexts completely and in a sustainable way. The real costs when it comes to talking to experts, creating technical drawings, renderings, buying parts for prototypes and different mechanisms accumulated to over 40.000 EUR in the last four years. For the PR-activation we calculated, as you can see, 10.000 EUR, the search for an investor (develop presentations and approach potential partners, etc.) we pinned up to 20.000 EUR, the actual step 5 to prepare the construction (getting permits, etc.) is calculated with 25.000 EUR. And this is only before the construction takes place. Step 6, the construction, will cost according to first estimates by specialists around 100.000 EUR, the step 7, the planting and care over three months adds up to 50.000 EUR. Followed by all these steps comes the final research phase (step 8) and the elaboration and supply of the open-source-data (step 9), which was calculated with another 20.000 EUR. Adding the Indiegogo costs (5-8%), bank costs (5-8%) and a puffer (10%), we end up at around 374.220 EUR. We plan to fulfill these steps until autumn 2020 – so every person world wide could build their own part of "The Green Skyline Initiative" in spring 2021. Stay tuned on our website for news and eventually hopefully all data! 

 

Thanks for reading through this. We highly appreciate your interest in our idea and vision. 

 

Important note: Even if we wanted we couldn't get universal Bioblinds ready as a product, as it always is a highly individual project. Our toolkit aims at making it possible for each person to adapt our data in the way needed to fit the local requirements. This is a very complex challenge, we are happy to take – in the best case with your help for the step of "PR-activation" or more. As a commons vision this is a long-term project and therefore we have to operate in steps – but also here we are open for feedback and a high fund could actually make our entire vision possible with just this one step – perhaps depending on you. :-)

 

We just want to see the vision of "The Green Skyline Initiative" at as many places and buildings as possible and therefore all the positive climatic impacts. Since you are already here, reading this, please, please help. :-) 

 

For any questions, more information, feedback, or anything else, please check our Q&A’s or simply write via email to Hello@TheGreenSkylineInitiative.com or via Instagram @thegreenskylineinitiative 
https://www.instagram.com/the_green_skyline_ini...

 

Last note: As most questions arrived us so far in German, we did the Q&A in German but we are more than happy to translate them for you if needed. 

 

COME AND JOIN "THE GREEN SKYLINE INITIATIVE"!

 

 

 

Here you find again our "Web 1.0 Countdown". Its time to act! Join!

 

THANK YOU!!!!!!

Sincerly,

Your Bioblinds-Team
story_txt:
– How can house facades produce oxygen and improve the living environment? – 


 

 
 BIOBLINDS - "The Green Skyline Initiative"Bioblinds provide "oxygen machines" as organic curtains for individual windows or entire houses and, theoretically, complete skylines. They are a "speculative design" project with essentially the vision to offer an open-source-toolkit or online-configurator to build fully functional window blinds made of plants in a Do-It-Yourself/(DIY)-design. All research concerning this project is iterative and to reference Anna Tsing (2018), grows out of the continuous collaborative work. 

 
THE IDEAA digital toolkit with building instructions and e.g. shopping lists for free download in order to build modular or integrated oxygen machines. These are intended for self-cultivation above doors or windows - with products from the hardware store and special tendril or hanging plants. This is a kind of ‘Vertical Gardening 2.0’, or ‘kinetic plant curtains’ for windows, entire houses and thus theoretically complete skylines. The tendrils should not be injured or stressed too much. This is possible thanks to a special mechanism elaborated by a group of amateur engineers, designers, communication and cultural consultants around the creative office Jan Engel.  The direct effects are obvious: Each wall could be green, the oxygen production could be increased accordingly, energy could be saved by cooling effects in the living area, the living comfort is increased and urban contexts are freed of gray.  Just quickly talking about the functions: Bioblinds can block the sun-light and reduce UV radiation, at the same time they provide privacy to the degree you want, as they can be opened and closed, and they also function as thermal isolations. Ergo Bioblinds somehow are “vertical gardening 2.0”. You can even grow food.   Our aim after this campaign:Since it is intended to be a democratic DIY offer, the Bioblinds team is planning a joint land-art project in the 30th anniversary year of the German reunification – with all those interested as bearers of the message of democratic freedom. The idea of ​​Bioblinds should stand as a sign of personal development. For this purpose, the group wants to build a two-story research cube in Osterwieck, on the former inner-German border. This should generate necessary social, mechanical and design data, bringing together both humans and plants of different cultures. WHAT DOES PR ACTIVATION ENTAIL? WHAT AM I SUPPOSED TO FUND HERE?By "PR-activation" we refer to means and measures to reach some publications and attention for this project within Germany but also world wide. For example, we would put all efforts in creating a relationship with chosen media in order to develop stories together for their channels. Ergo journalists need to travel to Goslar, see the prototype and get relevant information in a way that is tailored to their narrative needs. By this step we hope to enrich our story, find more partners and also a host for the land to build our research cube. PR-activation also entails going one layer deeper into the planning. In detail by creating more technical renderings for specific contexts. Please have also a look at the chapter below about our plans when it comes to "Timing and Budget". The time of the anniversary of "30 Years of German Unity" in 2019/2020 enhances the message of Bioblinds: “Democratic freedom and personal self-actualisation.”  This is because they, figuratively in this context, transform the former iron curtain into a green curtain, and a former watchtower into a transcultural interaction and community space. As a DIY product, Bioblinds make "democratic freedom" tangible and position this important value in a direct economic and social context.  THE IMPACTBioblinds redirect the cycle of “grey eating green” into “green co-existing with whatever there is or will be”. Grey here stands for urban centers and mega-cities. Bioblinds not only enlarge the sqm-area of plants in urban environments but also add oxygen and cool the interiors. Therefore, Bioblinds have a direct impact on the world climate and relate to the “Fridays for Future” movement. Bioblinds can be applied individually or as a community project, to one flat in a house or to the entire house. They can add a structured organic layer over each architecture and they can even be integrated in the planning of the housing or even of a city. In such cases, the client obviously has to pay for the travel expenses, necessary planning, constructing and planting. Additionally we are providing another very unique perk. If you or your company want to get a strategic and integrated communication consultancy, idea development, personal coaching, CEO coaching, narration consultancy, design consultancy or just a philosophical speculative design discussion, you can book us for a skype consultation for a special rate – we calculate here with 30 minutes. We are also super proud to have another perk. In order to show that we want each person and their input to be seen in the Bioblinds-Vision we thought about a free perk for christmas: We want to try to use two variables for a new approach to data sonification: First, the frequency in which people contribute in the first days,  and second, the amounts that are funded. These two variables, as anonymous data sets, will be the basis of the Bioblinds-song that we want to offer for a free download on christmas. So every funder becomes part of the Bioblinds-Song. For that we work together with a math expert and an amazing composer. Let's see. :-)On top of this all we offer two very personal perks from our own collection of beloved things. We have a beautiful iconic coffeetable book about bamboo "Die wunderbare Welt des Bambus". And we have the painting "Before" by Australian artist @bradteodoruk (on Insta) . If your wishes entail more than one item, please contact us. These specific perks are exclusively available through our campaign.  CONCERNING OUR TIMING AND BUDGETWe want to be transparent from the start. This step to "PR-activate" this research-cube on our overall journey to elaborate globally adaptable and scalable Bioblinds-open-source-data for each architecture for free for everybody, is our third step. The last years we worked on steps 1 and 2 (idea, research, plant finding, prototyping, planning crowd-funding) on our own for free because we believe that this simple idea democratically could change urban contexts completely and in a sustainable way. The real costs when it comes to talking to experts, creating technical drawings, renderings, buying parts for prototypes and different mechanisms accumulated to over 40.000 EUR in the last four years. For the PR-activation we calculated, as you can see, 10.000 EUR, the search for an investor (develop presentations and approach potential partners, etc.) we pinned up to 20.000 EUR, the actual step 5 to prepare the construction (getting permits, etc.) is calculated with 25.000 EUR. And this is only before the construction takes place. Step 6, the construction, will cost according to first estimates by specialists around 100.000 EUR, the step 7, the planting and care over three months adds up to 50.000 EUR. Followed by all these steps comes the final research phase (step 8) and the elaboration and supply of the open-source-data (step 9), which was calculated with another 20.000 EUR. Adding the Indiegogo costs (5-8%), bank costs (5-8%) and a puffer (10%), we end up at around 374.220 EUR. We plan to fulfill these steps until autumn 2020 – so every person world wide could build their own part of "The Green Skyline Initiative" in spring 2021. Stay tuned on our website for news and eventually hopefully all data!  Thanks for reading through this. We highly appreciate your interest in our idea and vision.  Important note: Even if we wanted we couldn't get universal Bioblinds ready as a product, as it always is a highly individual project. Our toolkit aims at making it possible for each person to adapt our data in the way needed to fit the local requirements. This is a very complex challenge, we are happy to take – in the best case with your help for the step of "PR-activation" or more. As a commons vision this is a long-term project and therefore we have to operate in steps – but also here we are open for feedback and a high fund could actually make our entire vision possible with just this one step – perhaps depending on you. :-)  We just want to see the vision of "The Green Skyline Initiative" at as many places and buildings as possible and therefore all the positive climatic impacts. Since you are already here, reading this, please, please help. :-)  For any questions, more information, feedback, or anything else, please check our Q&A’s or simply write via email to Hello@TheGreenSkylineInitiative.com or via Instagram @thegreenskylineinitiative https://www.instagram.com/the_green_skyline_ini... Last note: As most questions arrived us so far in German, we did the Q&A in German but we are more than happy to translate them for you if needed.  COME AND JOIN "THE GREEN SKYLINE INITIATIVE"!  






 
Here you find again our "Web 1.0 Countdown". Its time to act! Join!








 
THANK YOU!!!!!!
Sincerly,
Your Bioblinds-Team

story:
WHAT ARE WE DOING HERE?

In Filma we can't do everything alone. We need your collaboration to fight against plastic waist.

We are a team of four young entrepreneurs that found the solution to one use Covid plastic waist, we transform them into recycled face masks. You, your children, and the five next generations will suffer the consequences of this new environmental crisis if we do not react NOW. Do you want to help us?

WHY SHOULD YOU CARE ABOUT FILMA'S PROJECT?

Our face-masks made from recycled masks were created to fight against an issue brought by the crazy situation we’re living nowadays. We’ll go down in history as the generations that survived the world-changing pandemic. 

But we won’t let that happen. In FILMA we don’t want to be part of the generations that destroyed our planet due to the overproduction of single-use plastics, especially those produced to combat the pandemic (for example, masks). You don’t want to be part of that generation either. Despite millions of people being told to use face masks, little guidance has been given on how to dispose of or recycle them safely.

                           

                          Mohd RASFAN/AFP

Every month, we use 129 billion face masks worldwide (Enviromental Science & Technology). 

So where’s the problem? Face masks can take over 400 years to decompose. You, your children, and the five next generations will suffer the consequences. We need to reduce the contamination of all of this single-use plastic and we need your help to do it!

Based upon our past experiences, we can expect that around 75% of the masks and other pandemic-related waste will end up in landfill, or floating in our oceans.

Our challenge lies in the health risk that face masks present. They can’t be incinerated nor recycled using traditional systems.

                                     

 

WHY WOULD YOU TRUST US?

We have been working since the beginning of the pandemic with two internacional engineers that have followed us through the whole process and development. 

Before being transformed into 3d printer filament, our masks go through quite the treatment. After being completely disinfected, we separate the materials. They are then sent to the shredder which cut them up into small pieces. Those bits of plastic are finally mixed with some plastic pellets and sent through an extruder. That melts the plastic together, forming our filament.

             

 

In order to assure extreme protection, our face mask is designed to be used with a filter between the two plastic components.

            

  • Made from 3D recycled mask filament.
  • Better fit in the upper part of the nose to reduce exhaled air that leaves the upper part of the nose.
  • The filter holder button has also been changed to improve the click feeling when installing the filter and better locks the filter. The brackets are now very easy to remove.
  • The overall shape was improved to prevent air from entering from the sides.

                    

 

WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP?

FILMA is based out of Barcelona. During the past months, we have been putting up collection points all around the city (schools, pharmacies, hospital, local businesses…) where people can throw out their used masks. The few thousand masks that we’ve collected so far have been used to test and create our prototype.

              

 

We are also starting to gain governmental aid and with extra help we can offer fair paying jobs to those who have lost their jobs or houses due to the pandemic.

In order to implement our process of collection, treatment, and production of recycled masks on a higher scale and in different cities, WE NEED YOUR COLLABORATION AND 5 000€. We want to be as transparent as possible so let’s see what we’re going to do with your help and money:

 

HOW CAN YOU HELP US TO FIGHT AGAINST PLASTIC WASTE?

 

WE NEED ANY KIND OF HELP (NOT JUST MONEY, SHARING IS ALSO CARING) TO SCALE UP YOUR PROJECT AD INTERNATIONALIZE OUR ACTIONS IN THE FIGHT AGAINST PLASTIC WASTE. We know that rewards can be complicated so we’ve explained everything as simple as possible.

If you want to fight plastic waste with us, you can do a variety of things:

  • Share our movement with your family and friends, that would be AWESOME.
  • PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE recycle your face masks at home.
  • Get one of our perks:

#PERK1 0€-5€:     Thank you! You have recycle 50 masks with your donation.

                                      1)*You will receive a diploma via E-mail

#PERK2 5€-10€: Thank you! You have recycle 100 masks with your donation.

                                      1)*You will receive a diploma via E-mail

                                      2)*Sustainable Filma's stickers pack (view image)

#PERK3 10€-34€: Thank you! You have recycle 200 masks with your donation.

                                        1)*You will receive a diploma via E-mail

                                       2)*Sustainable Filma's stickers pack (view image)

                                       3)* Recycled printed key ring.

#PERK4  34,90€: Thank you! You have trust our process and you will be one of the first humans                                          to wear a mask made with masks.

                                      1)*You will receive one 3D print recycled mask. (FIRST 30 WILL GET                                                    PERSONALIZED MASKS)

#PERK5  94,20€:  *You will receive THREE 3D print recycled mask.

#PERK6  296€: *You will receive TEN 3D print recycled mask.

#PERK6  2792€: *You will receive ONE HUNDRED 3D print recycled mask.

#PERK8 1500€ (ONLY 4 DISPO): Thank you! You have helped us to buy 1/4 of the machinery.                                                                              WE WANT YOU IN OUR FIGHTER'S PLASTIC CLUB.

1)*You will be a Filma sponsor!. Your enterprise will appear in all our actions, web, new products.

2)*We will work as a team in some areas as creation and marketing.

3)Promotion of your brand in our website and social media.

   

 

 

WHICH IS OUR HISTORY?

FILMA was created by a team of four young entrepreneurs in Barcelona with the main objective of raising awareness about single-use plastic contamination and reducing the amount caused by the pandemic.

We are Daniel, Matthew, Pablo, and Carlota. We crossed paths when we began studying our degree LEINN (Leadership, Entrepreneurship, and Innovation). The degree is built upon three foundations: learning by doing, undertaking as a team, and international learning journeys.

 

    

 

As part of the degree, we run a non-profit company where we develop real business projects. As partners, we share a goal to solve environmental and social issues. FILMA was born during one of our never-ending Facetime whilst we were locked up in our houses (i’m sure that you can relate). We eventually ended up talking about contamination and we realised that an environmental crisis was just around the corner.

The virus wasn’t going anywhere soon. We began talking to engineers about what could be done with this new wave of plastic waste and we began finding solutions. Now, after months of research and testing, we’ve created the first face mask made of old face masks. We’re fighting against this environmental disaster. Will you help us?

story:
Help the Golden Rule sail for peace once more!

Veterans For Peace needs your help to restore the Golden Rule, the world's first anti-nuclear peace boat. In 1958, her brave crew of Quakers and pacifists risked their lives and freedom to nonviolently confront nuclear testing on the high seas. With your help, we'll be able to honor their legacy and continue their mission.

The Story

Horrified by the ongoing, open-air nuclear bomb tests and the threat of nuclear war, the four-man crew sailed the Golden Rule from California toward the Marshall Islands. Their intention, publicized around the world, was to nonviolently place their bodies in the way of planned nuclear bomb blasts. As they sailed from Honolulu harbor for the testing area, the voyagers were stopped and arrested by the U.S. Coast Guard. Guided by their conscience, the crew attempted to sail again, were arrested once more and detained in the Honolulu city jail until the conclusion of the test cycle. 

The Legacy

The publicity surrounding their trial and imprisonment helped ignite public outrage against nuclear weapons testing and alerted the world to the health hazards of nuclear fallout. Five years and many protests later, the Partial Test Ban Treaty of 1963 was enacted, banning above-ground nuclear testing by the two Superpowers. 

The courageous voyage of the Golden Rule and her crew inspired a similar anti-nuclear voyage in 1971 by the group that would eventually become Greenpeace. 

After the Golden Rule's crew was released from jail in 1958, the boat was sold. Many owners and half a century later, it ended up in northern California's Humboldt Bay, neglected and damaged, finally sinking in a storm.  

The Golden Rule can continue to be an inspiration for the protection of the environment and active peacemaking.  But first, we've got to get her back in the water.


The Golden Rule Project

When the Vets For Peace learned that this irreplaceable icon of history had literally washed up on their doorstep, they formed the Golden Rule Project and set about the restoration of both the boat and her mission.

With the gracious help of many talented volunteers and generous donations from around the world, the restoration is 70% complete. But, to get the Golden Rule back on the water now requires some large capital expenses like sails, electronic navigation equipment and specialized labor. 

Join The Crew

Our $50,000 goal will cover these costs, allowing us to “splash” in 2014.

The sooner we raise this money, the sooner the Golden Rule will be able to set sail on her new mission as a living museum and floating classroom, educating future generations on the importance of the ocean environment, the risks of nuclear technology and the need for world peace.  

By donating to this project, you become a part of the Golden Rule's extended crew, helping to unfurl the sails of peace everywhere.  Please step up, step aboard and help us launch the dream.

The Perks

Besides knowing that you're an integral part of this important piece of peace history, your monetary contribution will get you all sorts of cool tokens of appreciation. Join us for sea trials aboard the reborn Golden Rule as we remake history. Become an official Plank Owner. Have your name engraved on a permanent brass plaque aboard the boat. Score some fantastic bling. And lots more. Check the giving levels and pick your favorite. Every bit helps and no contribution is too small.

Can't contribute cash?  There are lots of other ways to participate! 

* Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Reddit and your blog or on email to your friends.

* Do you know someone who writes about peace, anti-nuclear protests, history, Quakers, the Pacific Ocean, wooden boats, sailboat restoration or sailing? Encourage them to contact us for a story.

* Hold a pledge party, where a computer is available for people to create accounts and pledge on the spot.

* Pledge in someone's honor as a gift to them.

* Do you know any celebrities who might support the Golden Rule's mission? Encourage them to lend their name and support to our fundraiser.

From the bottom of our hearts, thank you! Even if you can't contribute now, the Golden Rule is always available for personal tours if you're in the Eureka, CA area. Contact us through our website,  http://vfpgoldenruleproject.org/ and we'll show you around. But, fair warning: once people see the boat, they become easily seduced by the beauty of the vessel and the dedication of the fun-loving characters who make up the project. Many soon find themselves sanding, painting, sweeping up or fundraising with us. 

Who We Are  

Although the Golden Rule Project receives support from a diverse collection of people and groups, Veterans For Peace is our sponsoring organization.  We share common values and goals, and most Golden Rule Committee members belong to Veterans For Peace.  

We are committed to ending arms races and abolishing nuclear weapons, illuminating the true costs of war, and finally abolishing war as an instrument of national policy.  

The Golden Rule Project and Veterans For Peace are equally concerned about the state of the environment, and the impact upon it of military activities. In fact, we see peacemaking and the environment as being inextricably intertwined. After all, the U.S. Department of Defense is the world's number one polluter.  

We are likewise fully committed to the use of nonviolent means. The Quaker-inspired original crew of the Golden Rule pioneered the use of nonviolent direct action, and the restored boat will proudly carry that message.  

The Golden Rule Project is also supported by a number of Quakers, as was the original voyage, along with many other people of faith.  A number of Humboldt County businesses have been most generous with their support.  Lots of peace people and historic wooden boat lovers are behind us as well. 

We are particularly gratified that Greenpeace, USA is on board.  It makes sense - we share common values, and after all, the Golden Rule is the Rainbow Warrior's granny!  

Much more information is available at our website,  http://vfpgoldenruleproject.org/

story:
**2019 UPDATE**

Art for Trees (AFT) 2019 - “A Piece of My Heart” pendant.

*

Please consider donating in order to plant trees so we can replenish the wood we burn at Burning Man.

*

This year, we created a cordate (heart-shaped) leaf themed pendant in collaboration with Tzipora Hoynik. Fabricated domestically in Los Angeles, these 2” x 3” cast pewter two sided pendants - with one-of-a-kind amethyst and druzy stones from Uruguay - will be a gift at the $150 donation level (smaller heart stone) and $200 contribution level (larger heart stone). On the back, we placed a red heart Swarovski crystal to represent the Man’s “head” and hand stamped a quote from Arthur Rimbaud: “A thousand dreams within me softly burn: From time to time my heart is like some oak whose blood runs golden where a branch is torn.” 

*

This year marks the 7th Burning Man cycle for AFT. To date, we’ve planted 64,000 trees. These small, consistent, persistent, cumulative, and overall KIND efforts by Burning Man Participants DO make a difference. “Radical Reciprocity” - gifting back to nature - is a natural extension of the Burning Man “Leave No Trace” ethos since our less extractive and more regenerative practices will only support a more sustainable community and healthier planet.

*

“Do we, as conscious beings, exist outside of nature’s sway, or does its force impel us and inform the central root of who we are? Some say it’s our chief duty to preserve the natural world intact, protected from the ways of man. This is a worthy goal. And yet, if Burning Man has taught us anything, it’s that we can collaborate with nature. 

Only from immediate experience, not ideologies that stand outside of the created world, may we regenerate a sense of nature as it moves within us and flows through us. Having played with fire, we’ll take care to cleanse its atmospheric playground."

- Larry Harvey, Green Man theme Burning Man 2007

Example of 2019 Art for Trees HEART pendant - larger & smaller amethyst & druzy stones:

**2018 UPDATE**

-       Art for Trees & Larry Harvey Tribute Pendant:  “All-Seeing Leaf” which represents: Pi: Plant Intelligence versus AI: Artificial Intelligence. Created by jewelry artists Melissa Barron and Tzipora Hoynik whose designs are currently featured at the Smithsonian’s Renwick Gallery in the “No Spectators, the Art of Burning Man" exhibition.  Handcrafted in Los Angeles out of cast pewter, the 3" by 2" leaf and is embedded with a laser cut wooden eye etched by Tod Johnson with a realistic cabochon glass iris inlay.  Each inscribed on the back with the message: “Art for Trees– ‘If Burning Man has taught us anything, it’s that we can collaborate with nature’ - RIP Larry Harvey 1948-2018”

Larry’s recent passing has inspired Art for Trees to step up our commitment to Burning Man’s Ten Principles and his 2018 theme of “I, Robot.”

“I used to think the top environmental problems were biodiversity loss, ecosystem collapse, and climate change. I thought that with 30 years of good science we could address those problems. But I was wrong. The top environmental problems are selfishness, greed, and apathy. And to deal with those, we need a spiritual and cultural transformation – and we scientists don’t know how to do that.” 

- Gus Speth, Natural Resources Defense Council co-founder

We don’t need “more” science, technology, engineering, and math or VR, AI, IT, and social media hashtags to solve the world’s problems. What we do need is an awakening of our integral relationship with nature and how we interrelate with her. If we step away from the construct that we are the more dominant, intelligent, and worthy species – and move toward a reality that every living organism deserves love, respect, and rights – then we might be capable of positive change. This important shift in perspective can only begin inside each of us. Hopefully we can model a “reciprocity” movement at Burning Man and demonstrate that if we can change our collective consciousness, we can alter the destructive course we are on.

“Radical Reciprocity” (the unofficial 11th Burning Man Principle) would ensure that, of course, our community will replenish trees in return for consuming our forests’ bounties. It’s impossible to undo the past but we need to stop repeating cycles of endless consumption and harmful practices – and then denying we have any impact – especially at the Black Rock Desert. 

For the past 5 years, the emphasis behind the “Art for Trees” initiative has been our symbiotic connection to wood from trees. Recognizing that we can “collaborate” with our forests by asking for their “permission” to use their wood for our purposes, we then reciprocate by replanting trees to honor their contribution (and to insure that future generations of Burners and artists have access to these same gifts). Scientists can show us charts, algorithms, complicated metrics, and daunting statistics, but we believe we can have more impact on environmentabl and social actions if we rethink “ownership” and “entitlement” and shift our understandings towards “reciprocation” and “collaboration.”

Last year, we concentrated our support on For the Wild’s “One Million Redwoods Project” in order to plant 10,000 redwood seedlings to replenish the wood that we burned at Burning Man 2017: http://forthewild.world/1-million-redwoods-project

Thank you for your support!

Melissa “Syn” Barron

Founder 

Art for Trees

Example of the 2018 Art for Trees Pendant in pewter with inscription on the back:


 

 

Art for Trees logo - the "Divine Feminine Tree" - designed by Crystal Davis. Find more of her work on Instagram @cikeec
