HOS has campaigned against illegal killing of wild birds throughout its work since 1983. More specifically, HOS has applied pressure to the national and local authorities in order to improve the transposition of the EU’s Birds Directive (that is, the oldest European legislation tool for the protection of biodiversity!) and to actually implement it on the ground.
Illegal killing in the Ionian Islands has been a key media action of HOS every year for the last four years, as we are seeing the Turtle Dove population rapidly reducing. However, more recently HOS has undertaken a series of data collection, lobbying, capacity building and media actions in order to create a clearer and realistic picture of what is happening on the ground, as well as find what are the exact reasons for not tackling the problem are.
This work has lead us to decide to launch the “Safe Ηaven for Wild Birds” three-year  campaign in August 2012, in order to address the problem in a more coordinated, effective and targeted manner.
The campaign’s overall budget in Greece is 120.000 €. The EU will partially finance the project with the amount of 60.000 €. The remaining amount (60.000€) is self-financed. This is of course a very difficult task due to the economic crisis in Greece and the dropping out of potential greek funders. So, your contribution is absolutely helpful for the continuation and the completion of this campaign!

1)      A “Safe Haven for Wild Birds” national campaign. HOS will deliver a three-year campaign that targets hunters associations, visitors, decision makers and the younger generation. The campaign will go through stages of growing level of involvement of the target audiences using a number of different channels and tools: press adverts, TV spot, radio spot, engagement in social networks, and printed materials such as posters and pins.
ESTIMATED COST: 21.000 €
 
2)      Local campaign in the Ionian islands: a series of local events and information kiosks in Zakynthos and Corfu throughout the summer months of the three years of the campaign aim to engage local communities and our volunteers. We will also organize a “training the media” session in Zante in order to increase sensitivity around spring killing in the local media.

YOU can become a member of HOS and receive our magazine and all events updates.

Campaign’s website  www.leavingisliving.org

story:
Hello, I am James W. Anderson III, founder of Applied Ecotechnical Innovations, inventors of the systems which make the TORCH Town concept not only practical but as far as we can tell, they also make it the safest, most sustainable, cost effective and self sufficient community plan currently available.

I have extensive experience in bioremediation, land, soil and wetland restoration, organic gardening, holisitic medicine, community gardening programs, industrial composting, environmental consultation, and energy efficient engineering.

I work with these technologies on a daily basis. I have had great success with them at many sites over a period of several decades, starting as teen involved in some of the first major bioremediation research and systems in the world.

I also study the history of natural cultures such as my Native American (Cherokee and Powhattan), Celtic and Norse ancestors as well as indigenous cultures throughout the world and the rise and fall of civilizations since ancient times. There is much we can learn from preindustrial cultures.

The TORCH concept and supporting systems combines all of these areas of knowledge and more and builds on current safe stable and proven technologies to bring them to an even greater level of efficiency and cost effectiveness.

To be direct, I have a dream. It's what the American Dream should have been.

I dream of a world where all people, of all ages, nationalities and income levels live in safe, clean, comfortable homes that are storm, hurricane, fire and earthquake resistant, where they have no utility bills, no real estate taxes, no water or sewage bills, where they can pick healthy safe nutritious and delicious food from the gardens on their own roofs and terraces, where people don't have to work two jobs or more hours a week than they choose to support an inflated mortgage and bloated maintenance expenses, where people have time to be with their families, and thus there is less abuse, less divorce, less neglect of children and pets and far fewer strokes, heart attacks and fast food induced obesity.

I dream of a community where people can choose their own pace of life and don't have to be a wage slave chasing a rat race ideal they can never win. I dream of communities where people are not isolated from each other by the way their own homes are built and the need to rush around in metal boxes on wheels that keep us from knowing the people around us. I dream of communities for people, not for cars and glaring billboards of offensively brainwashing advertising.

I dream of a community where people truly have the right to just live, where they don't have to generate a huge cash flow just to keep their own homes. I dream of a community where all people can get around safely year round regardless of weather and where the community structure itself encourages helping each other in their times of need. I dream of a community where the pace of life is our choice, not something forced on us by wage slavery and because of that pace we can choose to spend time on family activities, education, community service, non profit causes or passing on our knowledge and skills to the less fortunate. Such a community allows the elderly, the handicapped and the financially challenged to be a health positively contributing asset of society. I dream of such a community where systemic and social problems are massively reduced because of such benefits. I dream of a community of healthy modern holistic living that reflects values of liberty, equality and compassion.

Most of us have had a similar dream, or portions of what I describe above, perhaps around the time you had your first job. You probably have had a similar dream at one time or another, perhaps as a young child or when you were tired of the rat race of consumer culture, and like me you were probably told its a fairy tale utopia and can't work. Well, the surest way to get me to make something work is to tell me its impossible. I found out how to make it not only possible but healthier and more affordable than modern "normal" communities.

I want to share this dream with as many people as possible. Why? I'm no saint. Its easier for us all to have if everyone has it. Its fundamental basic logic. The best way to have something is make sure everyone has it. If everyone has it, I can too. Its also extremely sensible and holds great value for strengthening our society and the stability of the world as a whole, which are also things I personally desire and think we all deserve.

This is why I and others believe it is time we brought this to the people instead of waiting for government or large organizations to wake up to the benefits and value of such communities and infrastructure systems.

Please take a moment to consider what we can achieve with your help.

Funding will support the following:

1. Finalize legal paperwork, patents and blueprints for TORCH Communiites, Bio-Domes Architecture and IOWEBS sustainable energy infrastructure system.

2. Promote the Total Organic Resource Conservation Hamlet Community Concept, and the associated Bio-Domes architecture and IOWEBS sustainable energy community infrastructure at meetings across the US and Canada as determined by contributor votes.

3. This will also allow us to approach existing communities with the IOWEBS system to be added to their existing disposal approach and make it more efficient and eco friendly. Likewise this will also allow us to build Bio.domes homes for people on a standalone basis anywhere they would like one.

Likewise there are three options that could apply to you personally, all while we all benefit as a whole.

1. Living in a TORCH Community.

2. Having a Bio.Domes Architecture house built at your own location.

3. Bringing the benefits to your community, such as 30% APR savings and earnings over normal sewage treatment.

We are starting our crowd source funding program to raise funds to make the IOWEBS and Bio.Domes based TORCH communities a reality using public money and not waiting for organizations and governments. It's our future, we need to make sure it happens instead of waiting and hoping.

We will use the funds raised to finalize all patents and necessary arrangements needed to bring the TORCH concept to a wider range of people and secure additional funding from persons wishing to see such communities built, and live and work in them.

We already have a large number of people that have expressed interest in purchasing homes in such communities and I am sure either you or someone you know would as well. Your assistance will help us make the last steps needed to be able to proceed to purchasing land at the initial sites and selling homes to those who want them, and eventually even construct some as rental properties for those who cannot afford to buy a home yet.

I will be selling my own home to pay for building one for myself. Even with the market down it ends up being profitable to do because these houses are cheaper per square foot, you will never pay property or income tax, a water bill, a sewage bill, energy use is dropped by 95%, maintenance is almost non existent and you grow your own food on your roof or buy from the local community supported agriculture participants and the town farmers market.

 

The TORCH Community plan includes the IOWEBS Integrated Organic Waste to Energy Biological System and Bio.Domes architecture, a highly efficient earth bermed passive solar design style which should be very familiar to those who love the beauty and peaceful logic of a more natural lifestyle without giving up the benefits of modern civilization.

The end of 2012 is here and the world hasn't ended, it's only the end of a cycle and the start of a new millennium.

However, many factors indicate that civilization as it stands today cannot continue, there are issues that threaten the safety and stability of the world. Many of these already have a strong negative impact on the economy and people's lives.

We believe humanity can face these challenges and conquer them by learning to live more efficiently using the power of Ecotechnical Engineering, of technology in a mutually supportive synergy with nature.

This is what a Total Organic Resource Conservation Hamlet (TORCH) Community does. These are community clusters designed for maximum efficiciency, self reliance, cost effectiveness and minimal ecological impact. The same support systems and infrastructure can also serve larger existing communities as well.

These communities use the best technologies available now, building on the solid foundatoin of the best of the past, to build the best possible future for humanity.

Each community and home built benefits all living things on earth by reducing the impact of humanity and as such helps stabilize the environment, the economy and even national and international security by reducing the need for competition for resources.

These communities help ensure a healthy future environmentally, socially, economically, and thus, personally.

The IOWEBS infrastructure system processes all organic wastes in the community using advanced methane, aquaponics and algae technologies and in so doing produces large amounts of clean energy, irrigation water, industrially composted fertilizer, and provides carbon sequestration all while supporting local agriculture and industry. The IOWEBS system can replace any existing sewage facility and be of direct benefit to any community on earth.

The Bio.Domes home designs provide low impact, low cost, energy efficient, low maintenance and highly disaster resistant homes with such features as 95% energy usage reduction, extreme wind and earthquake resistance, rooftop gardening, rain water capture and passive solar heating. These can also be built for anyone who wants one of their own, not just in TORCH Communities.

Together these provide a level of sustainable self reliance and healthier, lower stress, living that is unmatched in modern society while keeping all the benefits of modern living. These are primarily pedestrian oriented communities with year round underground handicapped accessible entry with local shops, farmers market, park, and a community fountain, and an Inn/Pub gathering hall.

I hope you can help us make it happen for the benefit of all life on earth. It's time for a new beginning, help us build the civilization for this next millennium, one solid step at a time.

Please help however you can, contribute or share this so we can make it a reality. We can't do it without you.

If you wish to contribute at any level and do not wish the reward just let us know. The extra contribution is highly appreciated as well. Likewise if there is a perk you think would be good please let me know. I welcome your thoughts.

We also hope to complete paperwork to make the non-rewarded contributions tax deductible by the time this campaign finishes. If so you will receive proper paperwork to be able to deduct from your taxes.

Thank you for listening,

James W. Anderson III

Founder, Applied Ecotechnical Innovations

Persons interested in a home, IOWEBS for their community, a cooperative land partnership, tiny house site or a business site should email AppEcoTech@gmail.com

3. Bringing the benefits to your community, such as 30% APR savings and earnings over normal sewage treatment.
We are starting our crowd source funding program to raise funds to make the IOWEBS and Bio.Domes based TORCH communities a reality using public money and not waiting for organizations and governments. It's our future, we need to make sure it happens instead of waiting and hoping.
We will use the funds raised to finalize all patents and necessary arrangements needed to bring the TORCH concept to a wider range of people and secure additional funding from persons wishing to see such communities built, and live and work in them.
We already have a large number of people that have expressed interest in purchasing homes in such communities and I am sure either you or someone you know would as well. Your assistance will help us make the last steps needed to be able to proceed to purchasing land at the initial sites and selling homes to those who want them, and eventually even construct some as rental properties for those who cannot afford to buy a home yet.
I will be selling my own home to pay for building one for myself. Even with the market down it ends up being profitable to do because these houses are cheaper per square foot, you will never pay property or income tax, a water bill, a sewage bill, energy use is dropped by 95%, maintenance is almost non existent and you grow your own food on your roof or buy from the local community supported agriculture participants and the town farmers market.
 
The TORCH Community plan includes the IOWEBS Integrated Organic Waste to Energy Biological System and Bio.Domes architecture, a highly efficient earth bermed passive solar design style which should be very familiar to those who love the beauty and peaceful logic of a more natural lifestyle without giving up the benefits of modern civilization.
The end of 2012 is here and the world hasn't ended, it's only the end of a cycle and the start of a new millennium.
However, many factors indicate that civilization as it stands today cannot continue, there are issues that threaten the safety and stability of the world. Many of these already have a strong negative impact on the economy and people's lives.
We believe humanity can face these challenges and conquer them by learning to live more efficiently using the power of Ecotechnical Engineering, of technology in a mutually supportive synergy with nature.
This is what a Total Organic Resource Conservation Hamlet (TORCH) Community does. These are community clusters designed for maximum efficiciency, self reliance, cost effectiveness and minimal ecological impact. The same support systems and infrastructure can also serve larger existing communities as well.
These communities use the best technologies available now, building on the solid foundatoin of the best of the past, to build the best possible future for humanity.
Each community and home built benefits all living things on earth by reducing the impact of humanity and as such helps stabilize the environment, the economy and even national and international security by reducing the need for competition for resources.
These communities help ensure a healthy future environmentally, socially, economically, and thus, personally.
The IOWEBS infrastructure system processes all organic wastes in the community using advanced methane, aquaponics and algae technologies and in so doing produces large amounts of clean energy, irrigation water, industrially composted fertilizer, and provides carbon sequestration all while supporting local agriculture and industry. The IOWEBS system can replace any existing sewage facility and be of direct benefit to any community on earth.
The Bio.Domes home designs provide low impact, low cost, energy efficient, low maintenance and highly disaster resistant homes with such features as 95% energy usage reduction, extreme wind and earthquake resistance, rooftop gardening, rain water capture and passive solar heating. These can also be built for anyone who wants one of their own, not just in TORCH Communities.
Together these provide a level of sustainable self reliance and healthier, lower stress, living that is unmatched in modern society while keeping all the benefits of modern living. These are primarily pedestrian oriented communities with year round underground handicapped accessible entry with local shops, farmers market, park, and a community fountain, and an Inn/Pub gathering hall.
I hope you can help us make it happen for the benefit of all life on earth. It's time for a new beginning, help us build the civilization for this next millennium, one solid step at a time.
Please help however you can, contribute or share this so we can make it a reality. We can't do it without you.
If you wish to contribute at any level and do not wish the reward just let us know. The extra contribution is highly appreciated as well. Likewise if there is a perk you think would be good please let me know. I welcome your thoughts.
We also hope to complete paperwork to make the non-rewarded contributions tax deductible by the time this campaign finishes. If so you will receive proper paperwork to be able to deduct from your taxes.
Thank you for listening,
James W. Anderson III
Founder, Applied Ecotechnical InnovationsPersons interested in a home, IOWEBS for their community, a cooperative land partnership, tiny house site or a business site should email AppEcoTech@gmail.com

story:
This is the Problem!

All of us will die some day! What will we leave to our Children and Grandchildren? 

We must reach our goal. If we don't reach our goal we all fail!

You Decide?

We've seen the creation of all types of gadgets and everyday items to make our lives more enjoyable, manageable (LOL) and comfortable. But we have failed to address the one thing that will effect the people we leave behind the most.

We have failed to address these problems: 

  • The environment! 
  • Our natural resourses! 
  • Waste! 

http://www.justlivegreener.com/environment/253-scary-facts-about-landfills.html

Where will our children and grandchildren live? All the gadgets and other items are wonderful but they mean nothing if we have no planet on which to live.

1. Is Global warming real?

2. Are the Polar Icecaps melting?

3. Are the coastal waters rising?

4. Are we using up our natural resources?

5. Are landfills the major cause of global warming? 

6. Can we repair all of the above?

Answers below.

It is our responsibility and duty to leave this planet better than it was when it was left to us.

Doxicom and the Greengooroo has been recycling for 4 years. 

This is some of what we achieved thus far:

Kept over 14 million pounds of paper out of the landfill. We have saved over 100,000 trees! Our goal is to save 1,000,000 million trees. Just imagine the positive environmental impact.

Kept over 1.5 million pounds of plastic bottles and other plastics out of the landfill. We saved 1.5 million pounds of waste that could have polluted our lakes and rivers and killed thousands of fish.

Recycled nearly 7,000 tons of metal. We have saved over 26,000 gallons of Crude Oil.

The best news is we are just getting started. We need your help. We must have funds to increase our recycling efforts.

In Trenton, TN, a city, we reduced the amount of waste going to the landfill by more than 30% in a little more than 12 months.

The City of Trenton, TN is "Rockin' The 'Roo" Recycling

Our first Customer Manufacturers Industrial Group is also our first 5 Greengooroo Client. We reduced the materials they were sending to the landfill by 90%.

Congratulations to MIG LLC for "Rockin' the 'Roo" Recycling

We plan to provide recycling services to more cities, more colleges, more companies and etc. Using our one of  kind proprietary system recycling is fun and easy. There is no longer any reason not to recycle because we will continue to provide the equipment, management, training and incentives. We want every entity to be 5 Greengooroo and consumers to support those that are. We would like to hire staff to find solutions for items that are not being recycled. Additionally we would like to match materials to companies and individuals that want to recycle the materials.

Ribbon cutting at City of Lexington, TN Recycling Operations Center (L.R.O.C.)

Visit our website to see how far we've come over the last four years, doxicom.com or greengooroo.com or greengoorooonline.com. Some of our Customers are listed  on the site. Please feel free to inquire about our performance.

This is what we plan to do once funded:

$5,500 will be used to develop a training video.

$4,500 will be used to create and implement a marketing program to encourage recycling.

$4,500 will be used to continue our training program for the young women.

$5,300 will be used to hire staff to solicit companies, schools, communities and others to recycle.

$7,900 will be used to find solutions for items that are not currently being recycled.

Total: $27,700 

$100,000 will allow us to add even more businesses, colleges, cities, or communities to our recycling program plus complete the web site greengoorooonline.com. This will assit in finding solutions for materials that are diffcult to recycle such as fiberglass, duct tape, wood scrap and other materials. We will also be able to locate materials vendor want to recycle.

$250,000 will allow additional businesses, colleges, cities or communities, and others to recycle, complete the web site greengoorooonline.com and hire additional staff and purchase equipment to find solutions for items that are not being recycled.

$500,000 will allow additional businesses, colleges, cities or communities,and others to recycle, complete the website greengoorooonline.com, hire staff to find solutions for items that are not being recycled and teach those we leave behind why recycling is necessary.

$1,000,000 Same as the above plus create a national measuring system for those that recycle, (example 5 star hotel). If you are a 5 greengooroo that means you reduced what you send to the landfill by 90%.

$3,000,000 Same as above and become a global company. 

For as little as $1 you can begin the process of leaving a better environment for those we will leave behind.

Check out these TREMENDOUS PERKS. All one of a kind collectors edition limited quantities items. All made from 100% recycled materials. When they are sold out they are gone for good.

Rock The 'Roo Collector's Edition Poster

The Thank You cards and the Poster will be printed on 100% recycled paper. True recycled paper is made after waste paper is de-inked and all fillers, clays and fiber fragments are removed from it. Then it is cooked and remanufactured back into usable pulp. It takes 1 hour to cut down a tree it takes 10 years to replace it.

"Rock The 'Roo" Reward Wristbands

The Bracelet will be made of a 100% recyclable material call HDPE. HDPE is a High-Density Polyethylene. HDPE is commonly recycled, and has a number "2" as its recycling symbol.

Rock The 'Roo Collectors Edition T-Shirts

The T-Shirt will be made from 100% Organic Cotton. Cotton is one of the most chemical-laden crops in the world. It has a huge pesticide foot print. Your T-Shirt will not be treated with chemicals such as formaldehyde. Your T-Shirt will be certified organic, sustainable, and eco-friendly.

We need your help to stop the damage we are doing to our environment and began the process of repairing.

Answers

1. Yes. 98% of the climate scientist say yes. "Heat Waves and Climate Change," by Climate Communication. George Shultz former Secretary of State under Ronald Regan listed three reason we should be concerned about Global Warming "national security, the economy and the environment".

2. Yes. NASA  "study revealed the oldest and thickest Artic sea ice is disappearing. Multi-year sea ice is shrinking rapidly."

3. Yes. The Environmental Protection Agency states "the United States will be the most negatively impacted of all countries on Earth." If you live on a coast in the US you should start making plans to relocate if nothing changes.

4. Yes. The Global Footprint Network has declared today Earth Overshoot Day. "That's the day when humankind's demand on nature exceeds the planet's ability to regenerate resources and absorb the waste." 75% of what we send to the landfill is recyclable.

5. Yes. Green energy choice, "The gradual decomposition of trash in landfills produces more than 34 percent of methane emissions."

6. Yes but. The Environmental Protection Agency states,"it will be a long time before we see the ozone layer repaired. Ozone destruction will likely continue for another twenty years"

When called upon we have always answered the call. We would like to make a difference. It's in your hands. We need your help. For as little as $1 you can kickstart this project and help us start the process of repairing the environment.

For as little as $1 you can make a difference. We need your help. We can continue to make a difference with your help.

If we don't reach our goal we will not get a dime. We must reach our goal in order to continue to expand and help get young women off government aid.

Thank you for making the right decision to help. Make your pledge today and thanks again. Together we will exceed our goal!

story:
Two teenage girls from Poland died in a car crash in South Iceland yesterday. The accident happened around 15:00 (03:00 pm) yesterday. Four people were in the car, all from Poland. The two girls were hurled out of the car but the other two are at a hospital.

The car went off the road, took a few rolls and landed upside down. The two girls were 15 and 16 years old, but they were hurled from the car during the rolls. A man and a woman were saved from the car just before the car caught fire. The two people who survived the accident were the driver and the front seat passenger. Their condition is considered stable and non-critical.

According to a doctor at the hospital it is unknown when they will be released from the hospital.

The cause of the accident is unknown and the accident is still under investigation.

 

 

Follow News of Iceland on Facebook and Twitter:

story:
Short Summary

Interect Inc. is a solar energy company that provides solutions for on- and off-grid applications. Our Interect Solar Education Program (ISEP) runs training workshops combining theory and hands-on to teach students about the solar industry.

The PowerShed will be a small scale off grid power plant available in kit form for the do-it yourself market.

 Starting price for the kit is expected to be $7500 Further information is available by writing to info@interect.ca

What We Need & What You Get

Capital for the creation of a kit that is simple enough for the average handyman's skill set. The shed will be multi purpose and fully scalable to accommodate many diverse usages. 

The Impact

We feel the creation of an inexpensive and simple solar energy system will be a contributor to a sustainable future as well as giving a level of independence to its owners.

Other Ways You Can Help

Anyone willing to help and not able to do so financially is encouraged to promote our project through social media or other means.

Please visit us at online, on Facebook and Twitter

story:
In an alternative vehicle, we will travel the lower 48 in pursuit of 30 plus stories to recognize household and business activities that support community and local resiliency.  The purpose of this project is to showcase local, practical, cost effective solutions to sustainable living including winning examples of using local foods and local energy.

It is these winning examples that will motivate and encourage a more positive response to energy security and climate change.  We know that there are technological solutions and top--down incentive programs for environmental action, but the key ingredient is missing: real people doing real work to lessen their impact on the environment. We're looking for everything from homesteading to up-cycling waste materials, alternative dwellings to local food programs, energy efficiency to alternative transportation, and everything in between.

All of our interviews are compiled onto our website, convenientresilience.com, to achieve the overarching goal of an interactive online resource and guide for applying these simple environmental initiatives to anyone’s life.It is our hope that this guide will act as a tool and platform for easily sharing knowledge and expertise across borders and interests.

After interviewing Lori Barg on her solar water heater in Plainfield, VT, we received contact from new friends in Nicaragua. They were so inspired by her simple design that they are looking to implement it across their country as a cost effective method to providing families with hot water.

With your support, we will be able to interview dozens of people across the country. Here is a sneak peek of some of the incredible projects we will be encountering.

Budget: 

$6,000-8,000 purchase of a vehicle

$2,000- fuel and maintenance/tolls on the road

$500- insurance

$2,000- food (10/day/per/100 days)

$1,000- camp lodging

$1,500- technology

 

Vermont:

  • Lori Barg: Solar Hot Water
  • Jill Bubier: Micro Hydro
  • Dave Palumbo of  Independent Power: Photovoltaics
  • Robert & Susan Lloyd: Off-Grid living
  • Moe O'Hara: Upcycling
  • Chapin Spencer of Local Motion: People powered transportation

Massachusetts:

  • Pedal People: Human powered delivery service
  • Cambridge Energy Alliance: Energy audits
  • Boston Food Swap: Sharing surplus food goods

New York: 

  • I Am Not A Virgin: Up-cycling beer bottled to jeans
  • Brooklyn Grange: Roof-top garden
  • Ulster County Tool Bank: Tool Shed Cooperative

Ohio: 

  • Natural Building Network & the Village Building Convergence: alternative building materials

Indiana:

  • 5 Kingdom Development: Environmental education, ecological & social health

Illinois: 

  • Midwest Permaculture: organic symbiotic relationship with land & living
  • The Plant: Vertical Farm and " food business incubator"

Missouri: 

  • Dancing Rabbit Ecovillage:

Minneapolis:

  • Harvest Moon Farmers: Backyard faming
  • Community Design Group: Sustainable mobility

Washington:

  • P-Patch Community Gardening: Cooperative Gardening

Oregon: 

  • POD Alternative Dwellings: Small, portable housing

California: 

  • Lucy Peniod: Native Gardening
  • Hayes Valley Farm: Bee Harvesting
  • Beth Terry: " My Life without Plastic"
  • The Ecology Center

New Mexico:

  • Earthship : Alternative building materials/sustainable housing 

Colorado: 

  • Eliu Hernandez: Upcycling

Texas: 

  • Sustain Center: Integrated sustainable systems
  • Dripping Spring Ollas: Efficient irrigation
  • Pure Salvage Living: Building houses with recycled material
  • In.gredients: Package free and zero waste grocery store

Alabama: 

  • Wayne Keith: Wood gas energy

Georgia: 

  • Box Car Grocer: Local food market
  • Ark Fab, Georgia Tech: Aquaphonics

South Carolina:

  • Groovy Garbage: Upcycling

story:
2018 Conservation Projects in Sumatran and Cambodia

*Let me note here that if you do not wish to donate using a credit card you can also make a donation via Paypal here. 

Our camera traps in three different locations in Sumatra's Hadabuan Hills need to be serviced in January, March, and May for the first half of this year. I have written about this ecosystem and the threats it faces several times, and the situation is as serious as ever today. Last year our project received some much-needed popular coverage in The Guardian, but more is needed!

Our other project site is Cambodia's Virachey National Park, where we have been working for nearly half a decade now. We recently rediscovered Asian elephants in this vast national park that receives woefully insufficient protection. 

Your donation will help pay for everything we need in the field: camera traps, protective cases and python locks, memory cards, lithium batteries, field provisions, and guide fees. With the inclusion of your email address, you can also expect to get regular updates on the expeditions' progress. 

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to email me at: greg.mccann1@gmail.com
story_txt: 2018 Conservation Projects in Sumatran and Cambodia*Let me note here that if you do not wish to donate using a credit card you can also make a donation via Paypal here. Our camera traps in three different locations in Sumatra's Hadabuan Hills need to be serviced in January, March, and May for the first half of this year. I have written about this ecosystem and the threats it faces several times, and the situation is as serious as ever today. Last year our project received some much-needed popular coverage in The Guardian, but more is needed!Our other project site is Cambodia's Virachey National Park, where we have been working for nearly half a decade now. We recently rediscovered Asian elephants in this vast national park that receives woefully insufficient protection. Your donation will help pay for everything we need in the field: camera traps, protective cases and python locks, memory cards, lithium batteries, field provisions, and guide fees. With the inclusion of your email address, you can also expect to get regular updates on the expeditions' progress. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to email me at: greg.mccann1@gmail.com

story:
Pierrette, the founder of PAC, was widowed in 2012, left with 5 young children, no family, and no employment prospects. She struggled to feed her children and pay for medicine, education, and other expenses, as she scraped by doing odd jobs for neighboring households, many of which were headed by women in similarly dire situations.

In 2013, she participated in a training on processing Moringa into powder, where she learned about the nutritional benefits of Moringa leaves. Moringa already grew sporadically in her neighborhood, so she began incorporating the leaves into meals she served to her children, and she witnessed a remarkable difference in her family’s well-being. Here is where she saw an opportunity to use what she learned in the training to both create an income source for herself, and help all the women she met around the community since the death of her husband by providing them extra income and a powerful supplement to the daily nutrition of their children.

Today, PAC consists of a fast-growing network of women who produce Moringa leaves, creating significant economic value and improvements in family health, all out of the modest assets held by these women. PAC’s activities have garnered the attention of export partners in the USA and Europe, which has redefined its vision and shown the possibility that even more families can benefit from Moringa, beyond Dassa, and beyond Benin.

In order to achieve this goal of exportation, we are looking to you. We have already raised $10,000 through a Peace Corps grant but have estimated another $5,000 needed to fulfill our dream and build a top of the line Moringa Processing Center. The current center is an old home built without the intention of processing high grade moringa powder. Even with all hygienic procedures being taken by workers, it is impossible for us to achieve the quality powder needed for US standards while working in that building. The blueprint has been approved by experts in the field who all assure that with this new center, our moringa will be as clean as it gets.

Once the construction is completed (after an estimated 4 months), we will be able to increase the quality and quantity of moringa powder produced and start exporting moringa powder to partners around the world. With a stable market, we can take on more suppliers and give potentially hundreds more struggling mothers the opportunity to gain a supplemental income to feed their families and pay school fees.

Even if you are not able to currently financially support this project, please pass along this message! Share this link on social media, talk about the power of moringa during your next holiday party... truly, everything helps!

story:
Our Story

RidePal provides an end-to-end commuting service that substantially improves the rider experience, makes them productive during their commute and enhances recruiting and worker loyalty for their employer. Transportation companies achieve more revenue and efficient utilization of their vehicles. This is more flexible than public transportation and can serve remote areas.


50 to 80% of the active population in the top 15 US cities* drive to work daily for an average of 50 minutes leading to congested roads, polluted cities, stressed and unhealthy workers, high employee turnover and lower productivity (* US Census Bureau, 2008). 

The Impact

Putting one person away from a car and into a bus reduces its carbon footprint by 40%. Walking for 15 min to a bus stop can increase the average lifespan by 17%. People will enjoy more professional choices as longer commutes won't be as daunting. The people that will keep commuting by car will enjoy less traffic. Everyone living in an urban area will have cleaner air and overall better quality of life. Public budgets are being cut - now is the time for private initiatives to tackle the problem.


What We Need & What You Get

RidePal has signed up companies into its pilot program - however it is still limited in its ability to offer the right choices to their employees. The company will join an accelerator program (Greenstart) in February and is looking for incremental funding to help establish two solid clusters in the Bay Area. In any case, the money will be used to seed routes and make the service more valuable to riders.

We have reached out to Friends and Family and environmentally focused Angel investors as well.


Other Ways You Can Help

Tell people about RidePal! Anyone can vote for a ride at www.ridepal.com - and when it becomes full, we will put it on the road.

You can also recommend RidePal for your company, or any company you might know. They can sign up for our pilot program at www.ridepal.com

story:
*See the Updates section to see where we are on the project

How It Started

What started as a desperate project when I was a homeless single father during the recession has now taken on a life of its own.  When I couldn't find a job as a programmer in time, which I had experience as for 15+ years, I had to make something happen.  So I came up with a plan to make a solar project work with the odd legal barriers in Florida.  I had tinkered with solar projects for 10 years as a hobby, but the very laws that made solar installation difficult in Florida led me to the idea: to build zero-energy apartments.  The plans have been ready for 2 years, but I was battling my way back to a normal life, and wanted to contribute my own money to the project.  Thanks to an inheritance, things are moving ahead, but I still need help to finish the first apartment.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am putting down $100,000 myself, but the total project will cost about $2 million.  In order to be financed, we will need 20% down.  There are interested potential investors, but we could use your help.

Your contributions would not only help me, and the environment, from this one building.  I have always planned to copy these buildings as fast as possible to have more sustainable buildings out there, and to do so, I will be starting a franchise.  It is the fastest way to expand ideas, and with each building providing 80kW of solar power, and each apartment complex providing 1-2 Megawatts of solar power (it's like a small power plant!), it may even be able to rival the output of large power plants as the franchise grows.

So you not only help, but we will do our best to make sure you get a chance to live in a zero-energy apartment.  We will have a waiting list on our website that tracks demand by zip code.  With your $20 contribution, you will be the very first on that waiting list.  When they start to see, say, 400 people on the waiting list in one zip code, developers will have a very compelling reason to build ZEAL Apartments there, and banks will have a compelling reason to back them.  So go tell your friends, too!  The waiting list will continue after the campaign, but IGG contributors will always be at the top of the list.

 

The Impact

While there have been net-zero buildings both residential and commercial, they are still few and far between, and most are individual projects.  The economics of this project, however, makes it extremely competitive commercially.  Developers who become franchisees benefit from:

  • A higher expected return on their investment (ROI)
  • Empty units still produce $50-150 worth of electricity at current rates
  • High demand for green buildings, and other extra competitive features.

When developers see there is clearly more money to be made by going sustainable, they will be pushing the technology out faster than any individual can hope.  And by joining the franchise, their franchise fees:

  • Help advertise and encourage more sustainable building
  • Help fund R&D to improve ZEAL Apartments sustainability even more!
  • A portion of each franchise fee goes to help house the homeless

But developers want to see proof, and that's why getting this first building built is so important.

 

Risks & Challenges

By far the most dangerous part is the same as any real estate development. Underestimating the costs, getting it partially built, and then being unable to fund the final part.  I am working with very experienced architects, general contractors, and solar installers, that are all experienced in net-zero construction.  Please check them out on the Team page, they're a wonderful crew.  And we're being conservative with all the investments to be safe.

Hitting the milestones for commercial competitiveness is a concern, but one that should easily be covered.  At the beginning of development two years ago, there was much less room for error.  But even in just two years, the drop in price and increase in solar panel efficiency have made that significantly easier.  We will probably end up producing almost 50% more electricity than we use, but that's why the data from the first building is so valuable to the future.

And the mental barriers of the cost still need to be watched, though they also look good.  There is a huge difference with people paying 10% more for their rent + utilities, or paying 10% less.  No one wants to pay more, but give someone better quality for less money, and who wouldn't go for that?  The same goes for developers making 2% less ROI, though demand *might* make up for it, or making 5% more, while still getting that same high demand.  We expect to hit both those marks, but the focus needs to stay on making sure that happens.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute now, that's ok.  Spreading the word helps just as much.  Especially if you'd like to live in a ZEAL Apartment, and you know others in your area that would like to.  Tell them about the campaign, and there will always be more chances to reserve your spot.  And even if you don't think there's any way you can contribute, even a kind word helps brighten my day.  Thank you all for your help!

story:
Let’s start with the facts: The California Department of Education found that youth who participate in environmental education programs in the outdoors can raise their science test scores by 27%. They also exhibit increased self-esteem, motivation to learn, better problem solving skills, and better behaviour in class. The bottom line is that youth who are given opportunities to learn in the outdoors are more likely to care about the environment and for themselves.


For years, the Get to Know contest has been a forum for youth across North America to share their connections with nature and to inspire others to get outside and make these connections for themselves. Over the past few years, we have made a lot of changes to this contest: we've added music and video categories as well as city-specific galleries in order to engage more and more youth. The response has been amazing; in recent years the contest has received over 30,000 entries and we have selected winners from all across the continent.

Michelle, Age 15, AB, Canada.

In order to keep this contest running and to reach out to more people than ever before, Get to Know relies on partners and donations. We have a two-fold approach for getting more youth involved in the 2014 contest: 

  • one is by running events such as Art in the Park as well as Launch and Congratulations Events; 
  • the other is through media and school outreach which involves PSAs on both TV and radio as well as sending posters and other promotional material to schools. We also try to give presentations in schools and have several lesson plans ready for any teacher that wants to incorporate Get to Know into the classroom.

With your generosity, we hope to be able to expand our outreach to get more children outdoors making meaningful memories in nature. We are hoping to beat last year’s 5900 contest entries. In fact, our goal is to reach 10,000 entries this year. Think about it. That's 10,000 connections to nature, 10,000 moments where a child connected with their surroundings and felt inspired. We hope you will consider donating to help us to make this year's contest better than ever.

You work hard for your cash and we want to be open with you about exactly where it is going. First you should know that we are a registered charity in Canada (874935521RR0001 under Wild Neighbours Society and in the States we are a project of The Community Partners (95-4302067). We’re based in Canada, and that’s why the fundraiser is in CAD.

The funds raised in this campaign will go towards promoting the contest and running events to get more youth involved in the contest, as well as to offset the costs of actually running the contest. This includes website upkeep, social media outreach, and costs associated with prizes for the contest.

As we said before, we have a two-fold approach for this: one way is through running events. We have to pay for space rentals, art supplies, presentation fees, and sometimes snacks at these events. We get volunteers to help out and often receive discounted rates on rentals, but as a charity we rely on your support to be able to pay for the remaining fees.

Erin, Age 12, TX, USA.

The other part of outreach is through radio and TV PSAs, school presentations, promotional packages, and the development of lesson plans for teachers to use in the classroom. While we get many in-kind donations with the production of PSAs and the like, there are still costs to actually get them on the air. We also have to consider the time it takes to produce the lesson plans and promotional materials.


The bottom line is that promoting the contest isn't free and in order to get more youth involved and active in the outdoors, we need to get them interested in participating in the contest, which means that we need to increase promotion. 

Lawrence, Age 10, BC, Canada.

What happens if we don’t meet our goal?
We work within our budget. We will do however much outreach we can afford to do with the funds raised here--if we don't meet our goal, it just means that the contest will be smaller than we had hoped. However, if because of your generosity we exceed our goal, we’ll be able to make this year’s contest even bigger than we thought or that we can save some money for promotion next year. We are responsible with your donations. The money will be going towards contest-related expenses, nothing else.

The Get to Know Contest is instrumental in connecting youth to nature. We truly believe that these connections are the keys to a greener, more sustainable future. We protect what we love, and if we inspire a generation to love the outdoors, we’re confident that this generation will make the environment a priority.


We've already seen the amazing things that this contest can accomplish-- we now have city-wide Galleries in Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, the Durham Region, and the Central Okanagan in Canada. In the US, we have City-Wide Galleries in Baltimore, Atlanta, Los Angeles, as well as a National Parks Service Gallery, a Louisiana Gallery, and a Texas State Parks Gallery. This means that all of these areas have made a commitment to the contest and to promoting the creation of meaningful connections to nature. 

Emma, Age 13, BC, Canada.

Past contest winners and entrants have gone on to form our Youth Ambassadors crew and have accomplished some amazing things. They have attended International Unconferences where they have discussed environmental changes and issues and how to fix them as well as ways to get their peers involved. The music and video categories of the contest came from the brains of our young environmentalists and have been very successful in recruiting new outdoor enthusiasts. Now they want others to join in the conversation. Help us empower more young people than ever before to enter the Get to Know Contest and feel passionate about our planet.

There are tons of ways to help us out, even if you can’t make a donation here. One of those ways is simply to enter the contest (if you are under 19 and live in Canada or the US)! If you’re not under 19, encourage your friends, neighbours, children, nieces, nephews, and cousins to enter. The more entries we get, the better.

Or you can use the share tools up above to help us spread the word over social media and get others interested in supporting our campaign. Letting others know about the contest is a huge help and you have our most sincere thanks!

You can also wish us the best and keep us in mind as you get out and experience nature. Every good thought helps! Have fun exploring the great outdoors!


We have some really awesome and unique perks lined up for you--you cannot get any of these items anywhere else on the planet. Whatever amount you decide to donate, we want to thank you. Every dollar helps and we are incredibly grateful for your support. 

At the $10 level, we’ll offer you your choice of a cougar, wolf, grizzly bear, polar bear, or moose notepad/fridge magnet. These notepads make great grocery or to-do lists and are super handy to have around the house. Thank you for your support!

At the $15 level we’d like to offer you the amazing Get to Know Contest Art Calendar. Choose between the 2014 calendar (both the US and the Canadian editions are available) or our exclusive Special Occasions Calendar, which can be used at any time to record birthdays, holidays, anniversaries, and other events of note.



At the $25 level, you have your choice of any of our plush animals:  the grizzly bear, black bear, leopard frog, peregrine falcon, or the barn owl. We have limited supplies of each, so you will be receiving something that is truly special. This also means that it would be great if you could send us your first and second choice so that we know what to ship you if we run out of one animal. These plush toys include information about your Wild Neighbours, courtesy of Robert Bateman.


And finally, the $50 level. If you’re even considering donating at this level, we’d like you to have our most sincere thanks. Because we can tell that art and the environment mean a lot to you, we would like to offer you something that means a lot to us: we have two different prints by wildlife artist Robert Bateman-- “Family Hike” and “Getting to Know”-- that are not available anywhere else.  ("Family Hike" is on the left and "Getting to Know" is on the right in the image below.) These prints are only available through us and would make a special addition to any nature lover's collection. Thank you so much for your contribution.

We do ask that if you live outside of the USA or Canada that you please add $20 to your perk for international shipping.
To all our supporters and well-wishers: thank you from the bottom of our hearts. You have truly made a difference and we are excited about making this year’s contest the best ever.

We have some really awesome and unique perks lined up for you--you cannot get any of these items anywhere else on the planet. Whatever amount you decide to donate, we want to thank you. Every dollar helps and we are incredibly grateful for your support. 
At the $10 level, we’ll offer you your choice of a cougar, wolf, grizzly bear, polar bear, or moose notepad/fridge magnet. These notepads make great grocery or to-do lists and are super handy to have around the house. Thank you for your support!





At the $15 level we’d like to offer you the amazing Get to Know Contest Art Calendar. Choose between the 2014 calendar (both the US and the Canadian editions are available) or our exclusive Special Occasions Calendar, which can be used at any time to record birthdays, holidays, anniversaries, and other events of note.
At the $25 level, you have your choice of any of our plush animals:  the grizzly bear, black bear, leopard frog, peregrine falcon, or the barn owl. We have limited supplies of each, so you will be receiving something that is truly special. This also means that it would be great if you could send us your first and second choice so that we know what to ship you if we run out of one animal. These plush toys include information about your Wild Neighbours, courtesy of Robert Bateman.



And finally, the $50 level. If you’re even considering donating at this level, we’d like you to have our most sincere thanks. Because we can tell that art and the environment mean a lot to you, we would like to offer you something that means a lot to us: we have two different prints by wildlife artist Robert Bateman-- “Family Hike” and “Getting to Know”-- that are not available anywhere else.  ("Family Hike" is on the left and "Getting to Know" is on the right in the image below.) These prints are only available through us and would make a special addition to any nature lover's collection. Thank you so much for your contribution.


We do ask that if you live outside of the USA or Canada that you please add $20 to your perk for international shipping.To all our supporters and well-wishers: thank you from the bottom of our hearts. You have truly made a difference and we are excited about making this year’s contest the best ever.

story:
What if???

I'm not sure of what the percentages of each are but I know that I am partially driven by a need, partially by my commitment and partially by good old fashion curiosity .

Crowd funding (a simple way for people to help people reach their dreams and complete their projects) is not a new concept and might be compared to; "paying it forward insurance".  Yes, it is a form of begging but it is also, clearly a fun way to complete a project that is worthy of completion. Let's have fun with this and see if we can make it work.  It only takes a second to donate to the campaign. When you reach the payment part you can use PayPal, Mastercard, Visa and other easy methods. You will either be able to follow the success on this site or, if you donate, even $1, I will put your email on my list and keep you informed of the successes in much more detail.

My mind seems to "kick in" under pressure.  I am under pressure and this is where I ended up. Maybe, just maybe, I can bring my project which has been going on for years and costing me thousands of dollars, to a successful conclusion and move into the next phase.  

Every once in a while, I buy a power ball ticket.  I am not a gambler so I want instant gratification for my purchase. I always get my $2 worth.  Just dreaming of who I would help and how I would help others with needs, how my church would use the 10% they would receive, and yes, what I would indulge myself in. While I never expect to win, I always have more than my $2 worth of fun thinking about what I would do if I did.

I'm kind of hoping you may feel the same way about pitching in a couple bucks to my worthy cause and then smiling when you watch the success.  I assume you are at the very least, curious, just as I am.  At some point everyone either decides to go to Costa Rica or has a friend or family member who is going. By being part of this campaign, you, your family and your friends are connected.  You can say, with confidence: "I have a connection in Costa Rica and they may be able to give you some insight on your trip". I plan to be here a while and will be ready and willing to help when I can. 

You can replay the video as many times as you want and each time make a visit in your mind to this, most special place on the earth.  On those long cold winter nights, you can play the attached video and say to yourself: "some day I am going to call Jim and make a plan to come down to indulge in the pure and preserved nature immersed experience". You can know that it is 80 degrees and brimming with color at La Cuesta Roja no matter how cold or bleek it is out your front window. While you are watching the video, you will be knowing that you have been a part in protecting La Cuesta Roja for years and years to come. Better yet, you can spend some time planning on just how you will make it a reality and come stay at this incredible location which I hope to preserve for many generations.

My name is easy to remember: James Cameron.  I am also googleable for background.  I am a 67 year old semi retired ex-coffee roaster from Wisconsin now living in Costa Rica (it's that winter thing).  I have been coming to Costa Rica for 40 years; many of the trips for my former coffee roasting company: Cameron's Coffee Co., Inc. During those years and trips I was able to find the best part of Costa Rica and then lucked into the best of the best.  Now I want, and need, to share it.

My small eco tourism project is located on one of the most beautiful pieces of real estate in the world.  With your help, La Cuesta Roja will remain wild, natural and available to visit for the few. The approximately 5 protected acres, only accessible by boat, is sandwiched between incredible remote white sand ocean beaches and thick, lush, green, wildlife filled rain forest at the mouth of the magnificent  and wild Sierpe River.  It is nothing short of spectacular.

There are many reasons this property is special and unique.  The fact that you do not have to travel through the sometimes treacherous "Boca de Sierpe", to arrive here is important.  The sandbars out in the ocean break the large and powerful Pacific Ocean swells rendering the beaches at La Cuesta Roja perfect to swim and play in.  Check it out on Google Earth at: N08 46' 30.67"  W83 38' 09.01"

I knew the first afternoon after I purchased this property a little over 13 years ago; "this needs to be shared".  I sat in awe, as so many have since, on the front porch of the now 43 year old home and scarcely could believe the abundant natural beauty.  I have worked hard and spent almost all of my reserves to transform this location into a beach forest reserve that can be visited by a few people who share the desire to experience, but not molest, nature at it's finest.  

You can make the difference between this being a lightly used eco retreat or some kind of development.  I cannot do it alone, I need your help.  You will be helping to  preserve a piece of the world which is so deserving of being placed into a sustainable off grid eco destination that will not become just another development or home site of a wealthy individual.

I think this will be interesting and fun for all of us

I am looking to raise $16,000 dollars (after tax, credit card and PayPal fees and the commissions to indiegogo) to complete the securing of the forest reserve status for the property.  While this is not a huge number, I have nearly exhausted every dime of my retirement funds to preserve this property for ever.  It has been costly for me to do all of the essential studies and evaluations needed to place the property into Patrimonio Natural del Estado;  PNE (http://www.sinac.go.cr/competencias/ASP/Patrimonio/Paginas/default.aspx).  I am getting very near the finish line and have an estimate from the well established company that is doing the work for me to get this done.  Once La Cuesta Roja is established as a forest reserve that will be kept in a natural state (Natural del Estado) indefinitely, I can start the second phase.  I am confident we will reach and exceed our goal of $16,000.00.  Any overages will be used to continue on into the second Phase.

Phase two will be the removal of the current aging home on the property and the building of a small two bedroom cabin behind the 50 meter zone, with solar electric, spring water, completely off grid and sustainable with very little environmental impact.  The cabin will have similar views to those currently enjoyed from the house: Ocean, Mountain, rain forest and river all visible from the house.  It will also have good access to the beaches in front.  This is all part of phase two, let's concentrate on getting past phase one.

The Impact

There are several other land owners at and near the Boca de Sierpe equally committed to the preservation of this exceptional part of the world.  None of us want to see a hotel or development of home owners or commercial project beyond a very small well managed and ecologically minded eco tourism destination. There are no land owners considering development in this area. You will be making an investment in the preservation of one small but intricate part of the ecological system and insuring it's survival in a world of consumption.

I have been the designated steward of this incredible property for the last 13+ years.  During this period, I have removed one building, fought to avoid public restrooms at the beach which would have invited campers, too many daily visitors resulting in pressure on the abundant wildlife in the area.  I have removed trails and stair cases and returned the land to it's native habitat.  I have not built any buildings nor changed the building that has been here for 43 years.  I have only maintained and protected the area.

This project has firm traction and is rolling smoothly. I have been renting the house for the last several years as an eco tourism destination with incredible success.  Not financially (nearly every penny that has come in has gone to preservation, caretaker payment and my effort to protect the property from ever being a commercial site) but in sharing this location which is so very special.  My web site for the rental of this property is: www.lacuestaroja.5u.com which I welcome you to look over to get even a better idea of what this property has and will continue to have available to the ecologically orientated conservationists who share it.  There is no shortage of recreation available right from the site including beach, forest, river and ocean. My experience in running an eco tourism business is clearly shown in the 44 (today's count) consecutive 5 star reviews on the way in which I conduct the business of sharing this "made to be shared" location and what it has to offer those in search of a true eco adventure.  Not only will you be proud to be a part of this worthy project but you will also have a permanent connection to the vast splendor of the Osa Peninsula and Costa Rica.

Other Ways You Can Help

I hope you have become both interested and curious of the outcome of this campaign and project and will want to become part of it.  I realize that not everyone can hit the contribute button or commit to be a part of someone else's dream.  I hope to attract a large number of people who will give just a couple dollars to become part of the journey and be on the mailing list keeping you up to date on the progress. 

I am only sending this to people who know me, know my commitment to  the preservation of nature and my high level of integrity.  The only way this campaign can be successful is if you send it along to a select group along with a strong indorsement of the integrity of the campaign.  If your connections then send it along with your recommendation, we just may hit the magic number of conscientious and curious people to raise the funds needed to preserve this property for many life times. Tell your friends and everyone you know.  If you have a mailing list of eco minded people, school classes, or any list, please share this with them.

campaign_city: Drake Bay area Osa Peninsula, Costa Rica

story:
tewanonhstat ne kaniataratie – Protect the River

URGENT! $1 BILLION needed immediately. The kanien’keha:ka women, the public and supporters worldwide will raise funds to stop the Mayor of the CITY OF MONTREAL and his successors from unlawfully dumping 8 billion litres or more of toxic sewage into kaniatarowanen'on:we – also known as the St. Lawrence River. It violates kaia’nereh:kowa the law of the land, Canadian rules and regulations and international efforts to protect the environment.

  • Mayor of CITY OF MONTREAL intends to dump 8 billion litres of raw, untreated sewage (inclu. medical & industrial waste) 
  • These funds are to prevent the dumping into the river and ensure an alternative is found. The cost of $1 billion is the estimate from the CITY OF MONTREAL to employ reasonable alternatives to the proposed dumping plan
  • No dumping will be accepted by kontiia'takwe'ni:io or the rotinoshonni'on:we - the Women Title Holders of the Land and the People of the Longhouse / Original People of the Land
McGill University will be asked to find a permanent solution within six months. All people have a duty to protect all forms of life. Mayor Denis Coderre would rather fund an aqua park and baseball fields, while illegally dumping untreated toxic sewage, medical and industrial waste into the river. He is willing to pay a  fine to commit the crime.

Let’s stand together to save our mother, the earth. There are alternatives. Your donations can help stop this environmental catastrophe staring us in the face. Should we not raise $1 billion, you will be reimbursed. kaniatarowanen'on:we is a fragile ecosystem that we must all preserve, It is one of the most important river and lake systems in the world, in the heart of o'noware:ke, Great Turtle Island. Nia:wen. kontiia'takwe'ni:io, Women Title Holders.

story:
A massive explosion took place in Beirut today leaving hundreds of casualties, including dead and wounded.

Hospitals are extremely overwhelmed and forced to turn away injured people. Lebanon is in a state of humanitarian disaster.

We're raising money for the Lebanese Red Cross to help them in their response to this explosion!

All funds raised will be sent to the Lebanese Red Cross via wire transfer. Fundraised through The961 Foundation - a registered NGO in Canada (1171813-4).

Please donate anything that you can. Thank you!

Lebanon is in a state of humanitarian disaster.We're raising money for the Lebanese Red Cross to help them in their response to this explosion!All funds raised will be sent to the Lebanese Red Cross via wire transfer. Fundraised through The961 Foundation - a registered NGO in Canada (1171813-4).Please donate anything that you can. Thank you!

story:
Resumen/Summary

Somos un grupo de estudiantes del Master en Gerencia Ambiental en la Universidad de Duke en Estados Unidos. Estamos llevando a cabo un proyecto que involucra pequeños caficultores en 3 paises de Latinoamerica:
Colombia, Guatemala y Perú. Nuestra meta principal es ayudar a las comunidades de productores de café a encontrar estrategias efectivas para contrarrestar las amenazas y efectos del cambio climático. Entre éstas amenazas se encuentran sequías, deforestación de bosques nativos y perdida de cosechas enteras. 

We are a group of Master students of Environmental Management at Duke University in The United States. We are developing a scientific research project involving small holders Coffee growers of three Latin American countries: Colombia, Guatemala and Perú. Our main goal is to help them find effective strategies that assist them to counteract the environmental threats a phenomena like climate change implies, like droughts, deforestation, and loss of entire crops.  

¿Qué necesitamos? y ¿Cómo nos puedes ayudar?/ What We Need & What You Get

Queremos involucrar a los miembros de las comunidades. Para esto queremos visitarlos, conocerlos, conocer sus cosechas y entender sus fortalezas y necesidades. Queremos involucrarnos en su vida diaria y entenderlos y aprender de ellos. Para esto necesitamos viajar a los paises y no contamos con este dinero. Afortunadamente tenemos el soporte financiero para el análisis de los datos pero estamos intentando recoger fondos que nos ayuden con los gastos durante la investigación.
Al final del proyecto queremos entregarles a las comunidades un folleto con toda la información recopilada. La idea es que el folleto tenga un resumen de las estrategias a las que ellos pueden recurrir para mitigar y adaptarse al cambio climático. Así mismo queremos hacerlos partícipes de nuestra investigación dando a conocer sus preocupaciones, fortalezas, necesidades y conocimiento. Para esto queremos escribir un artículo científico de relevancia especial con el ánimo de contar nuestros resultados.

We want these communities to take part on this study, we want to visit them, meet them, their crops and get to understand their strengths and needs. We want to get immersed in their work and expressly learn from them. In order to achieve this we need to travel to these countries, and for that we need funding. We already count with the financial support to perform the data analysis but we are still working hard to get the full economical support so as to successfully complete the research.

By the end of this Project we want to put together a brochure that will be handed over all the coffee growers we´ll be working with. This brochure will contain the different strategies and the different scenarios where they can use them to mitigate the effects of climate change. We want to make them part of the research publications in the social networks and promote their invaluable local knowledge.

Finally having observed the effects of this project on the community and their product, we would like to transmit the knowledge acquired though a scientific paper. 

El Impacto/ The Impact

Esperamos que este proyecto tenga un efecto multiplicador y de verdad ayude a los pequeños caficultores de los tres paises. A veces la solución siempre ha estado ahí, sólo hay que tomarse el tiempo para hacerla visible. Todas estas comunidades son sabias y tienen conocimientos que provienen desde sus antepasados y conocen muy bien el cultivo del café. Esperamos que nuestra contrubución sea parte de todo un conjunto de conocimientos. Esperamos ayudarlos a entender cuales son los retos y a ayudarlos a construir nuevas estrategias y herramientas que los puedan ayudar a sobrellevar los obstáculos del cambio climático y convertirlos en oportunidades. Sin embargo, también tenemos claro que es posible que nosotros aprendamos muchísimo de ellos y nos ayude a entendernos también a nosotros.

We are hoping that this Project has a multiplier effect. Sometimes the solution has always been there, and you just need to make an effort to see it. These are wise communities, they carry with them ancient knowledge. Our contribution is to help them understand on time, the challenges that they´ll have to go through and help them build new tools to carry on in spite of new and more agressive obstacules. But definitely the biggest achievement will be to gain their wisdom.


Otras formas de ayudar / Other Ways You Can Help

1. Con su entusiasmo.
2. Si no tiene plata(dinero en algunos países de latinoamérica) pero tiene una idea que nos pueda ayudar, por favor mándenos un email a mmr33@duke.edu
3. Si tiene amigos que si tengan plata, por favor mandeles este link.
4.Si tiene amigos que no tienen plata pero tienen buenas ideas... mandeles esto y dígales que miren el punto #2.
5.Muchas Gracias

1. With your enthusiasm.

2. If you don’t have money but you do have a great idea, please send us an e-mail m at mmr33@duke.edu. 

3. If you have Friends that are willing to give money for a good cause, you might want to send this to them. 

4. If you have Friends that are not willing to give money but they have awesome ideas, well…you should also send this to them and tell them to look at point #2.

5. Many thanks!
