Coffee growers of three Latin American countries: Colombia, Guatemala and Perú.
Our main goal is to help them find effective strategies that assist them to
counteract the environmental threats a phenomena like climate change implies,
like droughts, deforestation, and loss of entire crops.  ¿Qué necesitamos? y ¿Cómo nos puedes ayudar?/ What We Need & What You GetQueremos involucrar a los miembros de las comunidades. Para esto queremos visitarlos, conocerlos, conocer sus cosechas y entender sus fortalezas y necesidades. Queremos involucrarnos en su vida diaria y entenderlos y aprender de ellos. Para esto necesitamos viajar a los paises y no contamos con este dinero. Afortunadamente tenemos el soporte financiero para el análisis de los datos pero estamos intentando recoger fondos que nos ayuden con los gastos durante la investigación.Al final del proyecto queremos entregarles a las comunidades un folleto con toda la información recopilada. La idea es que el folleto tenga un resumen de las estrategias a las que ellos pueden recurrir para mitigar y adaptarse al cambio climático. Así mismo queremos hacerlos partícipes de nuestra investigación dando a conocer sus preocupaciones, fortalezas, necesidades y conocimiento. Para esto queremos escribir un artículo científico de relevancia especial con el ánimo de contar nuestros resultados.We want these
communities to take part on this study, we want to visit them, meet them, their
crops and get to understand their strengths and needs. We want to get immersed
in their work and expressly learn from them. In order to achieve this we need
to travel to these countries, and for that we need funding. We already count
with the financial support to perform the data analysis but we are still
working hard to get the full economical support so as to successfully complete
the research. 
By the end of
this Project we want to put together a brochure that will be handed over all
the coffee growers we´ll be working with. This brochure will contain the
different strategies and the different scenarios where they can use them to mitigate
the effects of climate change. We want to make them part of the research
publications in the social networks and promote their invaluable local
knowledge.
Finally having observed the effects of this project on the community and their
product, we would like to transmit the knowledge acquired though a scientific
paper. El Impacto/ The ImpactEsperamos que este proyecto tenga un efecto multiplicador y de verdad ayude a los pequeños caficultores de los tres paises. A veces la solución siempre ha estado ahí, sólo hay que tomarse el tiempo para hacerla visible. Todas estas comunidades son sabias y tienen conocimientos que provienen desde sus antepasados y conocen muy bien el cultivo del café. Esperamos que nuestra contrubución sea parte de todo un conjunto de conocimientos. Esperamos ayudarlos a entender cuales son los retos y a ayudarlos a construir nuevas estrategias y herramientas que los puedan ayudar a sobrellevar los obstáculos del cambio climático y convertirlos en oportunidades. Sin embargo, también tenemos claro que es posible que nosotros aprendamos muchísimo de ellos y nos ayude a entendernos también a nosotros.We are hoping that this Project has a multiplier
effect. Sometimes the solution has always been there, and you just need to make
an effort to see it. These are wise communities, they carry with them ancient
knowledge. Our contribution is to help them understand on time, the challenges
that they´ll have to go through and help them build new tools to carry on in
spite of new and more agressive obstacules. But definitely the biggest achievement
will be to gain their wisdom.Otras formas de ayudar / Other Ways You Can Help1. Con su entusiasmo.2. Si no tiene plata(dinero en algunos países de latinoamérica) pero tiene una idea que nos pueda ayudar, por favor mándenos un email a mmr33@duke.edu3. Si tiene amigos que si tengan plata, por favor mandeles este link.4.Si tiene amigos que no tienen plata pero tienen buenas ideas... mandeles esto y dígales que miren el punto #2.5.Muchas Gracias1. With your enthusiasm.
2. If you don’t have money but you do have a great
idea, please send us an e-mail m at mmr33@duke.edu. 
3. If you have Friends that are willing to give
money for a good cause, you might want to send this to them. 
4. If you have Friends that are not willing to give
money but they have awesome ideas, well…you should also send this to them and
tell them to look at point #2.
5. Many thanks!

story:
As of today (23 January 2014) a local resident has pledged £500 if we can find another few residents who will match this.  We also have a cheque in the post for £50.00.  Please, please donate if you can and also spread the word via email or social media.


Summary

Many people of Bridgwater have objected to the proposed development of 'The Meads' and surrounding greenbelt on land south of Durleigh Road in Bridgwater.  Many people believe this development to be illegal as the land allocated for this development was never passed by the planning inspectorate.  

Although the proposed housing development isn't actually on 'The Meads'  but south and on elevated ground of said area, we believe it would have a determental impact on wildlife connected with the said area.

Objections came in the form of official documents submitted to Sedgemoor District Council Planning with over 65 people voicing their concerns.  An online petition was signed by over 650 people.  Although the council chose not to recognise this petition we feel it is still relevent and you can still sign it as we will be forwarding this again within the next couple of weeks.  You can view and sign the petiton by following the link; 

http://www.change.org/en-GB/petitions/sedgemoor-district-council-stop-the-proposed-development-of-an-eco-park-on-the-meads-in-bridgwater

;or go to Google and type in; 'Sedgemoor District Council: Stop the proposed development of an 'Eco Park' on The Meads in Bridgwater'.

Another paper petition with over 250 signatures have all been seen and ignored by our council.  We therefore are looking to raise funds for a judicial review and if need be, a court case.  Your funding will help to:

  • Pay for a solicitor to undertake a judicial review.
  • Pay for a court case if this need be.

As of 23rd December 2013 planning permission was granted to Summerfields Developers to go ahead with the said development.

What We Need & What You Get

Initially we need funds to pay a solicitor to ascertain whether the proposed development is illegal.  On conclusion and depending on if this development is indeed illegal, we will need funding to pay for a court process.

Although we are not sure of the total cost of this campaign, the initial expenses are:

  • To hire a solicitor for a judicial review will cost approx.  £1.500.
  • To hire a barrister will cost approx. £1,500.
  • Initial court costs will be approx. (This is the very first stage and we envisage this may be much higher)  £6.000.
  • Indiegogo charges approx.  £1,400.
  • Funds above and beyond £10,000 will be used to facilitate further stages of the judicial review as it progresses if and when needed.
  • Any additional funds will be added at a later date.
  • Any surplace funds will be donated to the Environmental Law Foundation who have agreed to help us fight this development.

The Impact

We all agree that Bridgwater is a fast growing town and with the onset of new and big developments such as Hinkley C, people will need housing.  We believe our council should also consider that people need space and nature.  There are already major housing developments underway and completed in Bridgwater.  Important greenspaces such as The Meads and land south of Durleigh Road should be left alone.  If we can save this corridor of nature we will be:

  • Protecting important wildlife such as otters, badgers, water voles and birds of prey amongst others.
  • Leaving a vehicle free area for dog walkers, children and nature lovers.
  • Giving Bridgwater a 'set of lungs' amongst the concrete and tarmac.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t afford to contribute, but that doesn't matter, you can still help by sharing this campaign on Facebook and other social sites:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Where is the money going?

Donated funds are held by Larcomes LLP Solicitors in a client account.  Larcomes LLP Solicitors were recommended by the Environment Agency as they have specialist knowledge in this area.

http://www.larcomes.co.uk/contact.htm

Contact person is David Sumner.

How to donate

You can donate via the pre-set 'Perks' or you can make a payment of your own choice via the red 'Contribute Now' button located at the top of the page.

Bridgwater is a great market town and has a wonderful community, lets pull together and keep it that way.  Thank you.

story:
• Have you ever been without power during severe weather or an emergency?
  • Have you ever absolutely needed power from your batteries and they did not work?
  • Has your vehicle ever left you stranded at night with no light to help you repair it?
  • Did your cell phone ever run out of power when you needed it most?
  • Do you need an adjustable battery to adapt to your power requirements?
  • Do you have a house without electricity or want to help people in developing countries?
  • Have you ever been out running, biking, hiking, camping, hunting, fishing, etc., only to realize that your nightlight ran out of batteries?


Your answer to all these situations is the H2Only Battery*
The only rechargeable battery in the world
that is activated with water; or any liquid.

*Patent No. WIPO WO 2013072708 A1 and ‘Patent Pending’ in the USA

With the H2Only Battery, you can Produce Electricity Anywhere, Anytime. Over and over and over again!


What is the 'H2Only Battery'?
It is a new technological breakthrough based on a patented alloy of metals that utilizes what we call ‘Controlled Oxidation’, and produces electricity per specific power needs.


I want it! What’s ready today?
We are ready to go into manufacturing for the H2Only Battery FLASHLIGHT and LIGHT.

  • The FLASHLIGHT has 7 LEDs blasting a beam bright enough to read signage letters 20m away! The FLASHLIGHT Kit contains: 1 FLASHLIGHT cap and 1 H2Only Battery.

    On a daily use of 8 hours, the H2Only Battery for the FLASHLIGHT lasts more than 60 sets of 2 AA or 2 AAA batteries! On occasional use, it will last forever! We mean it!

  • The LIGHT has 8 LEDs blasting light at 150 lumens in every direction, enough to light up a room up to 20sqm. The LIGHT Kit contains: 1 LIGHT cap, 2 H2Only Batteries and 1 FLASHLIGHT cap.


Specifications for the FLASHLIGHT and LIGHT:
- Weight: 200 grams
- Height: 17 cm
- Diameter: 6 cm
- FLASHLIGHT: 7 50/50 SMD directional LED at 200 lumen
- LIGHT: 8 50/50 SMD omni-directional LED at 150 lumen


What other cool devices will be coming?
We already have working prototypes for the Emergency Flashing TRIANGLE for Vehicles, the Sports LIGHT, the mobile-phone CHARGER, the H2Only Battery for RADIO, and the H2Only Battery for ROAD CONSTRUCTION Signage. We are designing the H2Only Battery which will be applicable to all low-voltage devices and the CLIP-ON/CLIP-OFF H2Only Battery (it will be the only adjustable battery in the world).

To make matters more exciting, we anticipate that our 3rd generation H2Only Battery will be able to power homes!


What’s great and unique about the 'H2Only Battery'?
It can keep going for 8+ hours every day, has no expiration date, does not leak and does not disintegrate, is CE Certified for safety, has no toxics or chemicals, and is renewable, recyclable and sustainable.


We left the best for last:
- Want more energy? Just clip-on another battery!
- Want less energy? Just unclip the batteries you don’t need!
We are designing the H2Only Battery to be Fully Adjustable on Power Needs!


The H2Only Battery will always be there for you!






If you need more details on the H2Only Battery and the Team behind it, read on!



What are the uses for the 'H2Only Battery’?

If you think about it, the uses of such an amazing invention are pretty much endless. What’s awesome is that the battery can take any shape or size! We can even manufacture custom batteries depending on the power requirement!

Personal Use –

  • Outdoor and Patio Lighting (rain can activate it too!)
  • Camping; Fishing; Hunting; Outdoor Activities
  • Sports (visibility lights for runners, cyclists, etc.)
  • Mobile Chargers, e.g. for mobile phones
  • Personal Survival Equipment (survival kits; it even works with urine!)
  • Emergency lighting for when electricity is out
  • Power source for every household appliance with low voltage demands, e.g. radios
  • The list is endless!

Commercial Use –

  • Emergency Lighting, e.g. elevators, buildings when electricity is out
  • Airport Emergency Lighting (military and civilian)
  • Lighthouses
  • Street Signage
  • Automotive (emergency triangle, flashlight, jump-start battery)
  • Lights for Ships with no generators, e.g. sailing
  • Monasteries and Places with no electricity

Survival Equipment –

  • Military Survival Kits (carried-on or in vehicles)
  • General Survival Equipment (survival kits, life vests in ships and airplanes)
  • Evacuation Lifeboats (ships and airplanes)
  • Lights for Shelters, Tunnels, Naval Lenses
How does the 'H2Only Battery’ work?

Just instantly dip the battery in a glass of water, in a stream, in a river, in the sea, or simply wet it with the running water from a faucet, a watering hose, etc. In case of emergency, you can even urinate on it! What’s more, any other conventional liquid will work too!

The battery will instantly start producing electricity which will last for as long as the sponge inside the battery is wet. This practically means that the battery can keep going for days, depending on the climate. When you see that there’s a drop in the output, simply re-wet the battery! In addition, if you leave the battery to dry out completely, it will provide at its maximum power when you re-wet it.

Disruptive Technology

Our battery is set to rock the world!

It is the only rechargeable (open type) battery that is activated with water, or any other liquid, and has been patented as such. Beside water, the H2Only Battery requires oxygen to operate, hence the term 'open type'.

Unlike all other batteries in the market, the H2Only Battery:

  • does not contain any acidic or toxic chemicals
  • emits no toxic pollutants
  • is not explosive
  • has a very low Cost to Longevity ratio
  • does not lose its properties even if unused and is not subject to ageing
  • has a lifespan of decades depending on usage
  • takes seconds to charge
  • does not require a protection circuit to maintain output within limits
  • is fully recyclable and safe for the environment
Meet the H2Only Battery Team

George Vilanakis, Inventor, Founder and CEO
George has a passion for Renewable Energy Sources. Since the age of 10, he has been toying with electronic devices and making something out of what everybody else deemed useless. In 2001, he prototyped a home-heating system emitting zero pollutants, utilizing the conductivity of water to increase efficiency. He is the inventor of the ‘H2Only Battery’, having studied, researched and tested the technology since 2002. Each day, he spends countless hours in his laboratory improving the technology.


Chris Papadakis, Business Angel, Business and Strategy Advisor
Chris is a member of the Sophia Business Angels in south France and has 20+ years of international experience in the international business arena, focusing on the Technology sector. An Engineer by education holding a Master of Science degree, and an Entrepreneur at heart, he has participated in several investments in his career mostly in the IT sector, and is constantly on the look-out for the next disruptive technology that will rock the world.

Thanasis Mavroulis, International Business Development
Thanasis is an international business developer with particular expertise on Asian and African markets. Since 2003, he has designed and managed international projects in product development, sales creation and sourcing, especially in China. He holds a Master of Science degree from the School of Oriental & African Studies from the University of London. His current focus is on supply chain management, and business continuity following natural disasters.
Why We Need Your Support?

We have been working on the H2Only Battery and its applications for the past 6 years. We have achieved tremendous breakthroughs and have overcome all technological barriers.

But now, we need your help. Your support will allow us to gather the funds required to lead us into manufacturing so we can make our H2Only Battery available to you and the millions of people who seek a piece of mind in an emergency, or even more who are deprived of electricity in their homes.

We are out on a mission. We intend to partner with leading Organizations in order to provide at least one ‘H2Only Battery LIGHT’ to homes in Africa that do not have electricity. Help us help people, provide piece of mind to people and make this breakthrough something that will rock the world!

We have designed our Indiegogo Campaign Perks so that you will benefit two-fold:

  • You will get the FLASHLIGHT and/or the LIGHT at a price lower than the retail prices.
  • Depending on the Perk you select, you will also contribute to helping people (Africa to start with) by offering them a necessity that they don’t have: light. We call our Cause: LIGHT Africa!

Why should you support us?

  • You have had cases when you needed to have light - perhaps in an emergency or in a blackout, and you either did not have it or you wished you had changed your leaking batteries…
  • You are conscious about not polluting the environment and strive to help as much possible to save our planet.
  • You want to help people who are deprived of the simplest necessities such as electricity.

We cordially thank you for your support!

Questions and Answers

1. Purchasing & Use (Quantity, Colors, etc.)

How many ‘H2Only Battery’ devices do I need?

If we were to compare our Battery to anything, that would be with a pair of running shoes! They both need some rest. That’s why for all our devices which will undergo continuous use – such as the LIGHT – we include 2 sets of ‘H2Only Batteries’ in the kit, so that you can interchange them.

So, after you’ve used the one set for 2-3 days, you will be able to prolong its lifespan if you let it dry out completely and use the second set in the interim.

How long will the ‘H2Only Battery’ last?
This depends on many factors, the most important being Usage. Other, less important factors are weather conditions and type of liquid used to activate.

For example, the FLASHLIGHT will probably not be used on a daily basis, but rather occasionally. This means that once it is activated and used, it will dry out completely. This FLASHLIGHT can last for many decades without the need to purchase a replacement H2Only Battery. In effect, you will have a FLASHLIGHT for the rest of your life!

On the other hand, the LIGHT will probably be used on a daily basis for 6+ hours every night, especially in regions without electricity. The proper use in this case would be to run the LIGHT on Battery no. 1 for 2-3 days, and then switch to Battery no. 2 (included in the kit) for the following 2-3 days. If possible, depending on weather conditions, it would be ideal to alternate the Batteries every day. In this way, the LIGHT will keep going for at least 3 months.

It should be apparent that weather conditions also affect the performance. In very hot climates, water evaporates very fast; so on the one hand, rewetting of the H2Only Battery will be more frequent, but on the other hand, the H2Only Battery will perform more because it will dry out sooner completing more dry-to-wet cycles. Remember we said that drying out the battery completely prolongs its lifespan?

The type of liquid plays a big role in the longevity of the H2Only Battery. We recommend activating the battery with simple water. Sea water will also work, yet the salt will cause the H2Only Battery to have a less number of restarts. We have designed the H2Only Battery to be able to be activated with any ‘normal’ liquid. This means that in case of an emergency, urine will also work!

What happens when my ‘H2Only Battery’ runs out?
Here’s the best part! Our H2Only Battery is fully recyclable. What this means is that you can send it back to us and we’ll send you a new H2Only Battery at reduced price. If you want to keep your old one, go ahead! We’ll still send you a new one at reduced price; but you will not have contributed to saving the environment. Think about it!

Will it replace the conventional flashlight or light that I have?
The intention of our invention is to provide electricity when it’s required, when either the power grid fails, or … when there’s no power grid, or … you just want to save on your electricity bill. The feedback from our testers has shown that after a short while, you will get to love the FLASHLIGHT and the LIGHT so much, that you’ll wonder why on earth you did not have one before!

Can I choose what color I want?
Absolutely! The various color variations are listed and shown above. There is no standard color, so make sure you specify what color you want.

Should however the color of your choice is not be available, we will let you know. You may then chose to wait for the backordered item or select another color."

Can anyone use the H2Only Battery?

Absolutely! The thought behind inventing the ‘H2Only Battery’ is that it should be a device that can be activated even by a small child. We were amazed when at some point during the prototype testing phase, the 2-year old daughter of one of the Team members asked to have the FLASHLIGHT, was told that it does not work, and instantly stated “Well, put it in water Daddy!” It’s that easy!

2. Buying & Shipping (Shipping costs, International, Timeline)

What are the shipping costs?
For all shipping costs across the world please see each Perk, so please make sure you include that with your order. We don’t anticipate that there will be any extra charges for customs, yet please note that shipment does not include extra fees from customs, or additional costs associated with your country. If it turns out that shipment to your country proves too expensive, we will reimburse your order.

When is the soonest I can get the Flashlight or the Light?
Estimated shipping dates for these devices begin in June 2014. Our goal is to have them out to you earlier but we know that sometimes things don’t go as planned, and we want to make sure not to overpromise. Our commitment to you: we are working full-steam to bring this to market, and as soon as it’s ready, it will be sent out to you!

3. Safety

How safe is the H2Only Battery?
Consider that it’s the only battery out there that has been CE CertifiedThe CE certification verifies that our products comply with all applicable EC requirements, such as safety, health, and environmental protection. Practically speaking, none of our products contain any toxic materials, chemicals or any other pollutants or hazardous stuff. They are absolutely safe to use, and … unlike most batteries, they cannot be swallowed by small children, so feel free to teach them how to use them!

Any more questions? Ask away!

We hope you join us.

Military Survival Kits (carried-on or in vehicles)
General Survival Equipment (survival kits, life vests in ships and airplanes)
Evacuation Lifeboats (ships and airplanes) 
Lights for Shelters, Tunnels, Naval Lenses 
How does the 'H2Only Battery’ work?
Just instantly dip the battery in a glass of water, in a stream, in a river, in the sea, or simply wet it with the running water from a faucet, a watering hose, etc. In case of emergency, you can even urinate on 
it! What’s more, any other conventional liquid will work too! 
The battery will instantly start producing electricity which will last for as long as the sponge inside the battery is wet. This practically means that the battery can keep going for days, depending on the climate. When you see that there’s a drop in the output, simply re-wet the battery! In addition, if you leave the battery to dry out completely, it will provide at its maximum power when you re-wet it.
Disruptive Technology
Our battery is set to rock the world! 
It is the only rechargeable (open type) battery that is activated with water, or any other liquid, and has been patented as such. Beside water, the H2Only Battery requires oxygen to operate, hence the term 'open type'.
Unlike all other batteries in the market, the H2Only Battery:

does not contain any acidic or toxic chemicals
emits no toxic pollutants
is not explosive
has a very low Cost to Longevity ratio
does not lose its properties even if unused and is not subject to ageing
has a lifespan of decades depending on usage
takes seconds to charge
does not require a protection circuit to maintain output within limits
is fully recyclable and safe for the environment
Meet the H2Only Battery Team




George Vilanakis, Inventor, Founder and CEO 
George has a passion for Renewable Energy Sources. Since the age of 10, he has been toying with electronic devices and making something out of what everybody else deemed useless. In 2001, he prototyped a home-heating system emitting zero pollutants, utilizing the conductivity of water to increase efficiency. He is the inventor of the ‘H2Only Battery’, having studied, researched and tested the technology since 2002. Each day, he spends countless hours in his laboratory improving the technology. 






Chris Papadakis, Business Angel, Business and Strategy Advisor 
Chris is a member of the Sophia Business Angels in south France and has 20+ years of international experience in the international business arena, focusing on the Technology sector. An Engineer by education holding a Master of Science degree, and an Entrepreneur at heart, he has participated in several investments in his career mostly in the IT sector, and is constantly on the look-out for the next disruptive technology that will rock the world. 






Thanasis Mavroulis, International Business Development 
Thanasis is an international business developer with particular expertise on Asian and African markets. Since 2003, he has designed and managed international projects in product development, sales creation and sourcing, especially in China. He holds a Master of Science degree from the School of Oriental & African Studies from the University of London. His current focus is on supply chain management, and business continuity following natural disasters.


Why We Need Your Support?
We have been working on the H2Only Battery and its applications for the past 6 years. We have achieved tremendous breakthroughs and have overcome all technological barriers.
But now, we need your help. Your support will allow us to gather the funds required to lead us into manufacturing so we can make our H2Only Battery available to you and the millions of people who seek a piece of mind in an emergency, or even 
more who are deprived of electricity in their homes.
We are out on a mission. We intend to partner with leading Organizations in order to provide at least one ‘H2Only Battery LIGHT’ to homes in Africa that do not have electricity. Help us help people, provide piece of mind to people and make this breakthrough something that will rock the world! 

We have designed our Indiegogo Campaign Perks so that you will benefit two-fold:

You will get the FLASHLIGHT and/or the LIGHT at a price lower than the retail prices.
Depending on the Perk you select, you will also contribute to helping people (Africa to start with) by offering them a necessity that they don’t have: light. We call our Cause: LIGHT Africa!

Why should you support us?

You have had cases when you needed to have light - perhaps in an emergency or in a blackout, and you either did not have it or you wished you had changed your leaking batteries… 
You are conscious about not polluting the environment and strive to help as much possible to save our planet.
You want to help people who are deprived of the simplest necessities such as electricity.
We cordially thank you for your support!
Questions and Answers1. Purchasing & Use (Quantity, Colors, etc.)
How many ‘H2Only Battery’ devices do I need?
If we were to compare our Battery to anything, that would be with a pair of running shoes! They both need some rest. That’s why for all our devices which will undergo continuous use – such as the LIGHT – we include 2 sets of ‘H2Only Batteries’ in the kit, so that you can interchange them.
So, after you’ve used the one set for 2-3 days, you will be able to prolong its lifespan if you let it dry out completely and use the second set in the interim.
How long will the ‘H2Only Battery’ last?
This depends on many factors, the most important being Usage. Other, less important factors are weather conditions and type of liquid used to activate.
For example, the FLASHLIGHT will probably not be used on a daily basis, but rather occasionally. This means that once it is activated and used, it will dry out completely. This FLASHLIGHT can last for many decades without the need to purchase a replacement H2Only Battery. In effect, you will have a FLASHLIGHT for the rest of your life!
On the other hand, the LIGHT will probably be used on a daily basis for 6+ hours every night, especially in regions without electricity. The proper use in this case would be to run the LIGHT on Battery no. 1 for 2-3 days, and then switch to Battery no. 2 (included in the kit) for the following 2-3 days. If possible, depending on weather conditions, it would be ideal to alternate the Batteries every day. In this way, the LIGHT will keep going for at least 3 months.
It should be apparent that weather conditions also affect the performance. In very hot climates, water evaporates very fast; so on the one hand, rewetting of the H2Only Battery will be more frequent, but on the other hand, the H2Only Battery will perform more because it will dry out sooner completing more dry-to-wet cycles. Remember we said that drying out the battery completely prolongs its lifespan?
The type of liquid plays a big role in the longevity of the H2Only Battery. We recommend activating the battery with simple water. Sea water will also work, yet the salt will cause the H2Only Battery to have a less number of restarts. We have designed the H2Only Battery to be able to be activated with any ‘normal’ liquid. This means that in case of an emergency, urine will also work!
What happens when my ‘H2Only Battery’ runs out?

Here’s the best part! Our H2Only Battery is fully recyclable. What this means is that you can send it back to us and we’ll send you a new H2Only Battery at reduced price. If you want to keep your old one, go ahead! We’ll still send you a new one at reduced price; but you will not have contributed to saving the environment. Think about it!
Will it replace the conventional flashlight or light that I have?

The intention of our invention is to provide electricity when it’s required, when either the power grid fails, or … when there’s no power grid, or … you just want to save on your electricity bill. The feedback from our testers has shown that after a short while, you will get to love the FLASHLIGHT and the LIGHT so much, that you’ll wonder why on earth you did not have one before!
Can I choose what color I want?
Absolutely! The various color variations are listed and shown above. There is no standard color, so make sure you specify what color you want.
Should however the color of your choice is not be available, we will let you know. You may then chose to wait for the backordered item or select another color."
Can anyone use the H2Only Battery?
 Absolutely! The thought behind inventing the ‘H2Only Battery’ is that it should be a device that can be activated even by a small child. We were amazed when at some point during the prototype testing phase, the 2-year old daughter of one of the Team members asked to have the FLASHLIGHT, was told that it does not work, and instantly stated “Well, put it in water Daddy!” It’s that easy!
2. Buying & Shipping (Shipping costs, International, Timeline)
What are the shipping costs?
 
For all shipping costs across the world please see each Perk, so please make sure you include that with your order. We don’t anticipate that there will be any extra charges for customs, yet please note that shipment does not include extra fees from customs, or additional costs associated with your country. If it turns out that shipment to your country proves too expensive, we will reimburse your order.
When is the soonest I can get the Flashlight or the Light?


Estimated shipping dates for these devices begin in June 2014. Our goal is to have them out to you earlier but we know that sometimes things don’t go as planned, and we want to make sure not to overpromise. Our commitment to you: we are working full-steam to bring this to market, 
and as soon as it’s ready, it will be sent out to you! 

3. Safety
How safe is the H2Only Battery?
Consider that it’s the only battery out there that has been CE CertifiedThe CE certification verifies that our products comply with all applicable EC requirements, such as safety, health, and environmental protection. Practically speaking, none of our products contain any toxic materials, chemicals or any other pollutants or hazardous stuff. They are absolutely safe to use, and … unlike most batteries, they cannot be swallowed by small children, so feel free to teach them how to use them!
Any more questions? Ask away!
We hope you join us.

story:
The Plan:

Our plan is to raise enough money to install solar panels on our roof.  Then, for the next 10 years, use the income produced by selling 100% of the energy produced by the solar panels to help low-income people around the world who need the money for their own entrepreneurial  projects and who don’t have access to typical banking services.  We would use micro-financing sites like KIVA.org where the people we assist pay us back slowly over time with their profits.  This allows us to take those payments and re-invest them back into more micro-financing projects to help more people. 

Microfinance is based on the idea that low-income individuals are capable of lifting themselves out of poverty if given access to financial services.  We discovered that we could help the most people by going the micro-financing route. By putting all those micro-payments back into the pot, we could in 10 years help over 18,000 people with close to half-a-million dollars!  All with a one time investment in a solar installation!

 

The Details:

Through a special government incentive program, we can secure a 20 year contract with our local hydro company that will pay 54.9 cents per kilowatt-hour (kWh) for all energy produced by the solar panels.  ( This is a good rate considering we are currently paying between 6.5 cents to 11.7 cents per kWh for energy consumed in our home).

The roof is perfectly south-facing and capable of holding a 9.75 kW system.  It is estimated that this system will earn $485.50 per month (averaged over the length of the contract since summer months will earn more than winter months for example).

To install the solar array it would cost $54,440.  It would take 10 years to pay off the system with our earnings of $485.50 per month.

We don’t have $54,440 lying around.

So, my plan is to raise the money to pay for the solar installation, and for the next 10 years use the income from the solar panels to help low-income people around the world who need the money for their own projects and don’t have access to typical banking services.  We would use micro-financing sites like KIVA.org where the people we assist pay us back slowly over time with their profits.  This allows us to take those payments and re-invest them back into more micro-financing projects to help more people. 

Microfinance is based on the idea that low-income individuals are capable of lifting themselves out of poverty if given access to financial services.  We discovered that we could help the most people by going the micro-financing route. By putting all those micro-payments back into the pot, we could in 10 years help over 18000 people with close to half-a-million dollars!  All with a one time $54,400 solar installation!

See our gallery page to see a chart of how this incredible growth will happen. Or download the Excel sheet to view and play with our numbers.

 

If you can’t help with a financial investment – you can still help!

Please spread the word about our project, if it gets funded you will have helped 18,000 needy people with close to half-a-million dollars!  Use the built in Share functions to make it easy too.  Contact your local paper if you thinks its news worthy – and share the link to this page.  And pray for the project too!    :o)

 

 

FAQ:

  • Why KIVA?

    Of all the microfinancing sites out there right now KIVA has the most people needing loans, and as those people pay back their loans (a little each month), KIVA gives it back to us (so each of those monthly micropayments will add up enabling us to help more people every month instead of waiting for the full loan to be paid back before we can invest in someone new).  In addition to www.kiva.org, we will consider other micro-lending sites too – right now we are looking at www.zidisha.org, http://www.energyincommon.org (I personally like this because it is specifically for green microfinancing – which can help people and do more to help the environment – similar to Kiva’s green specific loans too - http://www.kiva.org/green. Unfortunately they give us back the money after the entire loan is paid back, so it will slightly slow down the number of people we can help, and they currently have very few borrowers - but perhaps we can help the few they do have?!?!?)  and http://www.vittana.org/ (instead of investing in a business, this site lets you invest in education. This also has a longer payback period which slows down our goal of diretly helping 18,000 people in 10 years).

    Plus, things will change over 10 years... there may be new sites, improved services, etc. We will endeavour to use whatever services we deem to be the best to meet our goals. 

 

  • Why 10 years?

    If I had the money to pay for the solar installation myself, it would take 10 years to earn that money back.  By raising the money via IndieGoGo , instead of paying myself back, we would use the 10 years of income to help others.  And by using micro-financing to do it – the $57,500 raised can become $450,000 in aid to people in need.  

 

  • What happens after 10 years?

    Well, we don’t have a crystal ball, so we will decide at that time what we will do with any income or remaining funds.  We will first pay back everyone who donated $1000 or more. Then we will pay ourselves back for any costs that we had to pay out-of-pocket over the last 10 years (for example: if we had to repair the system). We may decide to upgrade the system assuming there is improved technology after 10 years. If there is a surplus we may decide to keep investing it, or donate part of it to charity.  We will have to see what the future holds.  But for now, we are promising to run this project for 10 years – that is 120 months of investing and reinvesting to people in need while helping the environment at the same time :o)



  • In the "Perks" section you say my donation will be multiplied 7.73 times.  What does that mean?

    By re-investing the money that is paid back to us every month, we will be re-investing the same money into more and more people in need.  Over the 10 years, your money will be reinvested 7.73 times.  So, for example, a $100 donation will at first help 4 people (at $25 each), but as each of those 4 people pay us back a little micorpayment every month, it willl take just 4 months to have enough money to help one more person. By continuing to reinvest the micropayments over 10 years that $100 loan will have helped 30 people with $773.  



  • You said the solar installation would cost $54,440, but you are asking for $57,500.  Why?  

    The actual cost of the solar installation is estimated at $47,677.  With tax and fees that grows to the $54,440 mentioned. Add onto that the fee Indiegogo will take for the fundraising platform, we will need to raise US$57,500 on Indiegogo to cover the costs of the solar installation.  See the "Gallery" for a more detailed breakdown.


  • What kind of solar panels and what company is doing the installation?

    We are looking at an array of 39 Siliken 250W panels, with an Enphase M215 inverter. 

    The company we are planning to use is:  Eco Alternative Energy   http://www.ecoaltenergy.com

    The hydro will be contected to: Festival Hydro http://www.festivalhydro.com
  • Are we guaranteed that the rooftop solar panels will earn that much over 10 years?

    Yes, the Ontario Power Authority (OPA) is giving 20 year contracts paying 54.9 cents per kilowatt hour.  We can fit 9.75 kilowatt panels on the perfectly south facing roof which is at a 26.5 pitch in full sun. This will earn us $485.50 per month on average (we will, for example, earn more in the summer than in the winter, and we will earn more in the early days when the panels are new. But this will all average out to $485.50 per month).

    Go here for more information on the OPA's microFIT program:
    http://microfit.powerauthority.on.ca/about-microfit

    Go here to see the pricing plan.  We are at the top of the list:  less than 10 kilowatt hour, rooftop solar system.
    http://microfit.powerauthority.on.ca/sites/default/files/news/FIT-mFITPriceScheduleV2.0.pdf



  • What about the solar panels degrading over time?

    Yes, Solar panels do degrade slightly each year (it’s expected).  But that has been taken into account when the numbers were crunched to come up with the $485.50 monthly income.  Siliken warranties that in year 1, we will get at least 97% of rated output, and in years 2-25, 0.7% per annum reduction.  In the attached proposal (see the Gallery page), you’ll notice that it was taken into account .5% reduction per annum over 20 years (which the installer says is probably a little more realistic.  If a solar manufacturer offers 0.7% per annum, you can expect that you will do better as they do not want to be replacing panels unless they absolutely have to).

    In fact, since the $485.50 per month calculated earnings were averaged over 20 years and the panels should earn more in the early years, we should earn more in the first 10 years - which means we could help even more people with more money than the calculations show!  Whoo hoo!


  • What if something breaks or the panels don't last that long or the roof needs replacing?

    The roof was reshingled last year, so we should be good for about 20 years.  

    There is a 10 year limited warranty on materials and workmanship for the Siliken 250W Solar panels, so we should be ok for the 10 years of the project.

    The Enphase micro-inverters (M215’s) are the latest design and come with a 25 year replacement warranty and free monitoring, meaning that for 25 years, we are completely covered.  If any of the micro-inverters were to go in 25 years, they actually would pay the installer to go out to our roof and replace them.  

    Plus, Eco Alternative Energy provides a full 2 year warranty on the installation (labour and parts).

    In addition, we will purchase insurance (about $100 per year that I will pay personally) to cover the cost of roof and panel replacement in case of an unforseen accident.

    So, we should be covered for the full 10 years of the project!  


  • What if you earn more money?  Or earn less than expected?

    All money earned from this project will go to the project.  We won't keep any of it.  We may earn more or less than expected, but all of it will go to helping people in need through micro-financing.  Hopefully, we will have some extra sunny days and be able to help even more people than we are expecting, and maybe even crack the half-million dollar mark! 


  • What is the environmental benefit?

    Annually, the solar energy will produce enough energy to power 371 houses for a day. (3710 over the 10 years)

    It will offset 17,133 pounds of carbon every year.  The equivalent of 196 trees.  (that is 171,330 pounds of carbon and 1,960 trees over the 10 years of the project).


  • How do the solar panels remove Carbon from our air?

    Ok, you caught me... they don’t actually “Remove” the carbon that is currently in our air, but by providing energy from solar panels we will replace the energy provided by those heavily polluting coal burning plants.  So we are really PREVENTING 1428 pounds of carbon from entering our air each month and not REMOVING existing carbon.  


  • Will I get to have a say in who and where the money is given?

    Yes and No.  We expect that the monthly re-investments in people will be a lot of work as the project grows and there is more and more money to loan to people every month.  We don't want to slow the process down by having to constantly consult with a world-wide committee every week.  However, we would welcome suggestions from anyone who donated to this project.  And, if we are unsure of whether or not to loan in a certain way (for example, through a new micro-financing route), we may choose to put out a survey to all of the supporters to this project and our direction will be dictated by where the majority of the survey votes want us to go.

    So yes, we will consider your suggestions, and you may get to vote on who, where and how we loan or donate our monies throughout the project.

(3710 over the 10 years)It will offset 17,133 pounds of carbon every year.  The equivalent of 196 trees.  (that is 171,330 pounds of carbon and 1,960 trees over the 10 years of the project).


How do the solar panels remove Carbon from our air?Ok, you caught me... they don’t actually “Remove” the carbon that is currently in our air, but by providing energy from solar panels we will replace the energy provided by those heavily polluting coal burning plants.  So we are really PREVENTING 1428 pounds of carbon from entering our air each month and not REMOVING existing carbon.  


Will I get to have a say in who and where the money is given?Yes and No.  We expect that the monthly re-investments in people will be a lot of work as the project grows and there is more and more money to loan to people every month.  We don't want to slow the process down by having to constantly consult with a world-wide committee every week.  However, we would welcome suggestions from anyone who donated to this project.  And, if we are unsure of whether or not to loan in a certain way (for example, through a new micro-financing route), we may choose to put out a survey to all of the supporters to this project and our direction will be dictated by where the majority of the survey votes want us to go. So yes, we will consider your suggestions, and you may get to vote on who, where and how we loan or donate our monies throughout the project.

story:
Summary

As you may know, we currently have two birds that are transmitting data to achieve two objectives: connect their phenotype and genotype to a breeding location and resolve the status of polymorphism in the subspecies abieticola. At this point we need to get many more transmitters out, because two birds is not enough to understand to what population these types belong. We also want to add more birds carrying transmitters as a strategy for obtaining breeding locations for population genomics work, while developing a growing dataset to answer questions including, but not limited to, the timing of movements, differential movements between and within populations, and to better understand plumage type as an indicator of geographic origin.

We need your help to do this! Our strategy is costly, because it requires a great deal of money and time on our part. Despite these costs, this strategy is the most efficient and effective method for achieving our research goals, because by approaching the sampling with transmitters we will avoid the challenge of international permitting, and the cost of travel to difficult areas to access such as the remote forests of boreal Canada. In other words, by tackling this research in this way, we will save both time and money!

The Plan

We plan to begin an ambitious effort for deploying transmitters starting this coming winter. Below is a detail of our plan, and how the money contributed by you will make this happen:

  • We plan to use the money from this campaign to purchase at least 10 tracking units to deploy this coming winter in the northeastern U.S., and the Great Plains. Even if COVID 19 limits this effort, we will be able to at least deploy units in New York and Kansas. 
  • We will make the money you contribute go the farthest it can. To do this, we will target wintering subspecies that breed in regions that are logistically difficult and expensive to access, such as Boreal Canada and Alaska. These include B. j. harlani, abieticola, and a dark non-harlani (potentially abieticola) type that winters in the Great Plains, and on occasion parts of the east.
  • If we deploy these ten units this year, and obtain photographs and blood samples from each bird, we will have a solid start to the sampling for the evolutionary research, as well as for building an extensive dataset of full cycle movements for these enigmatic subspecies. 

What We Need & What You Get

To get the sampling started to achieve all of our research objectives, we need to purchase transmitters. Below is a summary of how much these transmitters cost, and how the money you contribute will be applied.

  • Cost of transmitters -  One unit =  $790 ($500 per unit, plus $100 for insurance, $120 for yearly data fees, and $70 for shipping from the company in Europe). We would very much like to deploy at least ten of these units this winter, so we hope to raise as much as $10,000! 
  • A contribution from you is not just generosity. There is a perk! You can choose to make a contribution of any amount here on this site, or you can choose support levels that include perks the following perks: $20 - Red-tailed Hawk Stickers; $30 - Dark Morph Red-tailed Hawk Tee; $60 - a limited archival giclee print of a Western Red-tailed Hawk plate, illustrated by Bryce W. Robinson; and for $100 you receive all three! To claim these perks, go to https://ornithologi.bigcartel.com/category/the-...
  • We'll regularly post updates on the birds that are carrying transmitters purchased by this campaign. These updates will be on the project website, as well as our Facebook page. If you choose to contribute, please let us know where you heard about the campaign so that we can be sure you will see these updates.

The Impact

We are creating a research program that will grow, enabling an increased understanding of this widespread and beloved species. But the data we gather from our effort will also go beyond understanding the Red-tailed Hawk alone. Here are a few examples of the impact we think our program will have:

  • At the most fundamental level, our work will provide insight into Red-tailed Hawk subspecies that have been an enigma for so long. By attaching genetic samples to the breeding locations we obtain with the transmitters, we will be able to put genetic context to subspecies concepts, which might help us understand why harlani appears to be so different, and if subspecies such as abieticola truly are a distinct population.
  • Our work will also help us understand the evolutionary history of this species, which will be extremely informative for understanding the diversity we see in the species today, as well as providing yet another perspective on how geologic history can shape the development of species.
  • Connecting year round movement patterns to plumage and genetics will strengthen our ability to monitor Red-tailed Hawks, and enact conservation efforts if these are ever necessary. Even more, by doing so in Red-tailed Hawks, we can continue to refine this technique for use in other species. 
  • We also hope that by crowdfunding for transmitters, we can involve the community in this research, and expand our collective understanding of this well known and beloved raptor. Through this, we also hope that anyone involved will gain a greater understanding and appreciation for how this type of research is conducted. 

Risks & Challenges

Transmitters can fail, birds can die for many reasons, natural and human caused. It is possible that some of the transmitters we deploy will not provide movement data, or a breeding location. But, we have a plan in case this happens!

  • We plan to purchase insurance on the transmitters, so that in the event that a unit stops working for any reason, they will be replaced and we can try again. 
  • If a bird dies, we can follow the signal of the unit to its location and assess the cause of death. Many studies use this technique to track hawks, and birds alike. Deaths from transmitters are extremely rare, so the likelihood of the transmitter harming a bird is very small. But birds still die from natural causes, or they get shot, hit by a car, or a wind turbine. We'll know if this happens, and we'll learn a lot if it does.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you may have a keen interest in this work, but can't donate any money. Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Regardless of whether or not you contribute money, please follow us on Facebook, and share the project with your friends. Please encourage others to follow along, and to help us out!
  • Make sure to visit our website, and follow along on our progress on the blog. We'll post regular updates there, as well as discussions on subspecies identification, and more.

Thank you so much for your help! We're excited to have you along!

story:
We are a new biodiesel start-up..  We've been operating for 2 years on our personal investment, but now we need some help, and by helping us you help reduce CO2 emissions more directly than anything else you can do!

We are hoping to raise $5000 to put towards an upgrade to our biodiesel processor which will allow us to double our output and put us on-track to be able to pay a salary in the future. We have been working very hard at what has turned out to be a labour intensive and difficult job but one that we believe has immense positive environmental impact.

We hope that there are enough true environmentalists out there who are willing to contribute $1 to our efforts to make things successful.  We do not want any individual to contribute more than $5. Your pledge is refunded if we do not make our entire $5000 goal. We really want to see that at least 5000 people care enough to put $1 into our efforts.

Please consider putting $1 into the campaign.  We really need to know people care about fuel prices, fuel supply, and the ethics around sustainable fuel sources.

story:
Project location

 

Peristera is a tiny village of around 25 residents and it is located in the northern part of rural Greece in Kozani province (https://goo.gl/maps/pt5UwqeoXWJadAQT9). Peristera is built on 712 meters and combined with the geographical relief of the area forms the appropriate conditions for walnut and chestnut cultivation. At the moment the main focus of locals is on cereal and medicinal or aromatic herb cultivation.

 

Our vision

 

The main goal is to create a walnut orchard on our privately owned land, where there is enough space for maximum 600 trees. The plan is to purchase 3 year old plants, while the production of nuts starts when the plant is 7 years old. Your contribution will help us finance our project for the first years when the revenue will be almost zero. With your help we will be able to buy the plants and implement improvements  on our land, which will enhance the productivity and decrease the chances of underachievement. Furthermore, Research and Development on production(quality, quantity) and on potential future markets is essential to go one step forward

 

Here’s a break-down of what the funding will go toward: 

 

For the first couple years of production the main source of income will be the raw nut. This will help finance our future projects which is the extraction of walnut oil. This  is  used as aroma and flavor compound in cold dishes, while it is also used in beauty products. Last but not least, studies showed that herbal tea from the walnut tree leaves is beneficial for diabetics.

 

Nutritional value

 

Walnuts are thought to be unique among fruits and vegetable foods as they have strong antioxidant capacity.  Recent research has proved that walnuts have high nutritional value and can be part of a balanced diet, as long as the daily income does not exceed 30-60 g. It’s a food which is rich in fiber (2g./30g.), metals (magnesium, phosphorus, potassium, calcium, copper) and vitamins, as shown in the chart below.

Vitamins

Amount (%)

Vitamin A equiv.

1 μg (0%)

Beta-carotene

12 μg (0%)

lutein zeaxanthin

9 μg (0%)

Vitamin A

20 IU

Thiamine (B1)

0.341 mg (30%)

Riboflavin (B2)

0.15 mg (13%)

Niacin (B3)

1.125 mg (8%)

Pantothenic acid (B5)

0.570 mg (11%)

Vitamin B6

0.537 mg (41%)

Folate (B9)

98 μg (25%)

Vitamin B

120 μg (0%)

Vitamin C

1.3 mg (2%)

Vitamin D

0 μg (0%)

Vitamin D

0 IU (0%)

Vitamin E

0.7 mg (5%)

Vitamin K

2.7 μg (3%)

 

Legend: μg = micrograms; mg = milligrams; IU = International units. Percentages are roughly approximated using US recommendations for adults (Source: USDA Nutrient Database). 

 

How do we consume walnuts?

 

A walnut can be consumed with several ways, as raw, with no processing, roasted and salted. It can be used as well in cooking and pastry. Another use is in pharmaceutical industry and in production of walnut oil.

 

Health benefits

 

Daily consumption of walnuts can reduce the chances of cardiovascular diseases, certain types of cancer, diabetes type 2 and various health problems. Recent studies showed that walnuts decrease the risk of a heart attack. Walnuts consist of rich source of natural substances with antioxidant capacity as melatonin, oleic acid, vitamin Ε, carotenoids and polyphenols. All the above components show protective action against cancer, aging, occurrence of inflammation and mental disorders.

 

Trees as a strong shield against climate change!

 

New studies showed that if we plant a trillion trees along the whole world, the amount of carbon dioxide on the atmosphere will decrease dramatically due to their ability to convert CO2 into O2. This is the simplest, most enviromental and cost efficient solution, as scientists claim nowadays, for the confrontation of the climate change phenomenon.

The benefits from the cultivation of walnuts are many more. The growth of agricultural production contributes to the confrontation of the climate change, which is our main and biggest priority. In mountainous and semi-mountainous areas of Greece tree planting could be planned with walnut and chestnut cultivations, offering farmers an additional income, and at the same time raising the level of the atmosphere’s oxygen and decreasing also the air pollution. Moreover, the fact previous mentioned will contribute to the control of the environment’s temperature, avoiding as a result high temperatures. Pointing to that direction we commit in planting indigenous trees in the area of village Peristera, like walnut tree, so as to be created forests in areas that have been degraded soils or have been poor vegetation. 

 

THREE GOOD REASONS TO INVEST TO OUR  PROJECT

 

  • Creation of organic walnut orchard
  • One step against climate change
  • Supporting the local community

 

Please share this page with your followers to help us reach our goal

story:
Our Story

Real Aware began life as a graduate level creative design course project at Carnegie Mellon University. The idea was to take a social issue and apply a thorough design methodology that would enable some form of active change. Currently the team is made up of Brad Roth and Bill Liu, ‘12 MHCI, but is looking to expand as the initiative gets underway.

Why and How

Real Aware is important to us, as we have see the vast quantities of food wasted every day. We know that it is sometimes difficult for businesses to partake in recycling initiatives. We also know that there are a handful of businesses in our local area that do so despite the issues they face.

We know that people want to support eco-conscious businesses, so we want to help these businesses. We hope that by making consumers more aware of the eco-friendly businesses around them, that these businesses will be rewarded with more support from their communities. This added support will hopefully make such a large impact that other businesses take notice and want the same benefits so they, too, sign up for recycling programs and adoption can grow organically.

What We Need

Besides your general support, we also need money. We cannot fund the initial phases of this project on our own. That is where you (hopefully) come in.

For now, our plan is to design a prototype website that can act as a proof of concept for the Real Aware initiative. A $5 donation will get a personalized thank you email from Bill and myself. We believe $2000 is all we need in order to make this project a reality. A $15 donation will get you a personalized thank you as well as a custom desktop and smartphone background of our sticker design. A mighty generous donation of $25 will get you all of the aforementioned perks as well as an actual copy of the sticker that Real Aware will use to display in certified restaurants.

Our Progress

The Real Aware team thanks everyone for the contributions! We have been making progress and wanted to show everyone what we have been working on.

Paper Prototype

In preparation of reaching our funding goal, we have begun designing the prototype website. We have mocked up some of the main pages to get an idea of what we will need to build. Here is a mock up of the main page:

Here we designed a page for individuals who come to the site and want to look up what restaurants in their area are Real Aware certified. The page will contain a Google Maps-like interface and results page so users can more easily use the service:

The last page we have mocked up is the page users would see after selecting a certified restaurant. The page will contain a small profile of the restaurant, relevant information like address and phone number, as well as a small space the restaurant can use as a sort of blog to keep people up to date on their green efforts:

We have also begun testing our proposed interface with users. Mind you, these have been very early tests of our earliest prototype. A photo of Bill conducting a testing session is seen here:


Medium Fidelity Prototype

As part of our ongoing design process, we have created two different versions of the prototype web site. Our iterative design process requires we receive feedback from potential users, such as yourself.

If you would be so kind, you can visit our survey here and tell us what you think of our designs. This way, we will be able to take your thoughts into account as we redesign and move into the next phases of the project.

If you'd rather just take a look at what we created, please follow the following two links to the different versions of our design prototypes:

Design 1

Design 2

Other Ways to Help

If you can’t make a monetary donation but still want to show your support, then please feel free to share this campaign with friends and family on your social networks of choice. Any help you can provide is much obliged and we cannot thank you enough, truly.

Special Thanks

Thank you so much for all of the support. This has been a wonderful learning experience and we couldn't have done it without you!

Real Aware Bill Liu and Brad Roth Carnegie Mellon University | Understanding the Creative Process | Professor Steven Dow

If you would be so kind, you can visit our survey here and tell us what you think of our designs. This way, we will be able to take your thoughts into account as we redesign and move into the next phases of the project.
If you'd rather just take a look at what we created, please follow the following two links to the different versions of our design prototypes:
Design 1
Design 2
Other Ways to Help


If you can’t make a monetary donation but still want to show your support, then please feel free to share this campaign with friends and family on your social networks of choice. Any help you can provide is much obliged and we cannot thank you enough, truly.
Special Thanks
Thank you so much for all of the support. This has been a wonderful learning experience and we couldn't have done it without you!
Real Aware Bill Liu and Brad Roth Carnegie Mellon University | Understanding the Creative Process | Professor Steven Dow

story:
Short Summary

We are 4 volunteers, we are biologist and diving instructors, and sea lovers. 

We live in Mahahual, Costa Maya, Mexico, where corals and reef are the center of sealife, and one of the most important part in the world for fish reproduction (plankton, whale sharks, tunas, snappers, eels...)

We are worried about the nature of this small fisherman town, they aren't helped by anyone

Seaweed, global warming, trash, tourists, fishermen, are slowly destroying corals,and fish number is reducing, so we are beginning this project for coral reproduction.

We found a quite lagoon, in front of an hotel that will help us, we have the permissions and the local people help, we make coral reproduce in the lagoon, and then transplant in the main reef, in places where corals are destroyed by men and natural events.

We need funds to build the structure to allow corals to reproducts themselfes, and to protect them from humans and eventual turists. Floating bowls, nets, non toxic materials for the garden...

If sometime you swim in the ocean, or felt the fresh salt water on your body, or saw the colors of the underwater sealife, you should help us, to give back to the sea something of what it gave to you.

If you can't help us to buy materials, you can enjoy our group, we go out everyday to clean corals from sand, and we fight with tourists to keep the gardens intacted!

story:
CanMan is a new sorting system that will change your understanding of the waste sorting.

CanMan acts like a boomerang: you take out your trash, but return back you money.

Due to that, CanMan solves some problems. The first – is the problem of pollution of the planet. The second is your problem – bills for garbage collection. 

Users of CanMan sort their trash and drop it to the CanMan. Than we come to collect their waste from CanMan. We take the sorted waste and get out it from user’s houses. We don’t deliver waste to the landfill, we deliver it to the recycling plants. Recycling plants pay us for delivered sorted waste as for the raw materials for manufacture. And now thrown out users sorted garbage return back them money, less the operating expenses.

 

Everyone wants to help solve the problem of the Earth pollution. One of the simplest way to help is to implement a waste sorting. Let’s save the planet by making waste sorting available for everyone.

As we see our waste can be useful for us. It can save so much energy that we need! And why else waste sorting is so important?

 

 

                                                                Improving of CanMan:

  1. We will add your name and your country to one of the Canman. It will look like a «Thanks …, from … for giving me a chance to collect your garbage».
  2. You personally choose a slogan that will motivate people to sort their garbage. We will add your slogan to your CanMan.
  3. You personally choose a logo that will motivate people to sort their garbage. We will add your logo to your CanMan.
  4. You will personally choose a coloring of your CanMan in your own way.
  5. You will personally choose the size and specification of your CanMan among the proposed versions.
  6. You choose a place where your CanMan will be situated among the proposed places.
  7. Our team will show you functioning of your Canman on video.                    

 

 

You are in good hands.

 

Q: Does CanMan working system or it is a concept?

A: It’s a concept that was tested in work in October 2016. The conducted test demonstrated a good results.

Q: When CanMan will function?

A: We will start to production of CanMans after the raise of campaign goal. Introducing of CanMan will take about 6 months.

Q: What does CanMan make different from other previous projects?

A: Our campaign starts in Odessa, Ukraine. On the one hand there are serious problems with waste in this country. On the other hand waste sorting still doesn’t implement in our country. It is allow us to become one of the first who implement it. Also the economic situation is difficult in Ukraine. And it gives an opportunity to interest people in sorting waste through earning them money for it.

Q: What is the role play 170 °C+ for CanMan?

A: 170 °C+ it is another our project that help CanMan to sell the collected plastic and bring money for people. They are two complementary projects that support each other.

Q: What if I know someone who can help?

A: Incredible! Please contact with us by @mail or Facebook.

 

The circumstance that may delay implementation of CanMan is the government’s permitting process. However, it is not an unsolvable problem. This obstacle will be solved easy by the help of lawyers.

If our campaign does not raise its goal, so all received funds will be spend on environmental measures. Information about using of fund can be given for every backers in response to their request.
