story:
Short Summary

We graduated high school in 2012 not yet positive about where our lives were heading. We couldn't afford college and we were not happy about where our lives were at. After some thought we both enlisted in the Marine Corps and were given a ship date in the delayed entry program. With the extra time on our hands we wanted to make a difference in not only our own lives but others too. We then decided to walk across America, as this had always been an interest of ours. This put us in a unique situation to help others through an organization. We immediately picked cancer as the cause because not only has it affected us greatly, but it affects everyone. It took hours of research to find which organization we wanted to use but we both agreed in the end that Livestrong was perfect. Livestrong does the things that other organizations forget about and they have the lowest percentage of funds going towards their administration. 

Everyday we walk 15 to 20 miles. We started in CT and we're making our way to Huntington Beach, CA. Right now we reside in Lafayette, IN making our way to Chicago. At night we knock on doors and ask people if we can set a tent up in their yard. Time to time we get a free motel room but we generally sleep in a tent. Along this trip we have met so many cancer survivors, mothers of children who have died of cancer and many people who know others who have suffered from cancer. These people have given us the motivation we need to make it when the days get hard. They have made us truly passionate about what we do. They have showed us that we are out there making a difference. We have both seen what cancer does to a person and how horrible it is, it's indescribable. 

By funding our trip you will not only help us make our way across the country but you will be helping many people struggling through cancer. As of right now we have enough money to make it through Illinois and Kansas. If we don't make our $1500 goal on Indiegogo then we won't get any of it. It's either 100% or nothing! Please help our cause!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $1500 to finish this trip. This money will be going towards essencials such as food and equipment we may need along the way. George got a cold a few days ago but because of our funds we had to push through it. It's important that in times where one of us is sick we are able to pause for a few days without the worry of money. 

As you know, if we do not reach our $1500 goal, we don't get any of it. This doesn't mean you don't get your money back! In this case, you will be 100% funded back in return. Also, if you look on the right side of this page you will see three perks. These perks you can get if you donate the required amount. The amounts are $100, $150, and $500. All of these perks will be very interesting to say the lease. 

 

If you are not able to donate but would still like to help, please follow us on Facebook and share our page with your friends. 

 

facebook.com/walkingforacure2013

@walkinforacure

story:
My Story

Hello, I'm Anna Johnson. I'm a 17 year old high school student.

Growing up on the DelMarVa peninsula I developed a great love of the ocean. Living at the beach was so much fun! In the summer I enjoyed swimming, kayaking, crabbing and sunbathing. During the Winter months it could get a little monotonous. 

My parents would take my brother and me to the local beaches to do a "trash hunt." We'd carry large trash bags and use a a long grabber tool. We would walk up the beaches and clear out all the garbage left behind. I was always so surprised at the amount of trash we would collect. We each would have full trash bags at the end of the day.

When I was older we moved to the DC metro area for my parents' work. I always wondered if anyone else was picking up the trash.

About the Charity

The goal of Crystal Clear Seas is to remove marine water detritus.

Crystal Clear Seas wants to educate on the devastating effects of plastic in our oceans. In addition to our messaging efforts, we will coordinate one nationwide beach cleanup per year. We intend on partnering with select communities throughout the US to keep our beaches free of garbage and debris. Shorelines and coastal areas are easy to access and getting the detritus before it has a chance to get into the ocean is paramount. Cleaning up near-shore and coastal regions is akin to turning off the faucet of human-made debris. We will continue outreach by developing Crystal Clear Seas ambassadors to help spread the word. As a stretch goal, for every town we partner with to clean their beach we aim to provide them with environmental technology to help extract plastic pollutants from their local waterways and oceans.

The Impact

Clean beaches = clean water = clean health

  • 91% of plastic is not recycled
  • It takes at least 450 years for a plastic bottle to biodegrade
  • Over one million single-use plastic bottles are purchased every minute
  • 1220 marine species are affected by plastic pollution

How will the Money from this Fundraiser be Used?

The registration process is complicated, rigorous, and if applications are not prepared with exact precision, they will be denied. Crystal Clear Seas will engage the service of a professional registration company who has a  100% success record.

Money generated by this fundraiser will be applied to registration fees and expenses associated with obtaining IRS 501 (c) (3), a critical designation that will enable Crystal Clear Seas to properly engage its philanthropic mission to help protect our beaches and oceans from garbage. In addition, the fees collected will allow us to apply for grants from private, state, national organizations as well as the largest charitable foundations. The real power of beach clean up comes from educating the public.

What We Need & What You Get

For donations of $45 or more you will receive a Crystal Clear Seas BPA-free water bottle. Ditch the single-use plastic bottle and get a reusable one!

Participate in beach cleanup (COVID-19 willing...) Fall of 2021. 

We can all minimize our plastic waste by:

  • Helping cleanup our beaches and shorelines
  • Minimize single-use water bottles

story:
The Change We Seek

I am a student who has always been fascinated by science. I have often wondered how we can use the inventions to change the lives of the ordinary poor people. In my summer holidays I visited a village, near my hometown in India where the residents had to use candles at night to save money. Electric bills were eating into their meager income to the point that they had to choose between spending for their children’s education or for electricity. Using my pocket money savings ($100), I decided to donate energy-efficient compact fluorescent light (CFL) bulbs to twelve households. It was particularly challenging as some families were concerned with adapting a new form of radiance; nonetheless after explaining it would be beneficial to their lives, they considered it. A month later, those twelve households told me their electric bills had dropped from $3.24 a month to $0.60—a significant saving if your monthly income is $10. Encouraged by the success, I plan to extend my small experiment to 1,000 poor families in the coming summer. Your contributions would help bring in light into their lives. Saving electricity not only makes economic sense but also helps avoid the need to build more power stations and reduce carbon emissions thus making our planet more green and livable. 

How We Affect the Change?

The money will be used to buy energy efficient compact fluorescent bulbs (CFLs), bulb holders, switches and wiring to get them fixed in poor village homes. I plan to buy 8 Watt and 14 Watt CFL bulbs which give the same light as 60 Watt to 100 Watt normal incandescent bulbs. The normal bulbs cost Indian rupees (INR) 12 or $0.25 each whereas CFLs cost INR 100-120 or $2-2.50 each. Although the conventional bulb is cheaper, it has a shorter life span of 1-2 months compared with the guaranteed life of 3-5 years for CFLs, making them very cost effective. However, the initial high cost of the CFLs deters the poor from buying these. Given the small energy consumption of CFLs, it can help people save 80% of their recurrent electricity costs.. Also, because of the high consumption of the conventional bulbs, many poor people are unable to afford electricity and live in darkness using candles for lighting their homes. Providing them energy efficient CFLs will help bring light into their lives. 

We owe this Change to your Generous Help

We plan to provide CFLs to about 1,000 families with poor living background free of cost (2-3 sockets per household). This will of course depend on the money collected. We will share the progress of our initiative with our contributors and have special perks for our supporters. If things go well and I have time, will also try to launch a small website or atleast a webpage. We believe that every penny counts and sincerely look forward to your contributions, however small they may be. We have special perks ranging from pictures of the people we help to the special caps and T-shirts. We have also initiated the “Edison Award” and “Green Ambassador Award” for the very special people that will help us to realize our dream of a “carbon free green world”. We look forward to your generous support.

The Change Benefits All of Us

According to a 2006 article published in fastcompany.com, if 110 million American households bought just one CFL and used it in place of an ordinary 60-watt bulb, "the energy saved would be enough to power a city of 1.5 million people. One bulb swapped out, enough electricity saved to power all the homes in Delaware and Rhode Island. In terms of oil not burned, or greenhouse gases not exhausted into the atmosphere, one bulb is equivalent to taking 1.3 million cars off the road". That's the law of large numbers--small action multiplied by large numbers. Making this happen will have a catalytic effect and help uplift the world's very poor, the world's almost "forgotten".

You Can Help Too

Some people just can’t contribute, we understand but that doesn’t mean that you can’t help! We hope you can share our campaign with friends and people that you know; your good wishes and blessings will help us succeed. Your gentle nudge may do the trick! Please do write to us, tweet us or follow us at the facebook. We owe this all to you!

story:
Story Behind the Polar4 Arctic Expedition

When I first visited the Arctic in March 2011, I was blown away by the overpowering beauty surrounding me in the rich landscape and clean nature. It was uncontaminated oasis amidst a world with so much pollution. I was there to film a documentary, and the more time I spent trying to capture the Arctic on film, the more I felt it begin capture and captivate me.

I returned several times to the Arctic over the following years for the purpose of filming, and with each journey I felt more and more certain that I need to do something to help preserve it. Although it is one of the most untouched places on Earth, and the negative effects of climate change are more measurable there than anywhere else. Funding for scientists to thoroughly research changes in land and animal life is insufficient.

I realized I needed to do something about it. Thus one day in March of 2014, the idea for Polar4 was born.

The purposes of the mission are discovery and preservation. To discover, we will bring international scientists to conduct experiments they would not otherwise be able to finance related to climate change, animals and nature. To discover we will also search for the remains of the airship Italia mission lost there in 1928. To preserve, we will bring global attention to the Arctic through video footage, celebrities and media coverage of the experiments and the search for the airship Italia, to inspire the rest of the world to take action.

If we do not act now, the average temperature of planet earth will raise by as much as 4° by the end of the century. Desertification, extreme heat waves, tropical storms and rising sea levels are just some of the catastrophic impacts, that will affect millions of lives and entire regions of the world.

This is why I am asking you as a contributors to help us research and draw awareness to this area, helping not just us, not just you and your family and friends, not just the animals alive now, but all future generations of human, plant and animal life.

The Arctic is a powerful place but it is not strong enough to survive climate change and pollution on its own. The way things are going and the way that it is melting, the Arctic that I first encountered back in March of 2011 will exist for future generations only in old photos, videos and memories of those lucky enough to have seen it.

Mission Details

The voyage will begin in August 2017 in Tromsø, as 30 scientists and crew members board 4 sailboats and begin a 4 week journey. Each boat will have a different focus - one will focus on science, conducting 16 experiments, another on Arctic ice mapping, another on media and celebrities to bring attention to the cause, and still another on finding the airship Italia, lost in 1928. Because it will be Arctic summertime, we will have 24/7 sunlight to ensure we able to accomplish as much possible during the trip. As the Captain of the mission, I will decide when and in what order we do each experiment depending on water and weather conditions.

Reasons and Ways to Contribute

We ask contributors to help us preserve the Arctic. We are doing this for you and we cannot do it without you. Our goal is to get 85.000 EUR of crowdsourced funding. This is the last 20% of the total budget of the expedition. But we need it and therefore ask for your support and give you great perks in return. If you contribute to our mission, you will be contributing to a planet with healthier air and water for generations and generations to come.

Your contribution will be used in one of the following ways:

  • To help fund the 16 scientific experiments the scientists will perform, only with the full budget we can perform the 16 experiments as we planned.
  • To help support the expedition costs, rental materials and post-research and outreach after the expedition.

How this will benefit you:

  • It will benefit the health of the whole planet and this includes you and your family
  • You can contribute to something incredibly important to help save future lives
  • All the animals who live healthier longer lives in the Arctic would thank you if they could!


Our Impact is Your Impact

The success of the scientific experiments, of the search for the lost airship Italia and of generating worldwide media coverage for the mission depends not just on me and the scientists and the crew on the boats during the mission, but on all of the people who contribute their energy and money to help us get there in the first place.

The more attention we draw to the Arctic, the more we can ensure funding for scientific missions and for campaigns for preservation in the future. Every person who donates becomes a part of the mission as well as a part of the legacy of any success we achieve. Just as a team of us will take this journey to the Arctic, an even bigger and equally important team of us will help us achieve the means to get there.

Risks and Challenges

The Arctic Ocean combines freezing temperatures with volatile and unpredictable weather, meaning we will be at risk during the mission to severe and possibly life-threatening conditions. In addition, while on land, we will be surrounded by polar bears who do at times attack humans.

The crew and scientists will undergo rigorous survival and disaster training before the journey even begins, to ensure that we are prepared for every worst-case scenario. Each person on board will be aware of all emergency plans and trained in life-saving procedures should any kind of disaster strike. In addition, we will be in contact with emergency helicopter services in case of any medical emergency to ensure efficient and optimal care.
story_txt:
Story Behind the Polar4 Arctic Expedition
When I first visited the Arctic in March 2011, I was blown away by the overpowering beauty surrounding me in the rich landscape and clean nature. It was uncontaminated oasis amidst a world with so much pollution. I was there to film a documentary, and the more time I spent trying to capture the Arctic on film, the more I felt it begin capture and captivate me.

I returned several times to the Arctic over the following years for the purpose of filming, and with each journey I felt more and more certain that I need to do something to help preserve it. Although it is one of the most untouched places on Earth, and the negative effects of climate change are more measurable there than anywhere else. Funding for scientists to thoroughly research changes in land and animal life is insufficient.
I realized I needed to do something about it. Thus one day in March of 2014, the idea for Polar4 was born.
The purposes of the mission are discovery and preservation. To discover, we will bring international scientists to conduct experiments they would not otherwise be able to finance related to climate change, animals and nature. To discover we will also search for the remains of the airship Italia mission lost there in 1928. To preserve, we will bring global attention to the Arctic through video footage, celebrities and media coverage of the experiments and the search for the airship Italia, to inspire the rest of the world to take action.
If we do not act now, the average temperature of planet earth will raise by as much as 4° by the end of the century. Desertification, extreme heat waves, tropical storms and rising sea levels are just some of the catastrophic impacts, that will affect millions of lives and entire regions of the world.

This is why I am asking you as a contributors to help us research and draw awareness to this area, helping not just us, not just you and your family and friends, not just the animals alive now, but all future generations of human, plant and animal life.
The Arctic is a powerful place but it is not strong enough to survive climate change and pollution on its own. The way things are going and the way that it is melting, the Arctic that I first encountered back in March of 2011 will exist for future generations only in old photos, videos and memories of those lucky enough to have seen it.

Mission Details
The voyage will begin in August 2017 in Tromsø, as 30 scientists and crew members board 4 sailboats and begin a 4 week journey. Each boat will have a different focus - one will focus on science, conducting 16 experiments, another on Arctic ice mapping, another on media and celebrities to bring attention to the cause, and still another on finding the airship Italia, lost in 1928. If you contribute to our mission, you will be contributing to a planet with healthier air and water for generations and generations to come.
Your contribution will be used in one of the following ways:

To help fund the 16 scientific experiments the scientists will perform, only with the full budget we can perform the 16 experiments as we planned.
To help support the expedition costs, rental materials and post-research and outreach after the expedition.

How this will benefit you:

It will benefit the health of the whole planet and this includes you and your family
You can contribute to something incredibly important to help save future lives
All the animals who live healthier longer lives in the Arctic would thank you if they could!


Our Impact is Your Impact
The success of the scientific experiments, of the search for the lost airship Italia and of generating worldwide media coverage for the mission depends not just on me and the scientists and the crew on the boats during the mission, but on all of the people who contribute their energy and money to help us get there in the first place.
The more attention we draw to the Arctic, the more we can ensure funding for scientific missions and for campaigns for preservation in the future. Every person who donates becomes a part of the mission as well as a part of the legacy of any success we achieve. Just as a team of us will take this journey to the Arctic, an even bigger and equally important team of us will help us achieve the means to get there.

Risks and Challenges
The Arctic Ocean combines freezing temperatures with volatile and unpredictable weather, meaning we will be at risk during the mission to severe and possibly life-threatening conditions. In addition, while on land, we will be surrounded by polar bears who do at times attack humans.
The crew and scientists will undergo rigorous survival and disaster training before the journey even begins, to ensure that we are prepared for every worst-case scenario. Each person on board will be aware of all emergency plans and trained in life-saving procedures should any kind of disaster strike. In addition, we will be in contact with emergency helicopter services in case of any medical emergency to ensure efficient and optimal care.

story:
What is it?

Qallariy (pronounced Qayarii) in Quechua means to start, to begin and definitely the present campaign is aimed to contribute to the opening of the first shop in Peru without disposable packaging.    We want to eliminate packaging not only by selling groceries in bulk, but also preparing fresh food using local supplies, handcrafting household products and promoting the use of recyclable containers for the purchase and storage at home.

Dry food such as grains, seeds, beans, nuts, coffee, beans, tea leaves will be sold in bulk from containers.  We will have an European mill to freshly grind quinoa and other cereals, and we will also have others grinders for coffee beans, cacao beans, Maras salt. Customers will be encouraged to bring their own containers, or purchase them from the store.

Most of our products will be sourced regionally or will be handcrafted in the workshop.  In fact, next to the store, we want to create a workshop in order to elaborate fresh and natural handmade food (bread, cakes & pies, fermented vegetables & drinks, vegan burgers, nut milks) and to achieve a low waste lifestyle (detergent & cleaning refills done with Effective Microrganisms, shampoos refills, soaps, notebooks with recycled papers).  You won’t find countless brands for each product because the one we handmade with the best local resources, is enough.

So you will find our Kombucha made with coca leaves; our gluten free bread freshly baked in the horno de barro we have at home; our vegetarian handmade hamburgers just prepared and freezed; our potatoes from the field around Cusco just cut and freezed to you quickly prepare your French fries; our freshly milled local quinoa flour or flakes; our raw chocolate with the best cacao beans of the Cusco Region; our vegan soaps with fresh Peruvian fruits, vegetables and spices you can use also as bar shampoo; our natural liquid shampoo in refill; our eco-friendly laudry soap done with Effective Microrganisms; our notebooks and Midoris handsew with recycled papersour handmade bags and towels to go zero waste.  And  few imported products, as water purification systems, wooden dish brushes, bento boxes, stainless bottles.  In the rewards section, you have a first example of what we will sell in the shop.

We will put the pictures and the names of the people who are growing the food you eat, and the pictures of the fields where your potatoes, oranges, lemons, bananas, quinoa, quiwicha, are cultivated.

We will use also the sistem of bartrer, a traditional system here in the Cusco Region, with local producers.  We will prefer to buy quinoa, quiwicha, beans, etc. from small local producers we know how they cultivate their lands.

 

The impact

To act locally, as here in Peru, we need the economical support of those who are thinking globally, as YOU !!  As made clear by the climatic change, no country can remain immune from the impacts of global threats, so we have to work together to mitigate it.

All around the world people make use of plastic, not because of an individual election, but because nowadays everything is covered with plastic.  We want to follow the revolution that is happening all around the world,  where packaging free shops, supermarkets, restaurants are opening.  Sometimes the packaging hides the real value of the products tricking the buyer to purchase unhealthy food.  In our shop you will see how our food or products are prepared because the workshop will have large windows all around and each product wiil be labelled with its ingredientes.

In the workshop will work Peruvian women 6 hours per day, 5 days per week, with a contract and a fair salary.  We want to allow women to be independent in their family environment and to have time to live their lives apart from their work.

The shop will cater to Peruvians, foreign residents and tourists.  We want not only to offer a zero waste alternative to who is already motivated but also to educate people to select packaging free products.  For budget-minded shoppers, we’ll have not only organic, but also conventional products to offer.  Everyone should be able to afford to help the environment in the way they can.

 

About us

We’re a Peruvian couple living in Cusco (Peru) engaged in promoting a sustainable happiness for our society.  To be coherent with this effort, we want to open the first packaging free and handcrafted products shop of Peru and South America.

As an environmental engineer with several years of managerial experience in different countries of the world, and a philosopher, photographer and designer we have the knowledge to implement the shop.  And most important, we feel passionate about this project.
 

What We Need & What You Get

Opening a shop needs a big investment. Money is needed for renovation, furnishing and to buy the first round of products to stock the shop. And there are operating costs like rent and salaries for employees.

In the end of January 2019 we will apply to a fund for start-ups, financed by the Peruvian Government, in order to develop and validate our business model, to finance the legal creation of our company and the promotion through innovative marketing forms.  At the beginnig we are willing to work for free in the shop to save money to invest in this project.

With the funds we are requesting to you, we want to pay the first 6 months of rent for a shop in Cusco (in San Blas neighborhood, if you know Cusco, the most picturesque part of the town), to buy stainless-steel containers for products in bulk, glass containers for any kind of liquid (from kombucha to shampoos and detergents), to build wood structures to host the containers, to equip the workshop for the homemade production of food and drinks, to buy a Jumbo KoMo Mill to elaborate flours and flakes from organic Andean cereals, to buy the first round of groceries to sell and raw materials to be processed. 

We want to open by May-June 2019.

Of course we have rewards!! Each reward will be handmade in our workshop with local resources, it’s an unique design, and we are sure you will love it. We know that not everyone lives in Peru that would like to show support so we are more than happy to send you something via air mail or by email if you select this option when available.

If we don't reach our goal, we are still going to use every cent towards our shop simply changing its size and adapting this to the funds we will be able to collect. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you are in a moment that you haven’t extra cash, but even in this case, you can help us so much !!! the most important thing is that you love our project.

Please share our project using the Indiegogo sharing tools, with as many people as you can. Post it to facebook, tweet about it, tell people in real life!

We are looking forward to seeing you in the shop !!!

story:
I have this crazy idea that saving this World is much simpler then we make it out to be. In my mind, it is possible. There are 2 problems we face in 2013, Climate Change and Hunger (I don't think either needs further explanations), these can be curbed with one solution, WE CAN solve these 2 major issues of our Planet Earth. What is the solution? Trees! Fruit Trees to be exact!

Fruit = food Trees = carbon absorbtion

Simple, hey?

Thus, my goal is to buy land and plant thousands of fruit trees. Thus, my goal is to BUY LAND AND PLANT THOUSANDS OF FRUIT TREES.

 

 

     In the normal run of things, we give our money to a charity, they buy food, give out food, the food is finished, charity needs more donations.

With my extraordinary way of things, we ask to be funded, we plant fruit trees, the TREES give give give food for hundreds of years, we do not need more donations. It is sustainable.

I live in South Africa, land here is furtile and trees grow easily, yet so many go hungry.

I know what you are thinking, one fruit farm will not save everyone but my plan is to offer hiking, camping, picknicking and other paid for activities on the land. This income will be used for buying more land in other areas, planting more and more and more fruit trees!!!!!!!!! It is exciting and just imagine how much good we can achieve with such a crazy idea!

Just think of the Carbon emissions being sucked up.... The people being feed in a sustainable way.... This is one dream that keeps on giving!

About myself, I grew up on farms around the Eastern Cape, South Africa, I guess that made me accustomed to nature as climbing trees, growing veggies and looking for snakes were my childhood hobbies. To be perfectly honest, I still do the first two but since I now live in town there are no snakes to find except in mens trousers! I feel in harmony with nature, at one with the trees, they bring me joy (and oxygen). I've always been environmentally conscience, keen on greening the World and I have also always been exposed to poverty having lived in Africa my entire life.

I plan on planting the trees myself, with anyone else willing to dig a few holes(volunteers welcome). Imagine 40 000 trees... the food given, the  oxygen given, the carbon reduced.... It is sustainable...year after year.... 40 000 trees at least... That's A lot of food!

I am not a fancy scientist, I don't know the Latin names of trees but what I do know, is what trees can do for us. I know that technology will not save us, it only destroys. Going back to nature is our only choice.

...So people of the World, WE can solve 2 major issues (Hunger and Climate Change) with one solution (fruit trees!)

Will you join me in this crazy dream?

story:
Somos una institución sin ánimo de lucro interesada e compara grades exteriores de bosques primarios  en áreas de costa rica con la visión de protegerlas e identificarlas como zonas de reserva  de fauna y vegetación,

Con su ayuda compraremos  territorios extensos dedicados a la protección y control de bosques primarios, que son los responsables de conservar los recursos naturales, y proveer de oxígeno y agua a la tierra, conservar el pulmón de la tierra y desarrollar e implementar acciones de reforestación e dichas zonas.

Actualmente planeamos reforestar más de 500 hectáreas de territorios deforestados por madereros y cazadores furtivos, nuestra meta inmediata es recuperar u azoa de más de 300 hectáreas en la zona de guápiles provincia de limón.

 

Para tal labor contamos con un equipo de profesionales en varios campos dentro de la industria  forestal con amplia experiencia y reconocimiento he dicho campo, lo que garantiza que todos los procesos sea desarrollados con una auditoria privada de alta calidad y exigencia técnica, lo que garantiza que se llegue al éxito y a las metas propuestos.

 

. Los recursos recaudados en esta campaña serán administrados por nuestra fundación Greenbio de costa rica, y se auditaran a través de entidades  privadas dedicadas a la supervisión de inversiones y donaciones.

story:
ENGLISH - ITALIANO - FRANCAIS

The Town of Panicale (in the province of Perugia, very close to Assisi in Umbria) has granted planning permission to transform Villa Missiano in a residential area, cutting down the ancient olive trees that surround it.

Villa Missiano is a historic building and has been recently renovated in its original style. The surrounding land is covered with olive trees and can produce about 10,000 litres of extra virgin olive oil (See Perk from €25). The building dates back to the nineteenth century and is built in a classic Umbrian style, with influences from nearby Tuscany. The villa also has six self-catering apartments and a swimming pool and can work as a farm (See other perks).

The owner lives in Brazil and is trying to sell this property because he is no longer interested in it. A construction company has come forward with an offer to purchase and has already obtained planning permission.

The builders’ plan is to build 12 single-family homes, which means inexorably cutting all the olive trees on the property.



WHO ARE WE?

We are local people, born and raised in this same area, among these trees. We decided to launch this campaign because we have always lived in this area, we care about its natural and historical value, and we want to fight for its preservation.

If we reached the goal of €15,000, we will be able to rent the land and the farm for 1 year. But we need this exact amount.



During the rental period we will:

a. manage the olive groves, and hire workers for the harvest of the olives and the production of quality extra virgin olive oil (for experts, it is the “Muraiolo” type);

b. manage the holiday farm during holiday periods

c. create an educational farm to teach people how to harvest olives, make olive oil and cook our traditional regional dishes (See Perk from €5).

d. create one or more campaigns to raise funds in order to purchase the property in 2014 (the owner would sell it for €1,000,000)

 

The funds raised by the sale of our olive oil will go towards the accomplishment of this ambitious project.

 

We understand that in this time of crisis it is not easy to donate money. In this case we ask you to put the link to our campaign: www.indiegogo.com/savetheolives on your facebook page, twitter, website or anything that can get you in touch with many people, maybe attaching a photo from the online slideshow to your message.

 

ONE LAST APPEAL Letter from Cristiano

 

Dear friend,

My name is Cristiano. I was born in Umbria near these trees. As a child, I used to play in the fields with my friends, and on the way to school and back home I used to walk through the olive groves to pick wild flowers for my mother and my grandmother.

When I grew up, I left because I thought this place had nothing to offer me. I lived abroad, I worked in the world of tourism and now I have significant experience in this field.

 

One day, when I was back here to visit my parents, I realized that this place had endless potential but the concrete was destroying it. It is a resource that belongs to the whole humanity and not to particular individuals. So I decided to move back and stay.

Now I have a ten-month old daughter and I would like to bring some wild flowers also to her mother. In order to do so, I need your help to preserve this valuable area from destruction.

 

If you come to visit us (Perk for a weekend or for a week's holiday), I will welcome you, take to your accommodation and have the pleasure to show you the beauties of this wonderful place.

 

I thank you very much for your interest and look forward to welcoming you here in the Green Heart of Italy.

 

Cristiano

 

ITALIANO

 

Il Comune di Panicale (in provincia di Perugia, molto vicino ad Assisi in Umbria) ha concesso il permesso di pianificazione per trasformare Villa di Missiano in una zona residenziale, abbattendo gli ulivi centenari che la circondano

 

Villa di Missiano è un edificio storico ed è stato recentemente ristrutturato nel suo stile originale. Il terreno circostante è coperto di Ulivi e riesce a produrre circa 10.000 Lt di olio extravergine di oliva (vedi Perk da €25 Euro). La struttura risale al XIX secolo ed è costruita in stile umbro classico, con influenze della vicina Toscana. La villa dispone anche di sei appartamenti con angolo cottura e una piscina e potrebbe funzionare anche come agriturismo (Vedi altri Perk).

 

Il proprietario vive in Brasile e sta cercando di vendere questa proprietà, perché non è più interessato. Una società di costruzioni si è fatta avanti con un'offerta di acquisto e ha già ottenuto il permesso di pianificazione.

 

I costruttori hanno in programma di costruire 12 villette unifamiliari, inesorabilmente tagliando tutti gli alberi di ulivo della proprietà.

  

CHI SIAMO?

Persone del posto, nate e cresciute qui, in mezzo agli alberi e abbiamo deciso di lanciare questa campagna perché abbiamo sempre vissuto in questa zona, ci preoccupiamo per il suo valore naturale e storico e vogliamo combattere per la sua conservazione.

 

Se arrivassimo all'obbiettivo di €15.000 saremo in grado di affittare il terreno e l'agriturismo per 1 anno per questo scegliamo di arrivare ad un FIXED FOUND

 

Durante questo periodo ci impegniamo a:

 

a. gestire gli uliveti, assumere lavoratori per la raccolta delle olive e la produzione di qualità di olio extra vergine di oliva (per gli esperti tipo Muraiolo);

b. gestire l'agriturismo per le vacanze

c. creare una fattoria didattica per insegnare alle persone come raccogliere le olive, fare olio extravergine e cucinare i piatti tipici della nostra regione (Vedi Perk da €5). 

d. creare una o più campagne per raccogliere fondi al fine di acquistare la proprietà entro il 2014 (il proprietario lo venderebbe per €1.000.000)

 

I fondi raccolti dalla vendita dell'olio d'oliva ci permetteranno di arrivare a questo ambizioso progetto. 

 

Comprendiamo che in questo momento di crisi non è facile dare fondi, in questo caso ti chiediamo di inserire nella tua pagina facebook, twitter, sito web o qualsiasi altra cosa ci possa mettere in contatto con persone interessate il link della nostra campagna: www.indiegogo.com/savetheolives magari accompagnando il testo con la foto della presentazione.

 

ULTIMA PREGHIERA: Lettera di Cristiano

Cari Amici, 

mi chiamo Cristiano, sono nato in Umbria vicino a questi olivi. Da bambino giocavo nei campi con i miei amici, andavo a scuola e nel tornare a casa passavo per gli uliveti a raccogliere i fiori per mia madre e mia nonna.

 Da grande me ne sono andato perché pensavo che questo posto non avesse niente da offrirmi. Ho vissuto all'estero, ho lavorato nel mondo del turismo ed ora ho un'esperienza significativa nel settore.

Tornando a trovare i miei genitori un giorno, mi resi conto che questo posto aveva delle potenzialità infinite, ma la cementificazione lo stava distruggendo. È una risorsa dell'umanità, non di qualcuno in particolare. Così sono riamsto.

Ora ho una figlia di dieci mesi e mi piacerebbe che possa portare dei fiori di campo anche a sua madre, quindi, con il tuo aiuto, vorrei preservarlo dalla distruzione.

Se verrai a trovarci (Perk per un weekend o per una settimana di vacanze) sarò io ad accoglierti, a mostrarti il tuo alloggio e avrò il piacere di accompagnarti alla scoperta di questo meraviglioso posto.

Ti ringrazio molto per l'interesse e ti aspetto se vorrai venirci a trovare nel Cuore Verde d'Italia

 

Cristiano

 

FRANCAIS

 

Le village de Panicale (dans la province de Perugia, proche de Assisi en Umbria) a donné sa permission pour la transformation de la Villa Missiano en une zone résidentielle, ce qui implique la destruction des oliviers centenaires qui la bordent.

 

La Villa Missiano est une construction historique qui a été rénovée récemment dans son style d'origine. La propriété de la Villa est couverte d'oliviers pouvant produire 10,000 Litres d'huile d'olive vierge extra (voir les bénéfices à partir de 25€ de don). Son architecture se classe dans le style Umbrien classique à influences Toscanes et date du 19e siècle. La Villa possède 6 appartements indépendants ainsi qu'une piscine et peut être utilisée pour la production d'huile d'olive (voir les autres offres).

Le propriétaire qui vit actuellement au Brésil n'est plus intéressé par cette Villa, il souhaite donc la vendre. Un promoteur a proposé d'acheter la propriété et son projet a été accepté.

Le projet se compose de 12 maisons individuelles, ce qui implique la destruction de l'oliveraie.



QUI SOMMES-NOUS?

Nous sommes des habitants proches, qui sont nés et ont grandit parmi ces arbres, dans cette région. Nous avons décidé de lancer cette campagne parce que nous avons toujours vécus ici, cette Villa est une richesse historique et naturelle, et nous voulons nous battre pour la protéger.

Si nous parvenons à réunir 15 000€, nous serons en mesure de louer la propriété entière pour une année. Mais nous avons besoin de cette somme exacte pour mener à bien le projet.



Pendant l'année de location nous allons:

a.Gérer les oliveraies, embaucher des ouvriers pour la récolte des olives et la production d'huile d'olive vierge extra de qualité (pour les connaisseurs, il s'agit d'olives “Muraiolo”);

b.Gérer la Villa pour accueillir des visiteurs durant les périodes de vacances;

c.Mettre en place des formations sur la production des olives, la fabrication de l'huile d'olive et des cours de cuisine en relation avec nos plats typiques régionaux (voir les avantages des dons à partir de 5€);

d.Créer une ou plusieurs autres campagnes de collecte de fonds pour réunir l'argent nécessaire à l'achat de la propriété en 2014 (le propriétaire la vendrait pour une somme totale de 1 000 000€).

 

L'argent récolté par le biais de la production de l'huile sera entièrement consacré à ce projet ambitieux.

Nous savons que durant cette période de crise il n'est pas facile de faire des dons. Dans ce cas, nous vous demandons d'ajouter le lien de notre campagne: www.indiegogo.com/savetheolives à votre facebook, twitter, site internet ou quoi que ce soit qui permette d'informer le plus de monde possible, vous pouvez l'accompagner d'une photo de notre diaporama en ligne mis à votre disposition à l'adresse ci dessus.


DERNIER APPEL Lettre de Cristiano

Chers amis,

Je suis Cristiano. Je suis né en Ombrie près de ces arbres. Quand j’étais petit, je jouais dans les champs avec mes amis. Sur le chemin de l'école et quand je retournais à la maison, je passais au milieu de l'oliveraie pour cueillir des fleurs sauvages afin de les donner à ma mère et ma grand-mère.

Puis j'ai grandit, je suis partit car je pensais que cette région n'avait rien pour moi. J'ai vécu à l'étranger, j'ai travaillé dans le tourisme pendant plusieurs années. Maintenant je possède une expérience significative dans ce domaine.

Puis un jour, alors que je venais voir mes parents, j'ai réalisé que cette place avait un potentiel immense, malheureusement la situation actuelle n'utilise pas ce potentiel. C'est une richesse qui appartient à l'humanité entière, et non à quelques privilégiés. J'ai donc décidé de revenir et de rester.

J'ai à présent une fille âgée de 11 mois et j'aimerais qu'elle puisse apporter des fleurs sauvages à sa mère également. Pour ce faire, j'ai besoin de votre aide pour préserver cet endroit de la destruction.

Si vous venez nous visiter (don vous donnant droit à un week-end ou une semaine de vacances), je vous accueillerai, prendrai en charge votre hébergement et j'aurai le plaisir de vous montrer la beauté de cette place magnifique.

Je vous remercie beaucoup pour tout l'intérêt que vous portez à ce projet, et j'attends avec impatience pour vous souhaiter la bienvenue ici, dans le Cœur Verdoyant de l'Italie.

Cristiano
story_txt:
ENGLISH - ITALIANO - FRANCAIS
The Town of Panicale (in the province of Perugia, very close to Assisi in Umbria) has granted planning permission to transform Villa Missiano in a residential area, cutting down the ancient olive trees that surround it.
Villa Missiano is a historic building and has been recently renovated in its original style. The surrounding land is covered with olive trees and can produce about 10,000 litres of extra virgin olive oil (See Perk from €25). The building dates back to the nineteenth century and is built in a classic Umbrian style, with influences from nearby Tuscany. The villa also has six self-catering apartments and a swimming pool and can work as a farm (See other perks).
The owner lives in Brazil and is trying to sell this property because he is no longer interested in it. A construction company has come forward with an offer to purchase and has already obtained planning permission.
The builders’ plan is to build 12 single-family homes, which means inexorably cutting all the olive trees on the property.

WHO ARE WE?
We are local people, born and raised in this same area, among these trees. We decided to launch this campaign because we have always lived in this area, we care about its natural and historical value, and we want to fight for its preservation.
If we reached the goal of €15,000, we will be able to rent the land and the farm for 1 year. But we need this exact amount. 

During the rental period we will:
a. manage the olive groves, and hire workers for the harvest of the olives and the production of quality extra virgin olive oil (for experts, it is the “Muraiolo” type);
b. manage the holiday farm during holiday periods
c. create an educational farm to teach people how to harvest olives, make olive oil and cook our traditional regional dishes (See Perk from €5).
d. create one or more campaigns to raise funds in order to purchase the property in 2014 (the owner would sell it for €1,000,000)
 
The funds raised by the sale of our olive oil will go towards the accomplishment of this ambitious project.
 
We understand that in this time of crisis it is not easy to donate money. In this case we ask you to put the link to our campaign: www.indiegogo.com/savetheolives on your facebook page, twitter, website or anything that can get you in touch with many people, maybe attaching a photo from the online slideshow to your message.
 
ONE LAST APPEAL Letter from Cristiano
 
Dear friend,
My name is Cristiano. I was born in Umbria near these trees. As a child, I used to play in the fields with my friends, and on the way to school and back home I used to walk through the olive groves to pick wild flowers for my mother and my grandmother.
When I grew up, I left because I thought this place had nothing to offer me. I lived abroad, I worked in the world of tourism and now I have significant experience in this field.
 
 One day, when I was back here to visit my parents, I realized that this place had endless potential but the concrete was destroying it. It is a resource that belongs to the whole humanity and not to particular individuals. So I decided to move back and stay.
Now I have a ten-month old daughter and I would like to bring some wild flowers also to her mother. In order to do so, I need your help to preserve this valuable area from destruction.
 
If you come to visit us (Perk for a weekend or for a week's holiday), I will welcome you, take to your accommodation and have the pleasure to show you the beauties of this wonderful place.
 
I thank you very much for your interest and look forward to welcoming you here in the Green Heart of Italy.
 
Cristiano

b. gestire l'agriturismo per le vacanze
c. creare una fattoria didattica per insegnare alle persone come raccogliere le olive, fare olio extravergine e cucinare i piatti tipici della nostra regione (Vedi Perk da €5). 
d. creare una o più campagne per raccogliere fondi al fine di acquistare la proprietà entro il 2014 (il proprietario lo venderebbe per €1.000.000)

story:
If 150 folk put in £100, we'll buy a nice bit of land and plant it up with crunchy apples, succulent plums, and all the other trees that thrive and crop in the UK. You can be hands-on or hands-off; plant and prune your own trees, or just come by and collect the fruit once a year.  You'll be part of a community orchard where the community grows alongside the trees.

 

A community orchard in Ombersley, Worcestershire

The offer:

£150 for two trees of your own, or £100 for one tree, or £50 to be an honoured guest and fruit taster for life.

For your cash contribution, you'll buy into a little patch of permanence, a community, a festival, a pick-your-own and a holiday, all wrapped up in an ecologically valuable bit of tree planting and wildlife habitat creation. With lots of people involved, all choosing their own variety of apple, pear, plum, hazel nut, medlar, cherry, mulberry, quince or whatever, our orchard will be a treasure-trove of varieties. I also imagine we'll need a little hay-bale building to store our tools and a fire-pit to sit around.

So we need to raise £15,000. 

£10,000 to buy an acre of suitable land and the trees, plus a £5,000 contingency for site preparation and to ensure we stay on top of critical issues like fencing and grass cutting.

The offer again:

£150 for two trees of your own, £100 for one tree, £50 to be an honoured guest and fruit taster for life.

That's £100 from 150 people. Totally do-able right? Yes, if you sign up, like, NOW!

I'm Matt;

I'm involved with community gardens and orchards here in the UK, and I've planted fruit trees all over the world: apples in Scotland, pears in Wales, avocados in Australia - even the stinky durian in Malaysia. Those trees are still cropping, but on someone else's land - I don't get to pick the fruit! I want to create an orchard where my friends and I can hang out and return to year after year.

 

So what do you get?

The size of a fruit tree is determined by it's rootstock

 

Well, modern apple and cherry farmers might put more than a 1,000 trees on an acre of land, but let's plant the kind of trees that kids can climb.

That would be more like 250 x  MM106 Rootstock (largish) trees per acre. Which means everyone can have a good sized tree of their own. What a legacy for the kids!

We recently paid for pick-your-own cherries - £23 for a single basket of fruit. It was a joy to pick those plump shiny beauties, and they tasted good, but £23, seriously! 4 trips to a pick-your-own, or your own tree forever?

Lovely cherries that cost a fortune

What could go wrong?

Your tree could die. Pests could blight the leaves and fruits, and then the whole thing could be struck by lightning. You might lose interest and not visit your tree for years, decades. It would grown old without you. 

Whatever happens, the land remains, and trees can be replanted! Though pests and disease can be a problem, many hardy varieties soldier on unaided, year after year, producing delicious foodstuffs and creating a lovely environment (we've all seen venerable old apple trees, right?). Whatever happens, we'll deal with it, organically.

And if you fail to turn up for a decade, was it a waste of your £100? No! The tree is still there, the community is still there, the carbon has been sequestered and the environment has been improved.

Have tree. Visit country. Have fruit.

So please, join in, invest the cash and share this message.

All the best,

Matt@A fruit tree for everyone

story:
How do we do it?

By using Molten Salt Technology, a proven, working alternative to today’s nuclear energy, the Hyperion Clean Energy project has the potential to solve the looming energy crisis now, and make a huge impact on reducing the damage caused by climate change before it's too late!

It is enormously efficient, with a footprint per kilowatt hour dramatically lower than any form of energy that’s being used today and, best of all, it can be powered by stockpiles of today’s nuclear waste, helping to clean the planet.

Watch Bill Gates talk energy, climate change and the importance of the next generation of clean fission power!

 

Help us clean the planet while producing safe energy now!

 

Waiting for the government or anyone else to start taking action on this issue is not an option for the passionate team of experts behind the Hyperion Clean Energy project. The Hyperion team wants to make a meaningful impact on the increasing effects of climate change now, and get power into the hands of those that need it most before it’s too late. This project delivers on many levels at once: 

  • It creates big scale energy in a small package today. 
  • It’s based on long-term thinking with attainable short-term results. 
  • It works with a proven technology that allows for rapid deployment. 
  • It helps clean the planet and reduces waste by recycling nuclear waste for energy production. 
  • The excess heat generated can be used to help lower the cost of desalination operations. 

 

First step: Funding. Next: Save the planet.

Efficient, attainable, proven, safe, and clean: the kind of energy we need. 

 

 

Why hasn’t this been done before? 

 

Existing players in the industry have no incentive to adopt a new approach. They are entrenched in the current system: it pays very well and they are not agile enough to change direction. 

It also poses a real threat to established oil/gas/coal and conventional nuclear companies and there are very high barriers to entry. That’s where the Indiegogo campaign comes in. With the help of Indiegogo’s backer community, Hyperion’s team of experts - using proven technology with modern innovations - can continue working on bringing Molten Salt powered energy to those that need it, now. 

Hyperion's go-to market timeline versus that of our competitors.

 

Our Story.

We believe in pushing the boundaries of the possible: exploring the edge of human knowledge to see what's out there and taking that next great leap. We believe in open collaboration, the creation of a nexus of science, technology, engineering, mathematics, art and social impact for all.

Energy consumption is projected to rise by 48 percent by 2050. Current energy production models can’t meet this demand, are based on depleting resources with wasteful emissions, and come at a high cost. 

 

 

At Hyperion, we don't feel like it's only other people’s responsibility to solve problems that concern all of us. We also don't want to sit around waiting for the government or anyone else to start taking meaningful action because it will likely be too late. When our team got together, we were able to come up with a unique plan that addresses energy poverty on a large scale, so for us, that's worth putting ourselves out there. Ultimately, Hyperion was created through the right combination of people, for the right reasons, and strong determination to create real change.

 

 

Despite the rapid advancements by solar and wind over the past years, both still only make up a tiny percentage of the overall energy production. This won't be able to make up the difference in a meaningful timeframe. The world needs something more.

 

Consumption for Electricity Generation by Energy Source: 2015

 

With the success of this campaign, we can translate this initiative into an early-venture stage where there are significantly more dollars available to continue growing. The challenge we are faced with is that investments in software or healthcare happen early and often, but the clean-tech sector is still extremely limited until early venture stages, creating a massive barrier to entry and stifling innovation. Venture funding is simply not taking the same chances on major issues, like energy, as they are on other sectors.

That's why we're proud to unveil Hyperion Clean Energy here on Indiegogo. With your help we can make clean energy a reality within the near future: a clean, sustainable, and proven solution to solve the world’s energy concerns today.

Historical innovation at its best.

Luke Tucker, Founder and CEO of Hyperion Global Energy about his motivation.

 

Why did we choose flexible funding?

We recognize that we're pushing for something less tangible and less immediate, but it's something with a huge potential impact. Our goal is to activate global change toward more sustainable, affordable, and accessible energy production, which can help reduce the climate change impacts of other energy sources. Every single backer will make a difference in helping us pave the way towards cleaner energy for all. While making this a reality will require significant funding in the coming years, this campaign's success will catapult us into the next phase of development which opens up many doors to government grants and other larger funding sources:

 

Who are the people behind the idea?

 

Together, we started breaking things down and searching for ways to accelerate the move away from fossil fuels with the goal of preventing some of the worst effects of climate change that we’re going to experience over the next century. We came up with some interesting ideas, but to tell you the truth, there was no "eureka" moment. It was kind of just taking all these ideas back to first principles until one idea really stood out. That was our "hell, yes" moment, with one vision that just made so much sense.

Luke Tucker: Founder and Chief Executive Officer

Luke is a Senior Executive with over a decade of experience leading, training, staffing, and enabling large multinational teams within Canada’s Special Operations Forces (SOF).

He delivers complex multi-dimensional projects from concept to execution in often ambiguous and emerging situations - and is full-heartedly pouring his energy into Hyperion.

Richard Suchy: Chief Operations Officer

Richard is mechanical engineer by trade with over 30 years of experience managing the world’s largest energy projects. He is an expert in building, managing and leading the construction of energy projects of any size.

Dr. Leung Waihung: Chief Technology Officer

As a world-renowned nuclear engineer, Leung is Hyperion’s key nuclear engineering specialist, with over 20 years of experience in the nuclear industry focusing on advanced nuclear research and design. His knowledge plays a key role in developing the Hyperion Clean Energy solution.

John A. Thomas: Chief Strategy Officer

John is a highly experienced negotiator and business executive with decades of international experience. He has worked in a number of strategic roles in Europe, the Middle East and Asia with a unique set of skills and experiences, which makes him the perfect fit to guide Hyperion to success.

Mark Suchy: Business Development Officer

With over a decade championing heavy-weight international funding projects, Mark has extensive knowledge managing all aspects of investment transactions. He brings together major industry players and government officials, as well as manages local and foreign source assets and portfolios for disposition.

There are also several other key engineers involved in the project who support Hyperion behind the scenes every day.

story:
Short History of African Alternative Energy Solutions - AAES provides solutions, not just systems

I came to Uganda 6 years ago as a volunteer in a computer literacy project after 40 years as an entrepreneur, innovator and businessman in the computer field. I decided to stay and see what we could do to help alleviate the electricity problem.

Our first product was the Auto PowerStation which uses a vehicle normal driving to charge an inverter system for virtually free electricity, thus getting double utilization out of the fuel consumed. we know of no where in the world a similar system is commercially available. Because of customer requests we branched out into solar and inverter backup systems. In 2012, we developed the Universal PowerStation that can be charged from a car,the grid, solar or even a small motorcycle on a "plug and play" basis. More at www.powerstationafrica.com

At the same time we started looking at ways to lower the cost of solar systems for homes, schools and small businesses in remote areas for lighting and small appliances. We looked at the systems that were being imported and decided we could develop a better system and provide needed jobs here in Uganda making the systems.  Thus the PowerLight 12 volt LED lighting system was created, The beautiful lamps use only about 40% of CFL lights and will last for 50,000 hours or about 25 years. and are almost indestructible. This allows us to use smaller batteries and solar panels and thus lower the cost of a quality system, dramatically. The system has been enthusiastically received.

The PowerLight Mukene Fishing Project

There are 2 million families that rely on the fishing on Lake Victoria for their subsistence living. Virtually all the villages on the lake have no access to grid power and solar is the only logical source for electricity.

The Mukene (small silver fish) fishermen use kerosene lights to attract the fish into their nets at night. They spend $4 to $6 per night for fuel for the lanterns per night of fishing, putting a serious dent into their limited income.

When the fishermen saw our PowerLight lighting system they asked if it could be made waterproof and replace the kerosene lanterns. We put on our innovator hats and came up with a water proof system that only can replace the lanterns but also can be submerged, thus attracting more fish into their nets. The initial tests were 100% positive, but we need to do a full field test putting the system into the hands of a number of fishermen for a period of time before going into full production.

What we need and why we need it


We have set up a financing program for the PowerLight Systems with a micro finance company but they want us to get certification by the Ugandan National Bureau of Standards which will require the full field test.

The company, and its growth, up to this point has been primarily funded out of my retirement saving and small income and I am tapped out and profits are not yet great enough to take us to the next level. Considering everything, I feel we have accomplished a great deal with the limited resources we have had to work with and now we need some help.

Any and all funds raised will be used toward the costs of the field test, getting the certification of the system and setting up the manufacturing of the systems.

We have been assured that if we get through this next stage of development that there will be funding available for the next stage of the growth of AAES. However, as backup we are going to be offering shares to interested investors, once we get over this bump in the road.

The Impact

The Impact of your help will be huge.
  • This project has the promise of helping raise the income of hundreds or even thousands of fishermen and their families.
  • It will help provide needed electricity, lights, etc to a portion of the 85% of the population of Uganda that have no access to power at this time.
  • It will help provide needed jobs in the making, selling and supporting of the systems to under employed and unemploed Ugandans.
  • We have been asked to bring our products to several other developing countries and thus AAES can bring export earning to Uganda.
  • It will give you the satisfaction that you are helping make the world a little better place.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.
